title.en: PART 1 - Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases
title.fr: PART 1 - FR_Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases

title.en: - Coming into Force
title.fr: - FR_Coming into Force

title.en: 1.1 - These Regulations come into force 12 months after the day on which they are published in Part II of the Canada Gazette.
title.fr: 1.1 - FR_These Regulations come into force 12 months after the day on which they are published in Part II of the Canada Gazette.

title.en: - Repeal
title.fr: - FR_Repeal

title.en: 1.2 - On the day these Regulations come into force, the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations, as made by Order in Council P.C. 1985-147 dated January 17, 1985 and registered as SOR/85-77, are repealed.
title.fr: 1.2 - FR_On the day these Regulations come into force, the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations, as made by Order in Council P.C. 1985-147 dated January 17, 1985 and registered as SOR/85-77, are repealed.

title.en: - Interpretation
title.fr: - FR_Interpretation

title.en: 1.3 (2) - In these Regulations,
title.fr: 1.3 (2) - FR_In these Regulations,

title.en: 1.3 (2) (a) - “must” is imperative and “may” is permissive;
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (a) - FR_“must” is imperative and “may” is permissive;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (b) - the words “on”, “in” or “by” are synonymous when they are associated with the defined terms road vehicle, railway vehicle, vessel or aircraft;
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (b) - FR_the words “on”, “in” or “by” are synonymous when they are associated with the defined terms road vehicle, railway vehicle, vessel or aircraft;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (c) - pressure expressed in kPa is gauge pressure unless designated as absolute pressure, except for vapour pressure, which is always absolute pressure;
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (c) - FR_pressure expressed in kPa is gauge pressure unless designated as absolute pressure, except for vapour pressure, which is always absolute pressure;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (d) - shipping names listed in Schedule 1 may be
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (d) - FR_shipping names listed in Schedule 1 may be

title.en: 1.3 (2) (d) (i) - written in the singular or plural,
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (d) (i) - FR_written in the singular or plural,

title.en: 1.3 (2) (d) (ii) - written in upper or lower case letters, except that when the shipping name is followed by the descriptive text associated with the shipping name the descriptive text must be in lower case letters and the shipping name must be in upper case letters (capitals),
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (d) (ii) - FR_written in upper or lower case letters, except that when the shipping name is followed by the descriptive text associated with the shipping name the descriptive text must be in lower case letters and the shipping name must be in upper case letters (capitals),

title.en: 1.3 (2) (d) (iii) - in English only, put in a different word order as long as the full shipping name is used and the word order is a commonly used one,
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (d) (iii) - FR_in English only, put in a different word order as long as the full shipping name is used and the word order is a commonly used one,

title.en: 1.3 (2) (d) (iv) - for solutions and mixtures, followed by the word “SOLUTION” or “MIXTURE”, as appropriate, and may include the concentration of the solution or mixture, and
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (d) (iv) - FR_for solutions and mixtures, followed by the word “SOLUTION” or “MIXTURE”, as appropriate, and may include the concentration of the solution or mixture, and

title.en: 1.3 (2) (d) (v) - for waste, preceded or followed by the word “WASTE” or “DÉCHET”;
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (d) (v) - FR_for waste, preceded or followed by the word “WASTE” or “DÉCHET”;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (f) - when the word “placard” is used, it refers to a specific placard illustrated in the Appendix to Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), but when a placard is required or permitted to be displayed, the singular includes the plural and it means the appropriate number of that placard required by Part 4;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (g) - the word “or” is used in the inclusive sense unless the associated text clearly indicates otherwise;

title.fr: 1.3 (2) (h) (ii) - FR_a copy of the shipping document or document;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (i) - when it is necessary to convert between number of articles and net explosives quantity, one kilogram net explosives quantity must be counted as 100 articles and each 100 articles must be counted as one kilogram net explosives quantity;
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (i) - FR_when it is necessary to convert between number of articles and net explosives quantity, one kilogram net explosives quantity must be counted as 100 articles and each 100 articles must be counted as one kilogram net explosives quantity;

title.en: 1.3 (2) (j) - when dangerous goods are in a means of containment, it is the minimum required means of containment if
title.fr: 1.3 (2) (j) - FR_when dangerous goods are in a means of containment, it is the minimum required means of containment if

title.en: - General Provisions

title.en: - Applicability of the Regulations
title.fr: - FR_Applicability of the Regulations

title.en: 1.5 - Unless otherwise stated in sections 1.15 to 1.48 of this Part or in Schedule 1 or 2, dangerous goods must be handled, offered for transport or transported in accordance with these Regulations.
title.fr: 1.5 - FR_Unless otherwise stated in sections 1.15 to 1.48 of this Part or in Schedule 1 or 2, dangerous goods must be handled, offered for transport or transported in accordance with these Regulations.

title.en: - Schedule 2: Special Provisions
title.fr: - FR_Schedule 2: Special Provisions

title.en: 1.5.1 (1) - When there is a special provision in Schedule 2 for dangerous goods, that special provision applies.
title.fr: 1.5.1 (1) - FR_When there is a special provision in Schedule 2 for dangerous goods, that special provision applies.

title.en: 1.5.1 (2) - When there is a conflict between a special provision in Schedule 2 and other provisions in these Regulations, the special provision applies.
title.fr: 1.5.1 (2) - FR_When there is a conflict between a special provision in Schedule 2 and other provisions in these Regulations, the special provision applies.

title.en: 1.5.1 (3) - The UN numbers set out in italics after a special provision of Schedule 2 indicate the dangerous goods in respect of which the special provision applies. They are for information only and are not part of the Regulations.
title.fr: 1.5.1 (3) - FR_The UN numbers set out in italics after a special provision of Schedule 2 indicate the dangerous goods in respect of which the special provision applies. They are for information only and are not part of the Regulations.

title.en: - Schedules 1 and 3: Forbidden Dangerous Goods
title.fr: - FR_Schedules 1 and 3: Forbidden Dangerous Goods

title.en: 1.5.2 (1) - When the word “Forbidden” is shown for dangerous goods in column 3 of Schedule 1 or column 2 of Schedule 3, a person must not handle, offer for transport or transport the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 1.5.2 (1) - FR_When the word “Forbidden” is shown for dangerous goods in column 3 of Schedule 1 or column 2 of Schedule 3, a person must not handle, offer for transport or transport the dangerous goods.

title.en: 1.5.2 (2) - When the word “Forbidden” is shown for dangerous goods in column 8 or 9 of Schedule 1, a person must not offer for transport or transport the dangerous goods by the means of transport set out in the heading of that column.
title.fr: 1.5.2 (2) - FR_When the word “Forbidden” is shown for dangerous goods in column 8 or 9 of Schedule 1, a person must not offer for transport or transport the dangerous goods by the means of transport set out in the heading of that column.

title.en: - Schedule 1: Quantity Limits in Columns 8 and 9
title.fr: - FR_Schedule 1: Quantity Limits in Columns 8 and 9

title.en: 1.6 (1) - When there is a number shown in column 8 of Schedule 1, that number is a quantity limit per means of containment for the corresponding dangerous goods in column 2. A person must not load onto a passenger carrying vessel, or transport on a road vehicle or a railway vehicle on board a passenger carrying vessel, dangerous goods that exceed the quantity limit. Dangerous goods exceed the quantity limit if
title.fr: 1.6 (1) - FR_When there is a number shown in column 8 of Schedule 1, that number is a quantity limit per means of containment for the corresponding dangerous goods in column 2. A person must not load onto a passenger carrying vessel, or transport on a road vehicle or a railway vehicle on board a passenger carrying vessel, dangerous goods that exceed the quantity limit. Dangerous goods exceed the quantity limit if

title.en: 1.6 (1) (a) - in the case of a solid, they have a mass that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms;
title.fr: 1.6 (1) (a) - FR_in the case of a solid, they have a mass that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms;

title.en: 1.6 (1) (b) - in the case of a liquid, they have a volume that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres;
title.fr: 1.6 (1) (b) - FR_in the case of a liquid, they have a volume that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres;

title.en: 1.6 (1) (c) - in the case of a gas, including a gas in a liquefied form, they are contained in a means of containment the capacity of which is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres; and
title.fr: 1.6 (1) (c) - FR_in the case of a gas, including a gas in a liquefied form, they are contained in a means of containment the capacity of which is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres; and

title.en: 1.6 (1) (d) - in the case of an explosive
title.fr: 1.6 (1) (d) - FR_in the case of an explosive

title.en: 1.6 (1) (d) (i) - not subject to special provision 85 or 86, they have a net explosives quantity that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms, or
title.fr: 1.6 (1) (d) (i) - FR_not subject to special provision 85 or 86, they have a net explosives quantity that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms, or

title.en: 1.6 (1) (d) (ii) - subject to special provision 85 or 86, they exceed 100 articles.
title.fr: 1.6 (1) (d) (ii) - FR_subject to special provision 85 or 86, they exceed 100 articles.

title.en: 1.6 (2) - When there is a number shown in column 9 of Schedule 1, that number is a quantity limit per means of containment for the corresponding dangerous goods in column 2. A person must not offer for transport or transport by passenger carrying road vehicle or passenger carrying railway vehicle dangerous goods that exceed the quantity limit. Dangerous goods exceed the quantity limit if
title.fr: 1.6 (2) - FR_When there is a number shown in column 9 of Schedule 1, that number is a quantity limit per means of containment for the corresponding dangerous goods in column 2. A person must not offer for transport or transport by passenger carrying road vehicle or passenger carrying railway vehicle dangerous goods that exceed the quantity limit. Dangerous goods exceed the quantity limit if

title.en: 1.6 (2) (a) - in the case of a solid, they have a mass that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms;
title.fr: 1.6 (2) (a) - FR_in the case of a solid, they have a mass that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms;

title.en: 1.6 (2) (b) - in the case of a liquid, they have a volume that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres;
title.fr: 1.6 (2) (b) - FR_in the case of a liquid, they have a volume that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres;

title.en: 1.6 (2) (c) - in the case of a gas, including a gas in a liquefied form, they are contained in a means of containment the capacity of which is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres; and
title.fr: 1.6 (2) (c) - FR_in the case of a gas, including a gas in a liquefied form, they are contained in a means of containment the capacity of which is greater than the number when that number is expressed in litres; and

title.en: 1.6 (2) (d) - in the case of an explosive
title.fr: 1.6 (2) (d) - FR_in the case of an explosive

title.en: 1.6 (2) (d) (i) - not subject to special provision 85 or 86, they have a net explosives quantity that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms, or
title.fr: 1.6 (2) (d) (i) - FR_not subject to special provision 85 or 86, they have a net explosives quantity that is greater than the number when that number is expressed in kilograms, or

title.en: 1.6 (2) (d) (ii) - subject to special provision 85 or 86, they exceed 100 articles.
title.fr: 1.6 (2) (d) (ii) - FR_subject to special provision 85 or 86, they exceed 100 articles.

title.en: 1.6 (3) - If a quantity limit in column 8 or 9 of Schedule 1 conflicts with any other quantity limit in these Regulations, other than a quantity limit in special provisions, the quantity limit in that column takes precedence.
title.fr: 1.6 (3) - FR_If a quantity limit in column 8 or 9 of Schedule 1 conflicts with any other quantity limit in these Regulations, other than a quantity limit in special provisions, the quantity limit in that column takes precedence.

title.en: - Safety Requirements, Documents, Safety Marks
title.fr: - FR_Safety Requirements, Documents, Safety Marks

title.en: 1.7 - As provided for in section 5 of the Act, a person must not handle, offer for transport, transport or import dangerous goods unless
title.fr: 1.7 - FR_As provided for in section 5 of the Act, a person must not handle, offer for transport, transport or import dangerous goods unless

title.en: 1.7 (a) - the person complies with all applicable prescribed safety requirements;
title.fr: 1.7 (a) - FR_the person complies with all applicable prescribed safety requirements;

title.en: 1.7 (b) - the dangerous goods are accompanied by all applicable prescribed documents; and
title.fr: 1.7 (b) - FR_the dangerous goods are accompanied by all applicable prescribed documents; and

title.en: 1.7 (c) - the means of containment and transport comply with all applicable prescribed safety standards and display all applicable prescribed safety marks.
title.fr: 1.7 (c) - FR_the means of containment and transport comply with all applicable prescribed safety standards and display all applicable prescribed safety marks.

title.en: - Prohibition: Explosives
title.fr: - FR_Prohibition: Explosives

title.en: 1.8 - A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods by any means of transport if the dangerous goods are explosives and
title.fr: 1.8 - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods by any means of transport if the dangerous goods are explosives and

title.en: 1.8 (a) - are in direct contact with a large means of containment, except when the explosives are to be transported by road vehicle in quantities that are allowed for explosives in section 9.5, Part 9 (Road), in Schedule 1 or in any special provision in Schedule 2; or
title.fr: 1.8 (a) - FR_are in direct contact with a large means of containment, except when the explosives are to be transported by road vehicle in quantities that are allowed for explosives in section 9.5, Part 9 (Road), in Schedule 1 or in any special provision in Schedule 2; or

title.en: 1.8 (b) - are also radioactive materials.
title.fr: 1.8 (b) - FR_are also radioactive materials.

title.en: - Requirements Respecting the Transportation of Dangerous Goods on Board Passenger Carrying Vessels
title.fr: - FR_Requirements Respecting the Transportation of Dangerous Goods on Board Passenger Carrying Vessels

title.en: 1.10 (1) - The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods other than explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 25 passengers or more than one passenger for each 3 m of the length of the vessel.
title.fr: 1.10 (1) - FR_The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods other than explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 25 passengers or more than one passenger for each 3 m of the length of the vessel.

title.en: 1.10 (2) - The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods that are explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 12 passengers.
title.fr: 1.10 (2) - FR_The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods that are explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 12 passengers.

title.en: - Use of 49 CFR for Non-Regulated Dangerous Goods
title.fr: - FR_Use of 49 CFR for Non-Regulated Dangerous Goods

title.en: 1.11 - When a substance is regulated in the United States by 49 CFR but is not regulated in Canada by these Regulations, a person may transport the substance between Canada and the United States by road vehicle or railway vehicle in accordance with all or part of 49 CFR.
title.fr: 1.11 - FR_When a substance is regulated in the United States by 49 CFR but is not regulated in Canada by these Regulations, a person may transport the substance between Canada and the United States by road vehicle or railway vehicle in accordance with all or part of 49 CFR.

title.en: - Evidence: Safety Marks, Prescribed Documents
title.fr: - FR_Evidence: Safety Marks, Prescribed Documents

title.en: 1.12 - As provided for in section 42 of the Act, in any prosecution for an offence, evidence that a means of containment or transport bore a safety mark or was accompanied by a prescribed document is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the information shown or indicated by the safety mark or contained in the prescribed document.
title.fr: 1.12 - FR_As provided for in section 42 of the Act, in any prosecution for an offence, evidence that a means of containment or transport bore a safety mark or was accompanied by a prescribed document is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the information shown or indicated by the safety mark or contained in the prescribed document.

title.en: - Defence: Due Diligence
title.fr: - FR_Defence: Due Diligence

title.en: 1.13 - As provided for in section 40 of the Act, a person must not be found guilty of an offence if it is established that the person took all reasonable measures to comply with the Act or to prevent the commission of the offence.
title.fr: 1.13 - FR_As provided for in section 40 of the Act, a person must not be found guilty of an offence if it is established that the person took all reasonable measures to comply with the Act or to prevent the commission of the offence.

title.en: - Special Cases
title.fr: - FR_Special Cases

title.en: - 150 kg Gross Mass Exemption
title.fr: - FR_150 kg Gross Mass Exemption

title.en: 1.15 (1) - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of dangerous goods on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if
title.fr: 1.15 (1) - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of dangerous goods on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if

title.en: 1.15 (1) (a) - in the case of
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (a) - FR_in the case of

title.en: 1.15 (1) (a) (i) - dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, they are in one or more small means of containment in compliance with the requirements for transporting gases in Part 5 (Means of Containment), except that, in the case of dangerous goods that are UN1950, AEROSOLS, or UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES, the requirement in section 8.1.7 of CGSB-43.123 that aerosol containers and gas cartridges be tightly packed in a strong outer packaging does not apply, or
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (a) (i) - FR_dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, they are in one or more small means of containment in compliance with the requirements for transporting gases in Part 5 (Means of Containment), except that, in the case of dangerous goods that are UN1950, AEROSOLS, or UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES, the requirement in section 8.1.7 of CGSB-43.123 that aerosol containers and gas cartridges be tightly packed in a strong outer packaging does not apply, or

title.en: 1.15 (1) (a) (ii) - dangerous goods not included in Class 2, Gases, they are in one or more small means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_dangerous goods not included in Class 2, Gases, they are in one or more small means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;

title.en: 1.15 (1) (b) - except for dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, the dangerous goods are contained in one or more means of containment each of which has a gross mass less than or equal to 30 kg;
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (b) - FR_except for dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, the dangerous goods are contained in one or more means of containment each of which has a gross mass less than or equal to 30 kg;

title.en: 1.15 (1) (c) - the gross mass of all dangerous goods
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (c) - FR_the gross mass of all dangerous goods

title.en: 1.15 (1) (c) (i) - transported on the road vehicle or the railway vehicle is less than or equal to 150 kg, and
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (c) (i) - FR_transported on the road vehicle or the railway vehicle is less than or equal to 150 kg, and

title.en: 1.15 (1) (c) (ii) - transported on the vessel on a domestic voyage is less than or equal to 150 kg, excluding dangerous goods in a road vehicle or railway vehicle being transported on the vessel; and
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (c) (ii) - FR_transported on the vessel on a domestic voyage is less than or equal to 150 kg, excluding dangerous goods in a road vehicle or railway vehicle being transported on the vessel; and

title.en: 1.15 (1) (d) - the dangerous goods are in a quantity or concentration available to the general public and are transported
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (d) - FR_the dangerous goods are in a quantity or concentration available to the general public and are transported

title.en: 1.15 (1) (d) (i) - by a user or purchaser of the dangerous goods, or
title.fr: 1.15 (1) (d) (i) - FR_by a user or purchaser of the dangerous goods, or

title.fr: 1.15 (1) (d) (ii) - FR_by a retailer to or from a user or purchaser of the dangerous goods.

title.en: 1.17 (1) - A quantity of dangerous goods, other than explosives, is a limited quantity if
title.fr: 1.17 (1) - FR_A quantity of dangerous goods, other than explosives, is a limited quantity if

title.en: 1.17 (1) (a) - the dangerous goods are in one or more means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety; and
title.fr: 1.17 (1) (a) - FR_the dangerous goods are in one or more means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety; and

title.en: 1.17 (1) (b) - each outer means of containment has a gross mass that is less than or equal to 30 kg and the dangerous goods in the inner means of containment
title.fr: 1.17 (1) (b) - FR_each outer means of containment has a gross mass that is less than or equal to 30 kg and the dangerous goods in the inner means of containment

title.en: 1.17 (1) (b) (i) - if solids, have a mass that is less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1, when that number is expressed in kilograms,
title.fr: 1.17 (1) (b) (i) - FR_if solids, have a mass that is less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1, when that number is expressed in kilograms,

title.en: 1.17 (1) (b) (ii) - if liquids, have a volume that is less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1, when that number is expressed in litres, or
title.fr: 1.17 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_if liquids, have a volume that is less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1, when that number is expressed in litres, or

title.en: 1.17 (1) (b) (iii) - if gases, including a gas in a liquefied form, are contained in one or more means of containment each of which has a capacity less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1, when that number is expressed in litres.
title.fr: 1.17 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_if gases, including a gas in a liquefied form, are contained in one or more means of containment each of which has a capacity less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1, when that number is expressed in litres.

title.en: 1.17 (2) - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of limited quantities of dangerous goods on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if each means of containment is legibly and durably marked on one side, other than a side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport, with the mark illustrated in subsection (5).
title.fr: 1.17 (2) - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of limited quantities of dangerous goods on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if each means of containment is legibly and durably marked on one side, other than a side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport, with the mark illustrated in subsection (5).

title.en: 1.17 (3) - When a limited quantity of dangerous goods is in a means of containment that is inside another means of containment, the inner means of containment is not required to be marked if
title.fr: 1.17 (3) - FR_When a limited quantity of dangerous goods is in a means of containment that is inside another means of containment, the inner means of containment is not required to be marked if

title.en: 1.17 (3) (a) - the gross mass of the outer means of containment is less than or equal to 30 kg;
title.fr: 1.17 (3) (a) - FR_the gross mass of the outer means of containment is less than or equal to 30 kg;

title.en: 1.17 (3) (b) - the outer means of containment is not intended to be opened during transport; and
title.fr: 1.17 (3) (b) - FR_the outer means of containment is not intended to be opened during transport; and

title.en: 1.17 (3) (c) - the outer means of containment is legibly and visibly marked, on a contrasting background, with the mark illustrated in subsection (5).
title.fr: 1.17 (3) (c) - FR_the outer means of containment is legibly and visibly marked, on a contrasting background, with the mark illustrated in subsection (5).

title.en: 1.17 (4) - When a limited quantity of dangerous goods is in a means of containment that is inside an overpack, the following information must be displayed on the overpack unless the marks on the small means of containment are visible through the overpack:
title.fr: 1.17 (4) - FR_When a limited quantity of dangerous goods is in a means of containment that is inside an overpack, the following information must be displayed on the overpack unless the marks on the small means of containment are visible through the overpack:

title.en: 1.17 (4) (a) - the word “Overpack” or “Suremballage” or ; and
title.fr: 1.17 (4) (a) - FR_the word “Overpack” or “Suremballage” or ; and

title.en: 1.17 (4) (b) - the mark illustrated in subsection (5), legibly and visibly marked on a contrasting background.
title.fr: 1.17 (4) (b) - FR_the mark illustrated in subsection (5), legibly and visibly marked on a contrasting background.

title.en: 1.17 (5) - The mark is a square on point, and the line forming the square on point must be at least 2 mm wide. The top and bottom portions must be black and the central portion must be white or a contrasting colour. Each side of the mark must be at least 100 mm long. The letter “Y” may be displayed in the centre of the mark if the limited quantity is in compliance with the ICAO Technical Instructions. If the size of the means of containment so requires, the length of each side may be reduced to not less than 50 mm, provided that the mark remains clearly visible.
title.fr: 1.17 (5) - FR_The mark is a square on point, and the line forming the square on point must be at least 2 mm wide. The top and bottom portions must be black and the central portion must be white or a contrasting colour. Each side of the mark must be at least 100 mm long. The letter “Y” may be displayed in the centre of the mark if the limited quantity is in compliance with the ICAO Technical Instructions. If the size of the means of containment so requires, the length of each side may be reduced to not less than 50 mm, provided that the mark remains clearly visible.

title.en: 1.17 (6) - Until December 31, 2020, instead of being marked with the mark illustrated in subsection (5), a means of containment may have displayed on it

title.en: 1.17 (6) (a) - the words “Limited Quantity” or “quantité limitée”;

title.en: 1.17 (6) (b) - the abbreviation “Ltd. Qty.” or “quant. ltée”;
title.fr: 1.17 (6) (b) - FR_the abbreviation “Ltd. Qty.” or “quant. ltée”;

title.en: 1.17 (6) (c) - the words “Consumer Commodity” or “bien de consommation”; or
title.fr: 1.17 (6) (c) - FR_the words “Consumer Commodity” or “bien de consommation”; or

title.en: 1.17 (6) (d) - the UN number of each limited quantity of dangerous goods preceded by the letters “UN”, placed within a square on point.
title.fr: 1.17 (6) (d) - FR_the UN number of each limited quantity of dangerous goods preceded by the letters “UN”, placed within a square on point.

title.en: 1.17 (7) - For the purposes of paragraph 6(d), the line forming the square on point must be black and be at least 2 mm wide. If the dangerous goods have different UN numbers, the square on point must be large enough to include each UN number, but in any case each side must be not less than 50 mm long. The UN numbers and letters must be at least 6 mm high. The line, UN numbers and letters must be on a contrasting background.
title.fr: 1.17 (7) - FR_For the purposes of paragraph 6(d), the line forming the square on point must be black and be at least 2 mm wide. If the dangerous goods have different UN numbers, the square on point must be large enough to include each UN number, but in any case each side must be not less than 50 mm long. The UN numbers and letters must be at least 6 mm high. The line, UN numbers and letters must be on a contrasting background.

title.fr: - FR_Operation of a Means of Transport or a Means of Containment Exemption

title.en: 1.27 (1) - These Regulations do not apply to dangerous goods on a means of transport that are required for
title.fr: 1.27 (1) - FR_These Regulations do not apply to dangerous goods on a means of transport that are required for

title.en: 1.27 (1) (a) - the propulsion of the means of transport and that are
title.fr: 1.27 (1) (a) - FR_the propulsion of the means of transport and that are

title.en: 1.27 (1) (a) (i) - intended to remain on the means of transport until used, and
title.fr: 1.27 (1) (a) (i) - FR_intended to remain on the means of transport until used, and

title.en: 1.27 (1) (a) (ii) - contained in a fuel tank permanently installed on the means of transport;
title.fr: 1.27 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_contained in a fuel tank permanently installed on the means of transport;

title.en: 1.27 (1) (b) - the safety of individuals on board the means of transport;
title.fr: 1.27 (1) (b) - FR_the safety of individuals on board the means of transport;

title.en: 1.27 (1) (c) - the operation or safety of the means of transport including, while installed in the means of transport and used or likely to be used for purposes related to transport, air bags, air brakes, flares, lighting, shock absorbers or fire extinguishers; or
title.fr: 1.27 (1) (c) - FR_the operation or safety of the means of transport including, while installed in the means of transport and used or likely to be used for purposes related to transport, air bags, air brakes, flares, lighting, shock absorbers or fire extinguishers; or

title.en: 1.27 (1) (d) - ventilation, refrigeration or heating units that are necessary to maintain environmental conditions within a means of containment in transport on the means of transport and are intended to remain with the units or on the means of transport until used.
title.fr: 1.27 (1) (d) - FR_ventilation, refrigeration or heating units that are necessary to maintain environmental conditions within a means of containment in transport on the means of transport and are intended to remain with the units or on the means of transport until used.

title.en: 1.27 (2) - The exemption in subsection (1) does not apply to
title.fr: 1.27 (2) - FR_The exemption in subsection (1) does not apply to

title.en: 1.27 (2) (a) - ammunition; or
title.fr: 1.27 (2) (a) - FR_ammunition; or

title.en: 1.27 (2) (b) - dangerous goods being delivered to a destination and from which a portion is drawn off during transport for propulsion of the means of transport.
title.fr: 1.27 (2) (b) - FR_dangerous goods being delivered to a destination and from which a portion is drawn off during transport for propulsion of the means of transport.

title.en: - Transportation between Two Properties
title.fr: - FR_Transportation between Two Properties

title.en: 1.28 - These Regulations do not apply to dangerous goods, other than Class 1, Explosives, or Class 7, Radioactive Materials, that are in transport on a road vehicle between two properties owned or leased by the manufacturer, producer or user of the dangerous goods if
title.fr: 1.28 - FR_These Regulations do not apply to dangerous goods, other than Class 1, Explosives, or Class 7, Radioactive Materials, that are in transport on a road vehicle between two properties owned or leased by the manufacturer, producer or user of the dangerous goods if

title.en: 1.28 (a) - the dangerous goods are transported a distance less than or equal to 3 km on a public road;
title.fr: 1.28 (a) - FR_the dangerous goods are transported a distance less than or equal to 3 km on a public road;

title.en: 1.28 (b) - the road vehicle has displayed on it
title.fr: 1.28 (b) - FR_the road vehicle has displayed on it

title.en: 1.28 (b) (i) - the placard for the primary class of each of the dangerous goods, or
title.fr: 1.28 (b) (i) - FR_the placard for the primary class of each of the dangerous goods, or

title.en: 1.28 (b) (ii) - the DANGER placard;
title.fr: 1.28 (b) (ii) - FR_the DANGER placard;

title.en: 1.28 (c) - the dangerous goods are in one or more means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety; and
title.fr: 1.28 (c) - FR_the dangerous goods are in one or more means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety; and

title.en: 1.28 (d) - the local police are advised, in writing, of the nature of the dangerous goods no more than 12 months in advance of the transport.
title.fr: 1.28 (d) - FR_the local police are advised, in writing, of the nature of the dangerous goods no more than 12 months in advance of the transport.

title.en: - Ferry Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Ferry Exemption

title.en: 1.30 - Paragraph 3.6(3)(a) of Part 3 (Documentation), and subsection 4.16(3) and paragraph 4.16.1(2)(d) of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to dangerous goods in transport on a road vehicle or railway vehicle that is being transported on board a vessel that is operating over the most direct water route between two points that are not more than 5 km apart.
title.fr: 1.30 - FR_Paragraph 3.6(3)(a) of Part 3 (Documentation), and subsection 4.16(3) and paragraph 4.16.1(2)(d) of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to dangerous goods in transport on a road vehicle or railway vehicle that is being transported on board a vessel that is operating over the most direct water route between two points that are not more than 5 km apart.

title.en: - Propane and Gasoline in Highway Tanks on Board Passenger Carrying Vessels
title.fr: - FR_Propane and Gasoline in Highway Tanks on Board Passenger Carrying Vessels

title.en: 1.30.1 - Subsection 1.6(1) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases) and paragraph 3.6(3)(a) of Part 3 (Documentation) do not apply to dangerous goods that are UN1203, GASOLINE or UN1978, PROPANE that are in a highway tank that is being transported by a tank truck on board a passenger carrying vessel that is operating over the most direct water route between two points that are not more than 5 km apart if the following conditions are met:
title.fr: 1.30.1 - FR_Subsection 1.6(1) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases) and paragraph 3.6(3)(a) of Part 3 (Documentation) do not apply to dangerous goods that are UN1203, GASOLINE or UN1978, PROPANE that are in a highway tank that is being transported by a tank truck on board a passenger carrying vessel that is operating over the most direct water route between two points that are not more than 5 km apart if the following conditions are met:

title.en: 1.30.1 (a) - no more than two tank trucks transporting dangerous goods that are UN1203, GASOLINE or UN1978, PROPANE are on board the passenger carrying vessel;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (a) - FR_no more than two tank trucks transporting dangerous goods that are UN1203, GASOLINE or UN1978, PROPANE are on board the passenger carrying vessel;

title.en: 1.30.1 (b) - before the tank truck is placed on board the passenger carrying vessel, the highway tank is visually inspected by its driver for dents or evidence of leakage;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (b) - FR_before the tank truck is placed on board the passenger carrying vessel, the highway tank is visually inspected by its driver for dents or evidence of leakage;

title.en: 1.30.1 (c) - the tank truck is located on an open deck;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (c) - FR_the tank truck is located on an open deck;

title.en: 1.30.1 (d) - a safety perimeter of at least 1 m is established around the tank truck while it is on board the passenger carrying vessel;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (d) - FR_a safety perimeter of at least 1 m is established around the tank truck while it is on board the passenger carrying vessel;

title.en: 1.30.1 (e) - the tank truck’s parking brakes are set securely throughout the journey until the passenger carrying vessel has completed docking;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (e) - FR_the tank truck’s parking brakes are set securely throughout the journey until the passenger carrying vessel has completed docking;

title.en: 1.30.1 (f) - the tank truck’s engine is either left running at all times or is shut off and not restarted until the passenger carrying vessel has completed docking;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (f) - FR_the tank truck’s engine is either left running at all times or is shut off and not restarted until the passenger carrying vessel has completed docking;

title.en: 1.30.1 (g) - the tank truck’s driver remains with the tank truck while it is on board the passenger carrying vessel;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (g) - FR_the tank truck’s driver remains with the tank truck while it is on board the passenger carrying vessel;

title.en: 1.30.1 (h) - notices prohibiting smoking, the use of an open flame and the use of spark-producing equipment on the passenger carrying vessel are placed in full view of passengers;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (h) - FR_notices prohibiting smoking, the use of an open flame and the use of spark-producing equipment on the passenger carrying vessel are placed in full view of passengers;

title.en: 1.30.1 (i) - fixed extinguishing equipment, including foam cannon units that are capable of reaching the highway tank, is installed on board the passenger carrying vessel;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (i) - FR_fixed extinguishing equipment, including foam cannon units that are capable of reaching the highway tank, is installed on board the passenger carrying vessel;

title.en: 1.30.1 (j) - absorbent material that is compatible with flammable liquids is available on board the passenger carrying vessel;
title.fr: 1.30.1 (j) - FR_absorbent material that is compatible with flammable liquids is available on board the passenger carrying vessel;

title.en: 1.30.1 (k) - a flammable gas detector is available on board the passenger carrying vessel; and
title.fr: 1.30.1 (k) - FR_a flammable gas detector is available on board the passenger carrying vessel; and

title.en: 1.30.1 (l) - the passenger carrying vessel’s master ensures that the tank truck is constantly monitored by a crew member while it is on board the passenger carrying vessel.
title.fr: 1.30.1 (l) - FR_the passenger carrying vessel’s master ensures that the tank truck is constantly monitored by a crew member while it is on board the passenger carrying vessel.

title.en: - Class 1, Explosives, Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Class 1, Explosives, Exemption

title.en: 1.31 - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 6 (Training), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting on a road vehicle or a railway vehicle dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, if
title.fr: 1.31 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 6 (Training), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting on a road vehicle or a railway vehicle dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, if

title.en: 1.31 (a) - the quantity of all the explosives in the road vehicle or railway vehicle that are not subject to special provision 85 or 86, expressed in net explosives quantity, is less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1 for each of the explosives;
title.fr: 1.31 (a) - FR_the quantity of all the explosives in the road vehicle or railway vehicle that are not subject to special provision 85 or 86, expressed in net explosives quantity, is less than or equal to the number shown in column 6(a) of Schedule 1 for each of the explosives;

title.en: 1.31 (b) - the quantity of all the explosives in the road vehicle or railway vehicle that are subject to special provision 85 or 86, expressed in number of articles, is less than or equal to the number shown in special provision 85 or 86 for each of the explosives;
title.fr: 1.31 (b) - FR_the quantity of all the explosives in the road vehicle or railway vehicle that are subject to special provision 85 or 86, expressed in number of articles, is less than or equal to the number shown in special provision 85 or 86 for each of the explosives;

title.en: 1.31 (c) - each means of containment has displayed on it the class, compatibility group and UN number of the explosives contained inside it; and
title.fr: 1.31 (c) - FR_each means of containment has displayed on it the class, compatibility group and UN number of the explosives contained inside it; and

title.en: 1.31 (d) - a placard is displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) if the explosives are included in Class 1.1, 1.2, 1.3 or 1.5
title.fr: 1.31 (d) - FR_a placard is displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) if the explosives are included in Class 1.1, 1.2, 1.3 or 1.5

title.en: 1.31 (d) (i) - in any quantity exceeding 10 kg net explosives quantity, or
title.fr: 1.31 (d) (i) - FR_in any quantity exceeding 10 kg net explosives quantity, or

title.en: 1.31 (d) (ii) - in any number of articles exceeding 1 000 for explosives subject to special provision 85 or 86.
title.fr: 1.31 (d) (ii) - FR_in any number of articles exceeding 1 000 for explosives subject to special provision 85 or 86.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases, or Ammonia Solutions (Class 8) in Refrigerating Machines Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases, or Ammonia Solutions (Class 8) in Refrigerating Machines Exemption

title.en: 1.32 - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to UN2857, REFRIGERATING MACHINES, and refrigerating machine components, containing Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gases or UN2672, AMMONIA SOLUTIONS, if the quantity of gas has a mass that is less than or equal to 12 kg and the quantity of ammonia solutions is less than or equal to 12 L.
title.fr: 1.32 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to UN2857, REFRIGERATING MACHINES, and refrigerating machine components, containing Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gases or UN2672, AMMONIA SOLUTIONS, if the quantity of gas has a mass that is less than or equal to 12 kg and the quantity of ammonia solutions is less than or equal to 12 L.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases, that May Be Identified as UN1075, LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases, that May Be Identified as UN1075, LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS

title.en: 1.32.1 (1) - The following dangerous goods may be identified by the UN number UN1075 and the shipping name LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES instead of the UN number and shipping name identified for them:
title.fr: 1.32.1 (1) - FR_The following dangerous goods may be identified by the UN number UN1075 and the shipping name LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES instead of the UN number and shipping name identified for them:
1.32.1 (1) (b) - FR_UN1012, BUTYLENE;

title.en: 1.32.1 (1) (c) - UN1055, ISOBUTYLENE;
title.fr: 1.32.1 (1) (c) - FR_UN1055, ISOBUTYLENE;

title.en: 1.32.1 (1) (d) - UN1077, PROPYLENE;
title.fr: 1.32.1 (1) (d) - FR_UN1077, PROPYLENE;

title.en: 1.32.1 (1) (e) - UN1969, ISOBUTANE; and
title.fr: 1.32.1 (1) (e) - FR_UN1969, ISOBUTANE; and

title.en: 1.32.1 (2) - The shipping name of the dangerous goods listed in paragraphs (1)(a) to (f) may be shown on the shipping document, in parentheses, following the words “LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES”.
title.fr: 1.32.1 (2) - FR_The shipping name of the dangerous goods listed in paragraphs (1)(a) to (f) may be shown on the shipping document, in parentheses, following the words “LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES”.

title.en: 1.32.1 (3) - If either UN1077, PROPYLENE, or UN1978, PROPANE, is to be transported on a road vehicle or railway vehicle on board a vessel and is identified as LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES on the shipping document in accordance with subsection (1), the shipping name PROPYLENE or PROPANE, as appropriate, must be shown on the shipping document, in parentheses, following the words “LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES”.
title.fr: 1.32.1 (3) - FR_If either UN1077, PROPYLENE, or UN1978, PROPANE, is to be transported on a road vehicle or railway vehicle on board a vessel and is identified as LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES on the shipping document in accordance with subsection (1), the shipping name PROPYLENE or PROPANE, as appropriate, must be shown on the shipping document, in parentheses, following the words “LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GASES”.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases, Absolute Pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases, Absolute Pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa

title.en: 1.32.2 - Gases that are at an absolute pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa at 20°C, other than gases included in Class 2.1 or Class 2.3, may be handled, offered for transport or transported on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gas. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations that relate to gases included in Class 2.2 must be complied with.
title.fr: 1.32.2 - FR_Gases that are at an absolute pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa at 20°C, other than gases included in Class 2.1 or Class 2.3, may be handled, offered for transport or transported on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gas. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations that relate to gases included in Class 2.2 must be complied with.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases, in Small Means of Containment Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases, in Small Means of Containment Exemption

title.en: 1.32.3 - Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 6 (Training) do not apply to dangerous goods that are transported in one or more small means of containment on a road vehicle solely on land if
title.fr: 1.32.3 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 6 (Training) do not apply to dangerous goods that are transported in one or more small means of containment on a road vehicle solely on land if

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) - the dangerous goods are
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) - FR_the dangerous goods are

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (i) - UN1001, ACETYLENE, DISSOLVED,
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (i) - FR_UN1001, ACETYLENE, DISSOLVED,

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (ii) - UN1002, AIR, COMPRESSED,
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (ii) - FR_UN1002, AIR, COMPRESSED,

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (iii) - UN1006, ARGON, COMPRESSED,
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (iii) - FR_UN1006, ARGON, COMPRESSED,

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (iv) - UN1013, CARBON DIOXIDE,
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (iv) - FR_UN1013, CARBON DIOXIDE,

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (v) - UN1060, METHYLACETYLENE AND PROPADIENE MIXTURE, STABILIZED,
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (v) - FR_UN1060, METHYLACETYLENE AND PROPADIENE MIXTURE, STABILIZED,

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (vi) - UN1066, NITROGEN, COMPRESSED,
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (vi) - FR_UN1066, NITROGEN, COMPRESSED,

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (vii) - UN1072, OXYGEN, COMPRESSED, or
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (vii) - FR_UN1072, OXYGEN, COMPRESSED, or

title.en: 1.32.3 (a) (viii) - UN1978, PROPANE;
title.fr: 1.32.3 (a) (viii) - FR_UN1978, PROPANE;

title.en: 1.32.3 (b) - the dangerous goods are contained in no more than five small means of containment;
title.fr: 1.32.3 (b) - FR_the dangerous goods are contained in no more than five small means of containment;

title.en: 1.32.3 (c) - the gross mass of the dangerous goods is less than or equal to 500 kg; and
title.fr: 1.32.3 (c) - FR_the gross mass of the dangerous goods is less than or equal to 500 kg; and

title.en: 1.32.3 (d) - the labels displayed on the small means of containment can be seen from outside the road vehicle.
title.fr: 1.32.3 (d) - FR_the labels displayed on the small means of containment can be seen from outside the road vehicle.

title.en: - Class 3, Flammable Liquids: General Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids: General Exemption

title.en: 1.33 - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if the dangerous goods
title.fr: 1.33 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if the dangerous goods

title.en: 1.33 (a) - have no subsidiary class;
title.fr: 1.33 (a) - FR_have no subsidiary class;

title.en: 1.33 (b) - are included in Packing Group III and have a flash point greater than 37.8°C; and
title.fr: 1.33 (b) - FR_are included in Packing Group III and have a flash point greater than 37.8°C; and

title.en: 1.33 (c) - are in one or more small means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety.
title.fr: 1.33 (c) - FR_are in one or more small means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety.

title.en: - Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Flash Point Greater Than 60°C but Less Than or Equal to 93°C
title.fr: - FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Flash Point Greater Than 60°C but Less Than or Equal to 93°C

title.en: 1.34 - Despite section 6.1 of the Act and section 4.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) of these Regulations, substances that have a flash point greater than 60°C but less than or equal to 93°C may be transported on a road vehicle, on a railway vehicle or on a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Packing Group III. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations, except paragraph 7.2(1)(f) of Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), that relate to flammable liquids that have a flash point less than or equal to 60°C must be complied with.
title.fr: 1.34 - FR_Despite section 6.1 of the Act and section 4.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) of these Regulations, substances that have a flash point greater than 60°C but less than or equal to 93°C may be transported on a road vehicle, on a railway vehicle or on a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Packing Group III. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations, except paragraph 7.2(1)(f) of Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), that relate to flammable liquids that have a flash point less than or equal to 60°C must be complied with.

title.en: - UN1202, DIESEL FUEL, or UN1203, GASOLINE, Exemption
title.fr: - FR_UN1202, DIESEL FUEL, or UN1203, GASOLINE, Exemption

title.en: 1.35 - Part 3 (Documentation), the UN number requirements in sections 4.12 and 4.15.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) and Part 6 (Training) do not apply to the offering for transport, handling or transporting on a road vehicle of dangerous goods that are UN1202, DIESEL FUEL or UN1203, GASOLINE, if
title.fr: 1.35 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), the UN number requirements in sections 4.12 and 4.15.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) and Part 6 (Training) do not apply to the offering for transport, handling or transporting on a road vehicle of dangerous goods that are UN1202, DIESEL FUEL or UN1203, GASOLINE, if

title.en: 1.35 (a) - the dangerous goods are in one or more means of containment, each of which is visible from outside the road vehicle and each of which has displayed on it
title.fr: 1.35 (a) - FR_the dangerous goods are in one or more means of containment, each of which is visible from outside the road vehicle and each of which has displayed on it

title.en: 1.35 (a) (i) - the label or placard required for the dangerous goods by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), or
title.fr: 1.35 (a) (i) - FR_the label or placard required for the dangerous goods by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), or

title.en: 1.35 (a) (ii) - if a side or end of the means of containment is not visible from outside the road vehicle, the label or placard required for the dangerous goods by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) on a side or end that is visible from outside the road vehicle;
title.fr: 1.35 (a) (ii) - FR_if a side or end of the means of containment is not visible from outside the road vehicle, the label or placard required for the dangerous goods by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) on a side or end that is visible from outside the road vehicle;

title.en: 1.35 (b) - each means of containment is secured to the road vehicle so that the required label or at least one of the required placards displayed on it is visible from outside the road vehicle during transport; and
title.fr: 1.35 (b) - FR_each means of containment is secured to the road vehicle so that the required label or at least one of the required placards displayed on it is visible from outside the road vehicle during transport; and

title.en: 1.35 (c) - the total capacity of all the means of containment is less than or equal to 2 000 L.
title.fr: 1.35 (c) - FR_the total capacity of all the means of containment is less than or equal to 2 000 L.

title.en: - Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Alcoholic Beverage and Aqueous Solution of Alcohol Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Alcoholic Beverage and Aqueous Solution of Alcohol Exemption

title.en: 1.36 - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage of
title.fr: 1.36 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage of

title.en: 1.36 (a) - an alcoholic beverage if the alcoholic beverage
title.fr: 1.36 (a) - FR_an alcoholic beverage if the alcoholic beverage

title.en: 1.36 (a) (i) - contains alcohol that is less than or equal to 24% by volume,
title.fr: 1.36 (a) (i) - FR_contains alcohol that is less than or equal to 24% by volume,

title.en: 1.36 (a) (ii) - is included in Packing Group II and is in a means of containment with a capacity that is less than or equal to 5 L, or
title.fr: 1.36 (a) (ii) - FR_is included in Packing Group II and is in a means of containment with a capacity that is less than or equal to 5 L, or

title.en: 1.36 (a) (iii) - is included in Packing Group III and is in a means of containment with a capacity that is less than or equal to 250 L; or
title.fr: 1.36 (a) (iii) - FR_is included in Packing Group III and is in a means of containment with a capacity that is less than or equal to 250 L; or

title.en: 1.36 (b) - an aqueous solution of alcohol if the aqueous solution has a flash point greater than 23°C and

title.en: - Polyester Resin Kit Exception
title.fr: - FR_Polyester Resin Kit Exception

title.en: 1.38 - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of a polyester resin kit that consists of a substance included in Class 3, Packing Group II or III and a substance included in Class 5.2, Type D, E or F that does not require temperature control if
title.fr: 1.38 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of a polyester resin kit that consists of a substance included in Class 3, Packing Group II or III and a substance included in Class 5.2, Type D, E or F that does not require temperature control if

title.en: - Biological Products Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Biological Products Exemption

title.en: 1.41 - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of biological products if they
title.fr: 1.41 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of biological products if they

title.en: 1.41 (a) - are prepared in accordance with the requirements set out under the Food and Drugs Act;
title.fr: 1.41 (a) - FR_are prepared in accordance with the requirements set out under the Food and Drugs Act;

title.en: 1.41 (b) - are in a means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety; and
title.fr: 1.41 (b) - FR_are in a means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety; and

title.en: 1.41 (c) - are in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Biological Product” or “Produit biologique” in black letters at least 6 mm high on a contrasting background.
title.fr: 1.41 (c) - FR_are in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Biological Product” or “Produit biologique” in black letters at least 6 mm high on a contrasting background.

title.en: - Human or Animal Specimens Believed Not to Contain Infectious Substances Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Human or Animal Specimens Believed Not to Contain Infectious Substances Exemption

title.en: 1.42 (1) - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of human or animal specimens that a person has no reason to believe contain infectious substances.
title.fr: 1.42 (1) - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of human or animal specimens that a person has no reason to believe contain infectious substances.

title.en: 1.42 (2) - The human or animal specimens referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Exempt Human Specimen” or “spécimen humain exempté” or “Exempt Animal Specimen” or “spécimen animal exempté” and that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the specimen.
title.fr: 1.42 (2) - FR_The human or animal specimens referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Exempt Human Specimen” or “spécimen humain exempté” or “Exempt Animal Specimen” or “spécimen animal exempté” and that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the specimen.

title.en: - Tissues or Organs for Transplant Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Tissues or Organs for Transplant Exemption

title.en: 1.42.1 - These Regulations do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of tissues or organs for transplant.
title.fr: 1.42.1 - FR_These Regulations do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of tissues or organs for transplant.

title.en: - Blood or Blood Components Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Blood or Blood Components Exemption

title.en: 1.42.2 (1) - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of blood or blood components that are intended for transfusion or for the preparation of blood products and are reasonably believed not to contain infectious substances.
title.fr: 1.42.2 (1) - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of blood or blood components that are intended for transfusion or for the preparation of blood products and are reasonably believed not to contain infectious substances.

title.en: 1.42.2 (2) - The blood or blood components referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the blood or blood components.
title.fr: 1.42.2 (2) - FR_The blood or blood components referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the blood or blood components.

title.fr: 1.44 - FR_Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), and Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) do not apply to a residue of dangerous goods contained in a drum that is in transport on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage, except for dangerous goods included in Packing Group I or contained in a drum otherwise requiring a label for Class 1, 4.3, 6.2 or 7, if

title.en: 1.44 (b) - the drum is being transported for the purpose of reconditioning or reuse in accordance with section 5.12 of Part 5 (Means of Containment);
title.fr: 1.44 (b) - FR_the drum is being transported for the purpose of reconditioning or reuse in accordance with section 5.12 of Part 5 (Means of Containment);

title.en: 1.44 (c) - when more than 10 drums are on the road vehicle or on the railway vehicle, the road vehicle or railway vehicle has displayed on it the DANGER placard in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks); and

title.en: 1.44 (d) - the drums are accompanied by a document that includes the following information:
title.fr: 1.44 (d) - FR_the drums are accompanied by a document that includes the following information:

title.fr: 1.44 (d) (i) - FR_the primary class of each residue and the words “Residue Drum(s)” or “fût(s) de résidu” when the primary class can be reasonably determined, preceded by the number of drums containing dangerous goods with that primary class, and

title.fr: 1.44 (d) (ii) - FR_the words “Residue Drum(s) – Content(s) Unknown” or “fût(s) de résidu – contenu inconnu” if there are any residues for which the primary class cannot be reasonably determined, preceded by the number of drums containing the residues.

title.en: - Fumigation of Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Fumigation of Means of Containment

title.en: 1.45 - These Regulations, except for subsection 3.5(3) of Part 3 (Documentation) and section 4.21 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), do not apply to a means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment.
title.fr: 1.45 - FR_These Regulations, except for subsection 3.5(3) of Part 3 (Documentation) and section 4.21 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), do not apply to a means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment.

title.en: - Marine Pollutants Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Marine Pollutants Exemption

title.en: 1.45.1 - Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.
title.fr: 1.45.1 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.
