title.en: 1.49 (1) (c) - the cylinder is accompanied by a shipping document that includes the words “Cylinder in transport for purpose of refilling, exchanging or requalification in compliance with section 1.49 of the TDGR” or “Bouteille à gaz en transport aux fins de remplissage, d’échange ou de requalification en conformité avec l’article 1.49 du RTMD”;
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (c) - FR_the cylinder is accompanied by a shipping document that includes the words “Cylinder in transport for purpose of refilling, exchanging or requalification in compliance with section 1.49 of the TDGR” or “Bouteille à gaz en transport aux fins de remplissage, d’échange ou de requalification en conformité avec l’article 1.49 du RTMD”;

title.en: 1.49 (1) (d) - the cylinder is closed and secured so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (d) - FR_the cylinder is closed and secured so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) - in the case of a cylinder from or for a vessel that is a Canadian vessel as defined in section 2 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001, the cylinder conforms, as applicable, to
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) - FR_in the case of a cylinder from or for a vessel that is a Canadian vessel as defined in section 2 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001, the cylinder conforms, as applicable, to

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) (i) - the Fire Detection and Extinguishing Equipment Regulations, as they read immediately before being repealed,
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) (i) - FR_the Fire Detection and Extinguishing Equipment Regulations, as they read immediately before being repealed,

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) (ii) - the Life Saving Equipment Regulations,
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) (ii) - FR_the Life Saving Equipment Regulations,

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) (iii) - the Large Fishing Vessel Inspection Regulations,
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) (iii) - FR_the Large Fishing Vessel Inspection Regulations,

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) (iv) - the Small Fishing Vessel Inspection Regulations,
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) (iv) - FR_the Small Fishing Vessel Inspection Regulations,

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) (v) - the Small Vessel Regulations, and
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) (v) - FR_the Small Vessel Regulations, and

title.en: 1.49 (1) (e) (vi) - the Vessel Fire Safety Regulations;
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (e) (vi) - FR_the Vessel Fire Safety Regulations;

title.en: 1.49 (1) (f) - in the case of a cylinder from or for a vessel that is a foreign vessel as defined in section 2 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001 and that is a Safety Convention vessel as defined in that section, the cylinder is used for a purpose related to the operation or navigation of the vessel, including a life-saving or emergency purpose; and
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (f) - FR_in the case of a cylinder from or for a vessel that is a foreign vessel as defined in section 2 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001 and that is a Safety Convention vessel as defined in that section, the cylinder is used for a purpose related to the operation or navigation of the vessel, including a life-saving or emergency purpose; and

title.en: 1.49 (1) (g) - in the case of a cylinder from or for an aircraft, a flight authority, as defined in subsection 101.01(1) of the Canadian Aviation Regulations, has been issued in respect of the aircraft and the cylinder serves an aeronautical purpose, including a life-saving or emergency purpose.
title.fr: 1.49 (1) (g) - FR_in the case of a cylinder from or for an aircraft, a flight authority, as defined in subsection 101.01(1) of the Canadian Aviation Regulations, has been issued in respect of the aircraft and the cylinder serves an aeronautical purpose, including a life-saving or emergency purpose.

title.en: 1.49 (2) - When the cylinder has been requalified or filled, the exemption set out in subsection (1) applies only if the cylinder was requalified in accordance with clause 6.5.1(b) of CSA B340 and filled in compliance with clause 6.5.1(c) of CSA B340.
title.fr: 1.49 (2) - FR_When the cylinder has been requalified or filled, the exemption set out in subsection (1) applies only if the cylinder was requalified in accordance with clause 6.5.1(b) of CSA B340 and filled in compliance with clause 6.5.1(c) of CSA B340.

title.en: - Hot Air Balloon Cylinder Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Hot Air Balloon Cylinder Exemption

title.en: 1.50 (1) - Sections 5.1, 5.2 and 5.5 and subsections 5.10(1) and (2) of Part 5 (Means of Containment) do not apply to the offering for transport, handling or transporting of UN1978, PROPANE, in a cylinder on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a ship on a domestic voyage if
title.fr: 1.50 (1) - FR_Sections 5.1, 5.2 and 5.5 and subsections 5.10(1) and (2) of Part 5 (Means of Containment) do not apply to the offering for transport, handling or transporting of UN1978, PROPANE, in a cylinder on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a ship on a domestic voyage if

title.en: 1.50 (1) (a) - the cylinder is for use in a hot air balloon and is marked clearly and visibly, in letters at least 5 mm high, with the words “FOR USE IN HOT AIR BALLOONS ONLY” or “POUR UTILISATION DANS LES BALLONS SEULEMENT”;
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (a) - FR_the cylinder is for use in a hot air balloon and is marked clearly and visibly, in letters at least 5 mm high, with the words “FOR USE IN HOT AIR BALLOONS ONLY” or “POUR UTILISATION DANS LES BALLONS SEULEMENT”;

title.en: 1.50 (1) (b) - a flight authority, as defined in subsection 101.01(1) of the Canadian Aviation Regulations, has been issued in respect of the hot air balloon;
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (b) - FR_a flight authority, as defined in subsection 101.01(1) of the Canadian Aviation Regulations, has been issued in respect of the hot air balloon;

title.en: 1.50 (1) (c) - the cylinder is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (c) - FR_the cylinder is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;

title.en: 1.50 (1) (d) - subject to paragraph (e), the cylinder
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (d) - FR_subject to paragraph (e), the cylinder

title.en: 1.50 (1) (d) (i) - is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CSA B340, except clause 5.3.1.4 of that standard,
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (d) (i) - FR_is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CSA B340, except clause 5.3.1.4 of that standard,

title.en: 1.50 (1) (d) (ii) - is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CSA B342,
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (d) (ii) - FR_is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CSA B342,

title.en: 1.50 (1) (d) (iii) - is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with 49 CFR and, in the case of a requalified cylinder, is marked with the requalification markings required by CSA B339 or 49 CFR,
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (d) (iii) - FR_is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with 49 CFR and, in the case of a requalified cylinder, is marked with the requalification markings required by CSA B339 or 49 CFR,

title.en: 1.50 (1) (d) (iv) - is manufactured and selected in accordance with the ADR, is marked with the symbol π (Pi) in accordance with the TPED and is used in accordance with clauses 4.1.1.2, 4.1.3, 4.1.4, 4.2, 4.3.1, 4.3.2, 4.3.7, 4.3.8, 4.3.9, 5.1.1, 5.1.2, 5.1.3(b) to (e), 5.1.8 and 5.3.1.1 of CSA B340, or
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (d) (iv) - FR_is manufactured and selected in accordance with the ADR, is marked with the symbol π (Pi) in accordance with the TPED and is used in accordance with clauses 4.1.1.2, 4.1.3, 4.1.4, 4.2, 4.3.1, 4.3.2, 4.3.7, 4.3.8, 4.3.9, 5.1.1, 5.1.2, 5.1.3(b) to (e), 5.1.8 and 5.3.1.1 of CSA B340, or

title.en: 1.50 (1) (d) (v) - was manufactured before January 1, 2017, and is used in accordance with clauses 4.1.1.2, 4.1.3, 4.1.4, 4.2, 4.3.1, 4.3.2, 4.3.7, 4.3.8, 4.3.9, 5.1.1, 5.1.2, 5.1.3(b) to (e), 5.1.8 and 5.3.1.1 of CSA B340; and
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (d) (v) - FR_was manufactured before January 1, 2017, and is used in accordance with clauses 4.1.1.2, 4.1.3, 4.1.4, 4.2, 4.3.1, 4.3.2, 4.3.7, 4.3.8, 4.3.9, 5.1.1, 5.1.2, 5.1.3(b) to (e), 5.1.8 and 5.3.1.1 of CSA B340; and

title.en: 1.50 (1) (e) - the liquid phase of the propane is less than or equal to 85% of the capacity of the cylinder at 15°C.
title.fr: 1.50 (1) (e) - FR_the liquid phase of the propane is less than or equal to 85% of the capacity of the cylinder at 15°C.

title.en: 1.50 (2) - For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(d)(iv), ADR means the European Agreement concerning the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road, published by the United Nations, as amended from time to time and TPED means the Transportable Pressure Equipment Directive, Directive 2010/35/EU, June 16, 2010, published by the Council of the European Union.
title.fr: 1.50 (2) - FR_For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(d)(iv), ADR means the European Agreement concerning the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road, published by the United Nations, as amended from time to time and TPED means the Transportable Pressure Equipment Directive, Directive 2010/35/EU, June 16, 2010, published by the Council of the European Union.

title.en: 1.50 (3) - Subject to subsection (4), a cylinder referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(iv) or (v) must be requalified within
title.fr: 1.50 (3) - FR_Subject to subsection (4), a cylinder referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(iv) or (v) must be requalified within

title.en: 1.50 (3) (a) - 10 years after its date of manufacture; or
title.fr: 1.50 (3) (a) - FR_10 years after its date of manufacture; or

title.en: 1.50 (3) (b) - 10 years after its most recent requalification date as marked on the cylinder.
title.fr: 1.50 (3) (b) - FR_10 years after its most recent requalification date as marked on the cylinder.

title.en: 1.50 (4) - A cylinder that must be requalified on or before January 1, 2018 may be requalified within a 12-month grace period that starts on the day on which this section comes into force.
title.fr: 1.50 (4) - FR_A cylinder that must be requalified on or before January 1, 2018 may be requalified within a 12-month grace period that starts on the day on which this section comes into force.

title.en: 1.50 (5) - When it is requalified, a cylinder referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(iv) or (v) must
title.fr: 1.50 (5) - FR_When it is requalified, a cylinder referred to in subparagraph (1)(d)(iv) or (v) must

title.en: 1.50 (5) (a) - be requalified with a proof pressure retest and an internal and external visual inspection in accordance with clause 24 of CSA B339 by a facility that holds a valid certificate of registration referred to in clause 25.3 of CSA B339; or
title.fr: 1.50 (5) (a) - FR_be requalified with a proof pressure retest and an internal and external visual inspection in accordance with clause 24 of CSA B339 by a facility that holds a valid certificate of registration referred to in clause 25.3 of CSA B339; or

title.en: 1.50 (5) (b) - be subjected to a periodic inspection and test in accordance with clause 19 of CSA B341.
title.fr: 1.50 (5) (b) - FR_be subjected to a periodic inspection and test in accordance with clause 19 of CSA B341.

title.en: PART 2 - Classification
title.fr: PART 2 - FR_Classification

title.en: - Determining When Substances Are Dangerous Goods
title.fr: - FR_Determining When Substances Are Dangerous Goods

title.en: 2.1 - A substance is dangerous goods when
title.fr: 2.1 - FR_A substance is dangerous goods when

title.en: 2.1 (a) - it is listed by name in Schedule 1 and is in any form, state or concentration that meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods; or
title.fr: 2.1 (a) - FR_it is listed by name in Schedule 1 and is in any form, state or concentration that meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods; or

title.en: 2.1 (b) - it is not listed by name in Schedule 1 but meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods.
title.fr: 2.1 (b) - FR_it is not listed by name in Schedule 1 but meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods.

title.en: - Responsibility for Classification
title.fr: - FR_Responsibility for Classification

title.en: 2.2 (1) - Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must determine the classification of the dangerous goods in accordance with this Part.
title.fr: 2.2 (1) - FR_Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must determine the classification of the dangerous goods in accordance with this Part.

title.en: 2.2 (2) - When importing dangerous goods into Canada, the consignor must ensure that they have the correct classification before they are transported in Canada.
title.fr: 2.2 (2) - FR_When importing dangerous goods into Canada, the consignor must ensure that they have the correct classification before they are transported in Canada.

title.en: 2.2 (3) - A consignor must use the following classifications:
title.fr: 2.2 (3) - FR_A consignor must use the following classifications:

title.en: 2.2 (3) (a) - for substances included in Class 1, Explosives, the classification determined in accordance with the Explosives Act; and
title.fr: 2.2 (3) (a) - FR_for substances included in Class 1, Explosives, the classification determined in accordance with the Explosives Act; and

title.en: 2.2 (3) (b) - for radioactive materials, the classification determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 2.2 (3) (b) - FR_for radioactive materials, the classification determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.en: 2.2 (3.1) - For substances included in Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, a consignor may use a classification determined by the Public Health Agency of Canada or the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.
title.fr: 2.2 (3.1) - FR_For substances included in Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, a consignor may use a classification determined by the Public Health Agency of Canada or the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.

title.en: 2.2 (4) - A consignor may use the appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations to transport dangerous goods within Canada by a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if these Regulations or the document from which the classification is taken does not forbid their transport.
title.fr: 2.2 (4) - FR_A consignor may use the appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations to transport dangerous goods within Canada by a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if these Regulations or the document from which the classification is taken does not forbid their transport.

title.en: 2.2 (5) - If an error in classification is noticed or if there are reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification, the consignor must not allow a carrier to take possession of the dangerous goods for transport until the classification has been verified or corrected.
title.fr: 2.2 (5) - FR_If an error in classification is noticed or if there are reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification, the consignor must not allow a carrier to take possession of the dangerous goods for transport until the classification has been verified or corrected.

title.en: 2.2 (6) - A carrier who notices an error in classification or has reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification while the dangerous goods are in transport must advise the consignor and must stop transporting the dangerous goods until the consignor verifies or corrects the classification. The consignor must immediately verify or correct the classification and ensure that the carrier is provided with the verified or corrected classification.
title.fr: 2.2 (6) - FR_A carrier who notices an error in classification or has reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification while the dangerous goods are in transport must advise the consignor and must stop transporting the dangerous goods until the consignor verifies or corrects the classification. The consignor must immediately verify or correct the classification and ensure that the carrier is provided with the verified or corrected classification.

title.en: - Proof of Classification
title.fr: - FR_Proof of Classification

title.en: 2.2.1 (1) - A consignor who allows a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport or who imports dangerous goods into Canada must, during a five-year period that begins on the date that appears on the shipping document, make a proof of classification available to the Minister on reasonable notice given by the Minister.
title.fr: 2.2.1 (1) - FR_A consignor who allows a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport or who imports dangerous goods into Canada must, during a five-year period that begins on the date that appears on the shipping document, make a proof of classification available to the Minister on reasonable notice given by the Minister.

title.en: 2.2.1 (2) - For the purposes of this section, a proof of classification is
title.fr: 2.2.1 (2) - FR_For the purposes of this section, a proof of classification is

title.en: 2.2.1 (2) (a) - a test report;
title.fr: 2.2.1 (2) (a) - FR_a test report;

title.en: 2.2.1 (2) (b) - a lab report; or
title.fr: 2.2.1 (2) (b) - FR_a lab report; or

title.en: 2.2.1 (2) (c) - a document that explains how the dangerous goods were classified.
title.fr: 2.2.1 (2) (c) - FR_a document that explains how the dangerous goods were classified.

title.en: 2.2.1 (3) - A proof of classification must include the following information:
title.fr: 2.2.1 (3) - FR_A proof of classification must include the following information:

title.en: 2.2.1 (3) (a) - the date on which the dangerous goods were classified;
title.fr: 2.2.1 (3) (a) - FR_the date on which the dangerous goods were classified;

title.en: 2.2.1 (3) (b) - if applicable, the technical name of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 2.2.1 (3) (b) - FR_if applicable, the technical name of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 2.2.1 (3) (c) - the classification of the dangerous goods; and
title.fr: 2.2.1 (3) (c) - FR_the classification of the dangerous goods; and

title.en: 2.2.1 (3) (d) - if applicable, the classification method used under this Part or under Chapter 2 of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 2.2.1 (3) (d) - FR_if applicable, the classification method used under this Part or under Chapter 2 of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: - Classifying Substances That Are Listed by Name in Schedule 1
title.fr: - FR_Classifying Substances That Are Listed by Name in Schedule 1

title.en: 2.3 - If a name of dangerous goods is shown as a shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1, that name must be used as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 2.3 - FR_If a name of dangerous goods is shown as a shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1, that name must be used as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.

title.en: - Classifying Substances That Are Included in Only One Class and One Packing Group
title.fr: - FR_Classifying Substances That Are Included in Only One Class and One Packing Group

title.en: 2.4 - If, in accordance with the criteria and tests in this Part, a substance is included in only one class and one packing group, the substance is dangerous goods and the shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1 that most precisely describes the dangerous goods and that is most consistent with the class and the packing group determined by the criteria and tests must be selected as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 2.4 - FR_If, in accordance with the criteria and tests in this Part, a substance is included in only one class and one packing group, the substance is dangerous goods and the shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1 that most precisely describes the dangerous goods and that is most consistent with the class and the packing group determined by the criteria and tests must be selected as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.

title.en: - Classifying Substances That Are Included in More Than One Class or Packing Group
title.fr: - FR_Classifying Substances That Are Included in More Than One Class or Packing Group

title.en: 2.5 - If, in accordance with the criteria and tests in this Part, a substance meets the criteria for inclusion in more than one class or packing group, the substance is dangerous goods and its classification is determined in the following manner:
title.fr: 2.5 - FR_If, in accordance with the criteria and tests in this Part, a substance meets the criteria for inclusion in more than one class or packing group, the substance is dangerous goods and its classification is determined in the following manner:

title.en: 2.5 (a) - the classes in which the dangerous goods are included are ranked in order of precedence in accordance with section 2.8 to determine the primary class and the potential subsidiary class or classes;
title.fr: 2.5 (a) - FR_the classes in which the dangerous goods are included are ranked in order of precedence in accordance with section 2.8 to determine the primary class and the potential subsidiary class or classes;

title.en: 2.5 (b) - the potential packing group is the one with the lowest roman numeral;
title.fr: 2.5 (b) - FR_the potential packing group is the one with the lowest roman numeral;

title.en: 2.5 (c) - the shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1 that most precisely describes the dangerous goods and for which the corresponding data in columns 1, 3 and 4 are the most consistent with the primary class, the potential subsidiary class or classes and the potential packing group is selected; and
title.fr: 2.5 (c) - FR_the shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1 that most precisely describes the dangerous goods and for which the corresponding data in columns 1, 3 and 4 are the most consistent with the primary class, the potential subsidiary class or classes and the potential packing group is selected; and

title.en: 2.5 (d) - the shipping name and the corresponding data in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 are used as the classification of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 2.5 (d) - FR_the shipping name and the corresponding data in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 are used as the classification of the dangerous goods.

title.en: - Descriptive Text Following a Shipping Name
title.fr: - FR_Descriptive Text Following a Shipping Name

title.en: 2.5.1 - When applying section 2.4 or 2.5, the descriptive text written in lower case letters following a shipping name must be used in determining the shipping name that most precisely describes the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 2.5.1 - FR_When applying section 2.4 or 2.5, the descriptive text written in lower case letters following a shipping name must be used in determining the shipping name that most precisely describes the dangerous goods.

title.en: - Classifying a Mixture or Solution
title.fr: - FR_Classifying a Mixture or Solution

title.en: 2.6 - A mixture or solution of substances that are not dangerous goods and one substance that is dangerous goods and that is listed by name in Schedule 1 has the classification shown for the dangerous goods in that Schedule if the mixture or solution is still dangerous goods in accordance with paragraph 2.1(a) and the mixture or solution is not identified by a shipping name in Schedule 1. However, if the classification for the dangerous goods does not precisely describe the mixture or solution but the mixture or solution meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods, then sections 2.4 and 2.5 must be used to determine its classification.
title.fr: 2.6 - FR_A mixture or solution of substances that are not dangerous goods and one substance that is dangerous goods and that is listed by name in Schedule 1 has the classification shown for the dangerous goods in that Schedule if the mixture or solution is still dangerous goods in accordance with paragraph 2.1(a) and the mixture or solution is not identified by a shipping name in Schedule 1. However, if the classification for the dangerous goods does not precisely describe the mixture or solution but the mixture or solution meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods, then sections 2.4 and 2.5 must be used to determine its classification.

title.en: - Marine Pollutants
title.fr: - FR_Marine Pollutants

title.en: 2.7 (1) - A substance is a marine pollutant if
title.fr: 2.7 (1) - FR_A substance is a marine pollutant if

title.en: 2.7 (1) (a) - the letter “P” (marine pollutant) is set out in column 4 of Schedule 3 for the substance; or
title.fr: 2.7 (1) (a) - FR_the letter “P” (marine pollutant) is set out in column 4 of Schedule 3 for the substance; or

title.en: 2.7 (1) (b) - the substance meets the criteria for classification as a marine pollutant in accordance with section 2.9.3 or chapter 2.10 of the IMDG Code.
title.fr: 2.7 (1) (b) - FR_the substance meets the criteria for classification as a marine pollutant in accordance with section 2.9.3 or chapter 2.10 of the IMDG Code.

title.en: - Precedence of Classes
title.fr: - FR_Precedence of Classes

title.en: 2.8 (1) - When dangerous goods meet the criteria for inclusion in more than one class but meet the criteria for inclusion in only one of the following classes, that one class is the primary class. The classes are
title.fr: 2.8 (1) - FR_When dangerous goods meet the criteria for inclusion in more than one class but meet the criteria for inclusion in only one of the following classes, that one class is the primary class. The classes are

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) - Class 1, Explosives, except for the following dangerous goods for which Class 1 is a subsidiary class:
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) - FR_Class 1, Explosives, except for the following dangerous goods for which Class 1 is a subsidiary class:

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (i) - UN3101, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, LIQUID,
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) (i) - FR_UN3101, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, LIQUID,

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (ii) - UN3102, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, SOLID,
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_UN3102, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, SOLID,

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (iii) - UN3111, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, LIQUID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED,
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) (iii) - FR_UN3111, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, LIQUID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED,

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (iv) - UN3112, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, SOLID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED,
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) (iv) - FR_UN3112, ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE B, SOLID, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED,

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (v) - UN3221, SELF-REACTIVE LIQUID TYPE B,
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) (v) - FR_UN3221, SELF-REACTIVE LIQUID TYPE B,

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (vi) - UN3222, SELF-REACTIVE SOLID TYPE B,
title.fr: 2.8 (1) (a) (vi) - FR_UN3222, SELF-REACTIVE SOLID TYPE B,

title.en: 2.8 (1) (a) (vii) - UN3231, SELF-REACTIVE LIQUID TYPE B, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLED, and

title.en: - Class 1, Explosives
title.fr: - FR_Class 1, Explosives

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.9 - Substances are included in Class 1, Explosives, if they are
title.fr: 2.9 - FR_Substances are included in Class 1, Explosives, if they are

title.en: 2.9 (a) - capable, by chemical reaction, of producing gas at a temperature, pressure and speed that would damage the surroundings; or
title.fr: 2.9 (a) - FR_capable, by chemical reaction, of producing gas at a temperature, pressure and speed that would damage the surroundings; or

title.en: 2.9 (b) - designed to produce an explosive or pyrotechnic effect by heat, light, sound, gas or smoke or a combination of those means as a result of non-detonative, self-sustaining exothermic chemical reactions.
title.fr: 2.9 (b) - FR_designed to produce an explosive or pyrotechnic effect by heat, light, sound, gas or smoke or a combination of those means as a result of non-detonative, self-sustaining exothermic chemical reactions.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.10 - Class 1, Explosives, has six divisions:
title.fr: 2.10 - FR_Class 1, Explosives, has six divisions:

title.en: 2.10 (a) - Class 1.1, mass explosion hazard;
title.fr: 2.10 (a) - FR_Class 1.1, mass explosion hazard;

title.en: 2.10 (b) - Class 1.2, projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard;
title.fr: 2.10 (b) - FR_Class 1.2, projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard;

title.en: 2.10 (c) - Class 1.3, fire hazard and either a minor blast hazard or a minor projection hazard or both but not a mass explosion hazard;
title.fr: 2.10 (c) - FR_Class 1.3, fire hazard and either a minor blast hazard or a minor projection hazard or both but not a mass explosion hazard;

title.en: 2.10 (d) - Class 1.4, no significant hazard beyond the package in the event of ignition or initiation during transport;
title.fr: 2.10 (d) - FR_Class 1.4, no significant hazard beyond the package in the event of ignition or initiation during transport;

title.en: 2.10 (e) - Class 1.5, very insensitive substances with a mass explosion hazard; and
title.fr: 2.10 (e) - FR_Class 1.5, very insensitive substances with a mass explosion hazard; and

title.en: 2.10 (f) - Class 1.6, extremely insensitive articles with no mass explosion hazard.
title.fr: 2.10 (f) - FR_Class 1.6, extremely insensitive articles with no mass explosion hazard.

title.en: - Compatibility Groups
title.fr: - FR_Compatibility Groups

title.en: 2.11 - Explosives are divided into 13 compatibility groups as described in Appendix 2, Description of Compatibility Groups, Class 1, Explosives, to this Part.
title.fr: 2.11 - FR_Explosives are divided into 13 compatibility groups as described in Appendix 2, Description of Compatibility Groups, Class 1, Explosives, to this Part.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.12 - Explosives are included in Packing Group II.
title.fr: 2.12 - FR_Explosives are included in Packing Group II.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.13 - A substance is included in Class 2, Gases, if it is
title.fr: 2.13 - FR_A substance is included in Class 2, Gases, if it is

title.en: 2.13 (a) - a gas included in one of the three divisions set out in section 2.14;
title.fr: 2.13 (a) - FR_a gas included in one of the three divisions set out in section 2.14;

title.en: 2.13 (b) - a mixture of gases;
title.fr: 2.13 (b) - FR_a mixture of gases;

title.en: 2.13 (c) - a mixture of one or more gases with one or more vapours of substances included in other classes;
title.fr: 2.13 (c) - FR_a mixture of one or more gases with one or more vapours of substances included in other classes;

title.en: 2.13 (d) - an article charged with a gas;
title.fr: 2.13 (d) - FR_an article charged with a gas;

title.en: 2.13 (e) - tellurium hexafluoride; or
title.fr: 2.13 (e) - FR_tellurium hexafluoride; or

title.en: 2.13 (f) - an aerosol.
title.fr: 2.13 (f) - FR_an aerosol.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.14 - Class 2, Gases, has three divisions:
title.fr: 2.14 - FR_Class 2, Gases, has three divisions:

title.en: 2.14 (a) - Class 2.1, Flammable Gases, which consists of gases that, at 20°C and an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa,
title.fr: 2.14 (a) - FR_Class 2.1, Flammable Gases, which consists of gases that, at 20°C and an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa,

title.en: 2.14 (a) (i) - are ignitable when in a mixture of 13% or less by volume with air, or
title.fr: 2.14 (a) (i) - FR_are ignitable when in a mixture of 13% or less by volume with air, or

title.en: 2.14 (a) (ii) - have a flammability range with air of at least 12 percentage points determined in accordance with tests or calculations in ISO 10156;
title.fr: 2.14 (a) (ii) - FR_have a flammability range with air of at least 12 percentage points determined in accordance with tests or calculations in ISO 10156;

title.en: 2.14 (b) - Class 2.2, Non-flammable and Non-toxic Gases, which consists of gases that are transported at an absolute pressure greater than or equal to 280 kPa at 20°C, or as refrigerated liquids, and that are not included in Class 2.1, Flammable Gases, or Class 2.3, Toxic Gases; and
title.fr: 2.14 (b) - FR_Class 2.2, Non-flammable and Non-toxic Gases, which consists of gases that are transported at an absolute pressure greater than or equal to 280 kPa at 20°C, or as refrigerated liquids, and that are not included in Class 2.1, Flammable Gases, or Class 2.3, Toxic Gases; and

title.en: 2.14 (c) - Class 2.3, Toxic Gases, which consists of gases that
title.fr: 2.14 (c) - FR_Class 2.3, Toxic Gases, which consists of gases that

title.en: 2.14 (c) (i) - are known to be toxic or corrosive to humans according to CGA P-20, ISO Standard 10298 or other documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications, or
title.fr: 2.14 (c) (i) - FR_are known to be toxic or corrosive to humans according to CGA P-20, ISO Standard 10298 or other documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications, or

title.en: 2.14 (c) (ii) - have an LC50 value less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3.
title.fr: 2.14 (c) (ii) - FR_have an LC50 value less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3.

title.en: - Aerosols
title.fr: - FR_Aerosols

title.en: 2.14.1 (1) - Dangerous goods contained in an aerosol container must be transported under UN1950, AEROSOLS.
title.fr: 2.14.1 (1) - FR_Dangerous goods contained in an aerosol container must be transported under UN1950, AEROSOLS.

title.en: 2.14.1 (2) - The dangerous goods are included
title.fr: 2.14.1 (2) - FR_The dangerous goods are included

title.en: 2.14.1 (2) (a) - in Class 2.1, Flammable Gases, if the dangerous goods contain at least 85% by mass of flammable components and the chemical heat of combustion is greater than or equal to 30 kJ/g; or
title.fr: 2.14.1 (2) (a) - FR_in Class 2.1, Flammable Gases, if the dangerous goods contain at least 85% by mass of flammable components and the chemical heat of combustion is greater than or equal to 30 kJ/g; or

title.en: 2.14.1 (2) (b) - in Class 2.2, Non-flammable and Non-toxic Gases, if the dangerous goods contain not more than 1% by mass of flammable components and the heat of combustion is less than 20 kJ/g.
title.fr: 2.14.1 (2) (b) - FR_in Class 2.2, Non-flammable and Non-toxic Gases, if the dangerous goods contain not more than 1% by mass of flammable components and the heat of combustion is less than 20 kJ/g.

title.en: 2.14.1 (3) - The dangerous goods must be classified in accordance with section 31 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria.
title.fr: 2.14.1 (3) - FR_The dangerous goods must be classified in accordance with section 31 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria.

title.en: 2.14.1 (4) - The dangerous goods must not contain gases included in Class 2.3, Toxic Gases.
title.fr: 2.14.1 (4) - FR_The dangerous goods must not contain gases included in Class 2.3, Toxic Gases.

title.en: 2.14.1 (5) - The dangerous goods must have a subsidiary class of 6.1, Toxic Substances, or Class 8, Corrosive Substances, if the dangerous goods – other than the propellant to be ejected from the aerosol container – are included in Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, Packing Groups II or III, or Class 8, Corrosive Substances, Packing Groups II or III.
title.fr: 2.14.1 (5) - FR_The dangerous goods must have a subsidiary class of 6.1, Toxic Substances, or Class 8, Corrosive Substances, if the dangerous goods – other than the propellant to be ejected from the aerosol container – are included in Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, Packing Groups II or III, or Class 8, Corrosive Substances, Packing Groups II or III.

title.en: 2.14.1 (6) - The dangerous goods are forbidden for transport when they are included in Packing Group I for toxicity or corrosiveness.
title.fr: 2.14.1 (6) - FR_The dangerous goods are forbidden for transport when they are included in Packing Group I for toxicity or corrosiveness.

title.en: - Exemption
title.fr: - FR_Exemption

title.en: 2.14.2 (1) - These Regulations, except for Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases) and Part 2 (Classification) do not apply to gases included in Class 2.2, Non-flammable and Non-toxic Gases that are contained
title.fr: 2.14.2 (1) - FR_These Regulations, except for Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases) and Part 2 (Classification) do not apply to gases included in Class 2.2, Non-flammable and Non-toxic Gases that are contained

title.en: 2.14.2 (1) (a) - in foodstuffs, including carbonated beverages other than UN1950;
title.fr: 2.14.2 (1) (a) - FR_in foodstuffs, including carbonated beverages other than UN1950;

title.en: 2.14.2 (1) (b) - in balls intended for use in sports;
title.fr: 2.14.2 (1) (b) - FR_in balls intended for use in sports;

title.en: 2.14.2 (1) (c) - in tires; or
title.fr: 2.14.2 (1) (c) - FR_in tires; or

title.en: 2.14.2 (1) (d) - in light bulbs.
title.fr: 2.14.2 (1) (d) - FR_in light bulbs.

title.en: 2.14.2 (2) - The exemption set out in paragraph (1)(d) applies only if the light bulbs are packaged so that any pieces of a ruptured bulb are contained by the packaging.
title.fr: 2.14.2 (2) - FR_The exemption set out in paragraph (1)(d) applies only if the light bulbs are packaged so that any pieces of a ruptured bulb are contained by the packaging.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.15 - There are no packing groups for Class 2, Gases.
title.fr: 2.15 - FR_There are no packing groups for Class 2, Gases.

title.en: - Determination of LC50
title.fr: - FR_Determination of LC50

title.en: 2.16 - LC50 values for a single or pure gas or for a mixture of gases must be determined
title.fr: 2.16 - FR_LC50 values for a single or pure gas or for a mixture of gases must be determined

title.en: 2.16 (a) - by using LC50 values published in CGA P-20, ISO Standard 10298, technical journals or government publications;
title.fr: 2.16 (a) - FR_by using LC50 values published in CGA P-20, ISO Standard 10298, technical journals or government publications;

title.en: 2.16 (b) - in accordance with paragraphs 2.2.3(b) and (c) of Chapter 2.2 of the UN Recommendations; or
title.fr: 2.16 (b) - FR_in accordance with paragraphs 2.2.3(b) and (c) of Chapter 2.2 of the UN Recommendations; or

title.en: 2.16 (c) - for a mixture of gases, in accordance with section 2.17.
title.fr: 2.16 (c) - FR_for a mixture of gases, in accordance with section 2.17.

title.en: - Determination of LC50 of a Mixture of Gases
title.fr: - FR_Determination of LC50 of a Mixture of Gases

title.en: 2.17 - To determine the LC50 of a mixture of gases when the LC50 of each of the gases is known, use 5 000 mL/m3 as the toxic limit and,
title.fr: 2.17 - FR_To determine the LC50 of a mixture of gases when the LC50 of each of the gases is known, use 5 000 mL/m3 as the toxic limit and,

title.en: 2.17 (a) - if the mixture contains only one gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Gas A”), use the following calculation:
title.fr: 2.17 (a) - FR_if the mixture contains only one gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Gas A”), use the following calculation:

title.en: 2.17 (a) - LC50 of the mixture = LC50 of Gas Afraction by volume of Gas A in the mixture
title.fr: 2.17 (a) - FR_LC50 of the mixture = LC50 of Gas Afraction by volume of Gas A in the mixture

title.en: 2.17 (b) - if the mixture contains more than one gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Gas A”, “Gas B”, etc.),
title.fr: 2.17 (b) - FR_if the mixture contains more than one gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Gas A”, “Gas B”, etc.),

title.en: 2.17 (b) (i) - determine the contributing number (CN) of each of the gases with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula
title.fr: 2.17 (b) (i) - FR_determine the contributing number (CN) of each of the gases with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula

title.en: 2.17 (b) (ii) - combine the contributing numbers (CN) of each gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula
title.fr: 2.17 (b) (ii) - FR_combine the contributing numbers (CN) of each gas with an LC50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula

title.en: 2.17 (b) (iii) - obtain the LC50 of the mixture by dividing 1 by the number T (LC50 of the mixture = 1 / T).
title.fr: 2.17 (b) (iii) - FR_obtain the LC50 of the mixture by dividing 1 by the number T (LC50 of the mixture = 1 / T).

title.en: - Class 3, Flammable Liquids
title.fr: - FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.18 (1) - Substances that are liquids or liquids containing solids in solution or suspension are included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they
title.fr: 2.18 (1) - FR_Substances that are liquids or liquids containing solids in solution or suspension are included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they

title.en: 2.18 (1) (a) - have a flash point less than or equal to 60ºC using the closed-cup test method referred to in Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations; or
title.fr: 2.18 (1) (a) - FR_have a flash point less than or equal to 60ºC using the closed-cup test method referred to in Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations; or

title.en: 2.18 (1) (b) - are intended or expected to be at a temperature that is greater than or equal to their flash point at any time while the substances are in transport.
title.fr: 2.18 (1) (b) - FR_are intended or expected to be at a temperature that is greater than or equal to their flash point at any time while the substances are in transport.

title.en: 2.18 (2) - Despite paragraph (1)(a), liquids that have a flash point greater than 35°C are not included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they
title.fr: 2.18 (2) - FR_Despite paragraph (1)(a), liquids that have a flash point greater than 35°C are not included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, if they

title.en: 2.18 (2) (a) - do not sustain combustion, as determined in accordance with the sustained combustibility test referred to in section 2.3.1.3 of Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations;
title.fr: 2.18 (2) (a) - FR_do not sustain combustion, as determined in accordance with the sustained combustibility test referred to in section 2.3.1.3 of Chapter 2.3 of the UN Recommendations;

title.en: 2.18 (2) (b) - have a fire point greater than 100°C, as determined in accordance with ISO 2592; or
title.fr: 2.18 (2) (b) - FR_have a fire point greater than 100°C, as determined in accordance with ISO 2592; or

title.en: 2.18 (2) (c) - are water-miscible solutions with a water content greater than 90% by mass.
title.fr: 2.18 (2) (c) - FR_are water-miscible solutions with a water content greater than 90% by mass.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.19 (1) - Flammable liquids included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.19 (1) - FR_Flammable liquids included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.19 (1) (a) - Packing Group I, if they have an initial boiling point of 35°C or less at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and any flash point;
title.fr: 2.19 (1) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if they have an initial boiling point of 35°C or less at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and any flash point;

title.en: 2.19 (1) (b) - Packing Group II, if they have an initial boiling point greater than 35°C at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and a flash point less than 23°C; or
title.fr: 2.19 (1) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if they have an initial boiling point greater than 35°C at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and a flash point less than 23°C; or

title.en: 2.19 (1) (c) - Packing Group III, if the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
title.fr: 2.19 (1) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.

title.en: 2.19 (2) - Despite subsection (1), for dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids,
title.fr: 2.19 (2) - FR_Despite subsection (1), for dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids,

title.en: 2.19 (2) (a) - when the packing group is unknown, the consignor may include the dangerous goods in Packing Group I; or
title.fr: 2.19 (2) (a) - FR_when the packing group is unknown, the consignor may include the dangerous goods in Packing Group I; or

title.en: 2.19 (2) (b) - when the packing group is reasonably believed or is known to be Packing Group II or III, the consignor may include the dangerous goods in Packing Group II but, if the substance has the same characteristics as UN1203, GASOLINE, it may also be transported as Packing Group II.
title.fr: 2.19 (2) (b) - FR_when the packing group is reasonably believed or is known to be Packing Group II or III, the consignor may include the dangerous goods in Packing Group II but, if the substance has the same characteristics as UN1203, GASOLINE, it may also be transported as Packing Group II.

title.en: 2.19 (3) - Despite paragraph (1)(b), a viscous flammable liquid that has a flash point less than 23°C may be included in Packing Group III if
title.fr: 2.19 (3) - FR_Despite paragraph (1)(b), a viscous flammable liquid that has a flash point less than 23°C may be included in Packing Group III if

title.en: 2.19 (3) (a) - the liquid or any separated solvent does not meet the criteria for inclusion in Class 6.1 or Class 8;
title.fr: 2.19 (3) (a) - FR_the liquid or any separated solvent does not meet the criteria for inclusion in Class 6.1 or Class 8;

title.en: 2.19 (3) (b) - less than 3% of the clear solvent layer separates when the solvent separation test set out in subsection 32.5.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria is carried out;
title.fr: 2.19 (3) (b) - FR_less than 3% of the clear solvent layer separates when the solvent separation test set out in subsection 32.5.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria is carried out;

title.en: 2.19 (3) (c) - the viscosity and flash-point of the liquid are in accordance with the table to this subsection; and
title.fr: 2.19 (3) (c) - FR_the viscosity and flash-point of the liquid are in accordance with the table to this subsection; and

title.en: 2.19 (3) (d) - the viscosity test is carried out in accordance with the procedure set out in subsection 32.4 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria or the procedure set out in ISO 2431.
title.fr: 2.19 (3) (d) - FR_the viscosity test is carried out in accordance with the procedure set out in subsection 32.4 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria or the procedure set out in ISO 2431.

title.en: 2.19 (3.1) - If a liquid referred to in subsection (3) is a non-Newtonian substance or a flow cup method of viscosity determination is unsuitable, a variable shear-rate viscometer must be used to determine the dynamic viscosity coefficient of the liquid, at 23°C, at a number of shear rates. The values obtained must be plotted against shear rate and then extrapolated to zero shear rate. The dynamic viscosity value thus obtained, divided by the density, gives the apparent kinematic viscosity at near-zero shear rate.
title.fr: 2.19 (3.1) - FR_If a liquid referred to in subsection (3) is a non-Newtonian substance or a flow cup method of viscosity determination is unsuitable, a variable shear-rate viscometer must be used to determine the dynamic viscosity coefficient of the liquid, at 23°C, at a number of shear rates. The values obtained must be plotted against shear rate and then extrapolated to zero shear rate. The dynamic viscosity value thus obtained, divided by the density, gives the apparent kinematic viscosity at near-zero shear rate.

title.en: - Class 4, Flammable Solids; Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion; Substances That on Contact with Water Emit Flammable Gases (Water-reactive Substances)
title.fr: - FR_Class 4, Flammable Solids; Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion; Substances That on Contact with Water Emit Flammable Gases (Water-reactive Substances)

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.20 - Substances are included in Class 4 if they are flammable solids, substances liable to spontaneous combustion or substances that on contact with water emit flammable gases (water-reactive substances) and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions and packing groups of Class 4.
title.fr: 2.20 - FR_Substances are included in Class 4 if they are flammable solids, substances liable to spontaneous combustion or substances that on contact with water emit flammable gases (water-reactive substances) and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions and packing groups of Class 4.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.21 (1) - Class 4 has three divisions:
title.fr: 2.21 (1) - FR_Class 4 has three divisions:

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) - Class 4.1, Flammable Solids, which consists of substances that are
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) - FR_Class 4.1, Flammable Solids, which consists of substances that are

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (i) - readily combustible, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.2.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations,
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (i) - FR_readily combustible, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.2.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations,

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (ii) - under normal conditions of transport, liable to cause fire through friction,
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_under normal conditions of transport, liable to cause fire through friction,

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (iii) - solid desensitized explosives, which are solid explosives desensitized through wetting with water or alcohols or diluted with other substances to form a homogeneous solid mixture to suppress their explosive properties so that they are not included in Class 1, Explosives,
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (iii) - FR_solid desensitized explosives, which are solid explosives desensitized through wetting with water or alcohols or diluted with other substances to form a homogeneous solid mixture to suppress their explosive properties so that they are not included in Class 1, Explosives,

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) - self-reactive substances that are liable to undergo a strongly exothermic decomposition even without the participation of oxygen (air), as determined in accordance with section 2.4.2.3 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, but Class 4.1 does not include substances that have
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) - FR_self-reactive substances that are liable to undergo a strongly exothermic decomposition even without the participation of oxygen (air), as determined in accordance with section 2.4.2.3 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, but Class 4.1 does not include substances that have

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) (A) - a primary class of Class 1, Explosives, Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, or Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides,
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) (A) - FR_a primary class of Class 1, Explosives, Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, or Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides,

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) (B) - a heat of decomposition less than 300 J/g, or
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) (B) - FR_a heat of decomposition less than 300 J/g, or

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) (C) - a self-accelerating decomposition temperature (SADT) that is greater than 75°C for a 50 kg means of containment, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.2.3.4 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations,
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv) (C) - FR_a self-accelerating decomposition temperature (SADT) that is greater than 75°C for a 50 kg means of containment, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.2.3.4 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations,

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv.1) - polymerizing substances that, without stabilization, are liable to undergo a strongly exothermic reaction resulting in the formation of larger molecules or resulting in the formation of polymers under conditions normally encountered in transport,
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (iv.1) - FR_polymerizing substances that, without stabilization, are liable to undergo a strongly exothermic reaction resulting in the formation of larger molecules or resulting in the formation of polymers under conditions normally encountered in transport,

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (v) - identified by one of the following UN numbers: UN2956, UN3241, UN3242 or UN3251, or
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (v) - FR_identified by one of the following UN numbers: UN2956, UN3241, UN3242 or UN3251, or

title.en: 2.21 (1) (a) (vi) - are in the list of currently assigned self-reactive substances in section 2.4.2.3.2.3 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations;
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (a) (vi) - FR_are in the list of currently assigned self-reactive substances in section 2.4.2.3.2.3 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations;

title.en: 2.21 (1) (b) - Class 4.2, Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion, which consists of
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (b) - FR_Class 4.2, Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion, which consists of

title.en: 2.21 (1) (b) (i) - pyrophoric substances that spontaneously ignite within 5 minutes after coming into contact with air, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.3.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, and
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (b) (i) - FR_pyrophoric substances that spontaneously ignite within 5 minutes after coming into contact with air, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.3.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, and

title.en: 2.21 (1) (b) (ii) - self-heating substances that, when in large amounts (kilograms), spontaneously ignite on contact with air after long periods (hours or days), as determined in accordance with section 2.4.3.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations; and
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_self-heating substances that, when in large amounts (kilograms), spontaneously ignite on contact with air after long periods (hours or days), as determined in accordance with section 2.4.3.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations; and

title.en: 2.21 (1) (c) - Class 4.3, Water-reactive Substances, which consists of substances that, in tests performed in accordance with section 2.4.4.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, emit a flammable gas at a rate greater than 1 L/kg of substance per hour or spontaneously ignite at any step in the test procedure.
title.fr: 2.21 (1) (c) - FR_Class 4.3, Water-reactive Substances, which consists of substances that, in tests performed in accordance with section 2.4.4.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, emit a flammable gas at a rate greater than 1 L/kg of substance per hour or spontaneously ignite at any step in the test procedure.

title.en: 2.21 (2) - For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(a)(iv.1), a substance is considered to be a polymerizing substance of Class 4.1 if it
title.fr: 2.21 (2) - FR_For the purposes of subparagraph (1)(a)(iv.1), a substance is considered to be a polymerizing substance of Class 4.1 if it

title.en: 2.21 (2) (a) - has a self-accelerating polymerization temperature (SAPT) that is less than or equal to 75°C under the conditions in which the substance or mixture is to be transported, with or without chemical stabilization as offered for transport, and in the means of containment in which the substance or mixture is to be transported;
title.fr: 2.21 (2) (a) - FR_has a self-accelerating polymerization temperature (SAPT) that is less than or equal to 75°C under the conditions in which the substance or mixture is to be transported, with or without chemical stabilization as offered for transport, and in the means of containment in which the substance or mixture is to be transported;

title.en: 2.21 (2) (b) - exhibits a heat of reaction of more than 300 J/g; and
title.fr: 2.21 (2) (b) - FR_exhibits a heat of reaction of more than 300 J/g; and

title.en: 2.21 (2) (c) - does not meet any other criteria for inclusion in Classes 1 to 8.
title.fr: 2.21 (2) (c) - FR_does not meet any other criteria for inclusion in Classes 1 to 8.

title.en: - Polymerizing Substances
title.fr: - FR_Polymerizing Substances

title.en: 2.21.1 - A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport the following polymerizing substances unless they are stabilized by temperature control:
title.fr: 2.21.1 - FR_A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport the following polymerizing substances unless they are stabilized by temperature control:

title.en: 2.21.1 (a) - polymerizing substance that is in a small means of containment prescribed by TP 14850 or Chapter 6.1 of the UN Recommendations or in an intermediate bulk container (IBC) and whose self-accelerating polymerization temperature (SAPT) is 50°C or less in the small means of containment or IBC; and
title.fr: 2.21.1 (a) - FR_polymerizing substance that is in a small means of containment prescribed by TP 14850 or Chapter 6.1 of the UN Recommendations or in an intermediate bulk container (IBC) and whose self-accelerating polymerization temperature (SAPT) is 50°C or less in the small means of containment or IBC; and

title.en: 2.21.1 (b) - a polymerizing substance that is in a large means of containment that is not an IBC and whose SAPT is 45°C or less in the large means of containment.
title.fr: 2.21.1 (b) - FR_a polymerizing substance that is in a large means of containment that is not an IBC and whose SAPT is 45°C or less in the large means of containment.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.22 (1) - Substances included in Class 4.1, Flammable Solids, are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.22 (1) - FR_Substances included in Class 4.1, Flammable Solids, are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.22 (1) (a) - Packing Group I, if the substances meet the criterion in subparagraph 2.21(1)(a)(iii), except that substances that have one of the following UN numbers are included in Packing Group II: UN2555, UN2556, UN2557, UN2907, UN3270, UN3319 or UN3344;
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if the substances meet the criterion in subparagraph 2.21(1)(a)(iii), except that substances that have one of the following UN numbers are included in Packing Group II: UN2555, UN2556, UN2557, UN2907, UN3270, UN3319 or UN3344;

title.en: 2.22 (1) (b) - Packing Group II, if
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if

title.en: 2.22 (1) (b) (i) - the substances meet the criteria for inclusion in Class 4.1 in subparagraph 2.21(1)(a)(iv) or (v), except that substances that have one of the following UN numbers are included in Packing Group III: UN2956, UN3241 or UN3251,
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (b) (i) - FR_the substances meet the criteria for inclusion in Class 4.1 in subparagraph 2.21(1)(a)(iv) or (v), except that substances that have one of the following UN numbers are included in Packing Group III: UN2956, UN3241 or UN3251,

title.en: 2.22 (1) (b) (ii) - in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria for readily combustible solids, excluding metal powders, the burning time of the substances is less than 45 seconds and the flame passes the wetted zone, or
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria for readily combustible solids, excluding metal powders, the burning time of the substances is less than 45 seconds and the flame passes the wetted zone, or

title.en: 2.22 (1) (b) (iii) - in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria, for readily combustible solids that are powders of metals or metal alloys, the zone of reaction of the substances spreads over the whole length of the sample in 5 minutes or less; or
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria, for readily combustible solids that are powders of metals or metal alloys, the zone of reaction of the substances spreads over the whole length of the sample in 5 minutes or less; or

title.en: 2.22 (1) (c) - Packing Group III, if
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if

title.en: 2.22 (1) (c) (i) - in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria, for readily combustible solids, excluding metal powders, the burning time of the substances is less than 45 seconds and the wetted zone stops the flame propagation for at least 4 minutes,
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (c) (i) - FR_in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria, for readily combustible solids, excluding metal powders, the burning time of the substances is less than 45 seconds and the wetted zone stops the flame propagation for at least 4 minutes,

title.en: 2.22 (1) (c) (ii) - in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria, for readily combustible solids that are powders of metals or metal alloys, the zone of reaction of the substances spreads over the whole length of the sample in more than 5 minutes but not more than 10 minutes, or
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (c) (ii) - FR_in tests referred to in section 33.2.1 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria, for readily combustible solids that are powders of metals or metal alloys, the zone of reaction of the substances spreads over the whole length of the sample in more than 5 minutes but not more than 10 minutes, or

title.en: 2.22 (1) (c) (iii) - the substances are solids that are liable to cause fire through friction.
title.fr: 2.22 (1) (c) (iii) - FR_the substances are solids that are liable to cause fire through friction.

title.en: 2.22 (2) - Substances included in Class 4.2, Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion, are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.22 (2) - FR_Substances included in Class 4.2, Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion, are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.22 (2) (a) - Packing Group I, if the substances are pyrophoric solids or liquids;
title.fr: 2.22 (2) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if the substances are pyrophoric solids or liquids;

title.en: 2.22 (2) (b) - Packing Group II, if the substances are self-heating substances that give a positive result, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.3.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations using a 25 mm sample cube at 140°C; or
title.fr: 2.22 (2) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if the substances are self-heating substances that give a positive result, as determined in accordance with section 2.4.3.2 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations using a 25 mm sample cube at 140°C; or

title.en: 2.22 (2) (c) - Packing Group III for all other substances.
title.fr: 2.22 (2) (c) - FR_Packing Group III for all other substances.

title.en: 2.22 (3) - Substances included in Class 4.3, Water-reactive Substances, are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.22 (3) - FR_Substances included in Class 4.3, Water-reactive Substances, are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.22 (3) (a) - Packing Group I, if the substances
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if the substances

title.en: 2.22 (3) (a) (i) - react vigorously with water at ambient temperatures and demonstrate a tendency for the gas produced to ignite spontaneously, or
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (a) (i) - FR_react vigorously with water at ambient temperatures and demonstrate a tendency for the gas produced to ignite spontaneously, or

title.en: 2.22 (3) (a) (ii) - react readily with water at ambient temperatures so that the rate of evolution of flammable gas is greater than or equal to 10 L/kg of substance over any one minute;
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (a) (ii) - FR_react readily with water at ambient temperatures so that the rate of evolution of flammable gas is greater than or equal to 10 L/kg of substance over any one minute;

title.en: 2.22 (3) (b) - Packing Group II, if
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if

title.en: 2.22 (3) (b) (i) - the substances react readily with water at ambient temperatures so that the rate of evolution of flammable gas is greater than or equal to 20 L/kg of substance per hour, and
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (b) (i) - FR_the substances react readily with water at ambient temperatures so that the rate of evolution of flammable gas is greater than or equal to 20 L/kg of substance per hour, and

title.en: 2.22 (3) (b) (ii) - the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met; or
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (b) (ii) - FR_the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met; or

title.en: 2.22 (3) (c) - Packing Group III, if
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if

title.en: 2.22 (3) (c) (i) - the substances react slowly with water at ambient temperatures so that the rate of evolution of flammable gas is greater than or equal to 1 L/kg of substance per hour, and
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (c) (i) - FR_the substances react slowly with water at ambient temperatures so that the rate of evolution of flammable gas is greater than or equal to 1 L/kg of substance per hour, and

title.en: 2.22 (3) (c) (ii) - the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
title.fr: 2.22 (3) (c) (ii) - FR_the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.

title.en: - Class 5, Oxidizing Substances and Organic Peroxides
title.fr: - FR_Class 5, Oxidizing Substances and Organic Peroxides

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.23 - Substances are included in Class 5 if they are oxidizing substances or organic peroxides and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions of Class 5.
title.fr: 2.23 - FR_Substances are included in Class 5 if they are oxidizing substances or organic peroxides and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions of Class 5.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.24 - Class 5 has two divisions:
title.fr: 2.24 - FR_Class 5 has two divisions:

title.en: 2.24 (a) - Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, which consists of substances that yield oxygen thereby causing or contributing to the combustion of other material, as determined in accordance with section 2.5.2 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations; and
title.fr: 2.24 (a) - FR_Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, which consists of substances that yield oxygen thereby causing or contributing to the combustion of other material, as determined in accordance with section 2.5.2 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations; and

title.en: 2.24 (b) - Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, which consists of substances that
title.fr: 2.24 (b) - FR_Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, which consists of substances that

title.en: 2.24 (b) (i) - are thermally unstable organic compounds that contain oxygen in the bivalent “-O-O-” structure, as determined in accordance with section 2.5.3 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations,
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (i) - FR_are thermally unstable organic compounds that contain oxygen in the bivalent “-O-O-” structure, as determined in accordance with section 2.5.3 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations,

title.en: 2.24 (b) (ii) - are liable to undergo exothermic self-accelerating decomposition,
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (ii) - FR_are liable to undergo exothermic self-accelerating decomposition,

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iii) - have one or more of the following characteristics:
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iii) - FR_have one or more of the following characteristics:

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iii) (A) - they are liable to explosive decomposition,
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iii) (A) - FR_they are liable to explosive decomposition,

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iii) (B) - they burn rapidly,
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iii) (B) - FR_they burn rapidly,

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iii) (C) - they are sensitive to impact or friction,
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iii) (C) - FR_they are sensitive to impact or friction,

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iii) (D) - they react dangerously with other substances, or
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iii) (D) - FR_they react dangerously with other substances, or

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iii) (E) - they cause damage to the eyes, or
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iii) (E) - FR_they cause damage to the eyes, or

title.en: 2.24 (b) (iv) - are in the list of currently assigned organic peroxides in section 2.5.3.2.4 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 2.24 (b) (iv) - FR_are in the list of currently assigned organic peroxides in section 2.5.3.2.4 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.25 (1) - The packing group for a substance that is included in Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, must be determined by using a test sample of the substance that
title.fr: 2.25 (1) - FR_The packing group for a substance that is included in Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, must be determined by using a test sample of the substance that

title.en: 2.25 (1) (a) - in the case of a solid, is prepared in accordance with section 2.5.2.2 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations; and
title.fr: 2.25 (1) (a) - FR_in the case of a solid, is prepared in accordance with section 2.5.2.2 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations; and

title.en: 2.25 (1) (b) - in the case of a liquid, is prepared in accordance with section 2.5.2.3 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 2.25 (1) (b) - FR_in the case of a liquid, is prepared in accordance with section 2.5.2.3 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: 2.25 (2) - In the case of a solid substance included in Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, the test procedure set out in either subsection 34.4.1 (test O.1) or subsection 34.4.3 (test O.3) of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria must be carried out on the test sample. The substance is included in
title.fr: 2.25 (2) - FR_In the case of a solid substance included in Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, the test procedure set out in either subsection 34.4.1 (test O.1) or subsection 34.4.3 (test O.3) of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria must be carried out on the test sample. The substance is included in

title.en: 2.25 (2) (a) - Packing Group I, if the test sample exhibits an average burning time that is
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if the test sample exhibits an average burning time that is

title.en: 2.25 (2) (a) (i) - less than the mean burning time of a 3:2 potassium bromate/cellulose mixture by mass when test O.1 is used, or
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (a) (i) - FR_less than the mean burning time of a 3:2 potassium bromate/cellulose mixture by mass when test O.1 is used, or

title.en: 2.25 (2) (a) (ii) - greater than the mean burning rate of a 3:1 calcium peroxide/cellulose mixture by mass when test O.3 is used;
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (a) (ii) - FR_greater than the mean burning rate of a 3:1 calcium peroxide/cellulose mixture by mass when test O.3 is used;

title.en: 2.25 (2) (b) - Packing Group II, if the criteria for Packing Group I are not met and the test sample exhibits an average burning time that is
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if the criteria for Packing Group I are not met and the test sample exhibits an average burning time that is

title.en: 2.25 (2) (b) (i) - less than or equal to the mean burning time of a 2:3 potassium bromate/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.1 is used, or
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (b) (i) - FR_less than or equal to the mean burning time of a 2:3 potassium bromate/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.1 is used, or

title.en: 2.25 (2) (b) (ii) - equal to or greater than the mean burning rate of a 1:1 calcium peroxide/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.3 is used; or
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (b) (ii) - FR_equal to or greater than the mean burning rate of a 1:1 calcium peroxide/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.3 is used; or

title.en: 2.25 (2) (c) - Packing Group III, if the criteria for Packing Groups I and II are not met and the test sample exhibits an average burning time that is
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if the criteria for Packing Groups I and II are not met and the test sample exhibits an average burning time that is

title.en: 2.25 (2) (c) (i) - less than or equal to the mean burning time of a 3:7 potassium bromate/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.1 is used, or
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (c) (i) - FR_less than or equal to the mean burning time of a 3:7 potassium bromate/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.1 is used, or

title.en: 2.25 (2) (c) (ii) - equal to or greater than the mean burning rate of a 1:2 calcium peroxide/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.3 is used.
title.fr: 2.25 (2) (c) (ii) - FR_equal to or greater than the mean burning rate of a 1:2 calcium peroxide/cellulose mixture by mass, when test O.3 is used.

title.en: 2.25 (2.1) - In the case of a liquid substance included in Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, the test procedure set out in sub-section 34.4.2 (test O.2) of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria must be carried out on the test sample. The substance is included in
title.fr: 2.25 (2.1) - FR_In the case of a liquid substance included in Class 5.1, Oxidizing Substances, the test procedure set out in sub-section 34.4.2 (test O.2) of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria must be carried out on the test sample. The substance is included in

title.en: 2.25 (2.1) (a) - Packing Group I, if the test sample in a 1:1 mixture by mass of substance and cellulose spontaneously ignites or the mean pressure rise time is less than that of a 1:1 mixture by mass of 50% perchloric acid and cellulose;
title.fr: 2.25 (2.1) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if the test sample in a 1:1 mixture by mass of substance and cellulose spontaneously ignites or the mean pressure rise time is less than that of a 1:1 mixture by mass of 50% perchloric acid and cellulose;

title.en: 2.25 (2.1) (b) - Packing Group II, if the mean pressure rise time is less than or equal to the mean pressure rise time of a 1:1 mixture by mass of 40% aqueous sodium chlorate solution and cellulose and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met; or
title.fr: 2.25 (2.1) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if the mean pressure rise time is less than or equal to the mean pressure rise time of a 1:1 mixture by mass of 40% aqueous sodium chlorate solution and cellulose and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met; or

title.en: 2.25 (2.1) (c) - Packing Group III, if the mean pressure rise time is less than or equal to the mean pressure rise time of a 1:1 mixture by mass of 65% aqueous nitric acid solution and cellulose and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
title.fr: 2.25 (2.1) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if the mean pressure rise time is less than or equal to the mean pressure rise time of a 1:1 mixture by mass of 65% aqueous nitric acid solution and cellulose and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.

title.en: 2.25 (3) - Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, are included in Packing Group II.
title.fr: 2.25 (3) - FR_Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, are included in Packing Group II.

title.en: 2.25 (4) - The type, B to F, of organic peroxides must be determined in accordance with section 2.5.3.3 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 2.25 (4) - FR_The type, B to F, of organic peroxides must be determined in accordance with section 2.5.3.3 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: - Class 6, Toxic and Infectious Substances
title.fr: - FR_Class 6, Toxic and Infectious Substances

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.26 - Substances are included in Class 6 if they are
title.fr: 2.26 - FR_Substances are included in Class 6 if they are

title.en: 2.26 (a) - liable to cause death or serious injury or to harm human health if swallowed or inhaled or if they come into contact with human skin; or
title.fr: 2.26 (a) - FR_liable to cause death or serious injury or to harm human health if swallowed or inhaled or if they come into contact with human skin; or

title.en: 2.26 (b) - infectious substances.
title.fr: 2.26 (b) - FR_infectious substances.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.27 - Class 6 has two divisions:
title.fr: 2.27 - FR_Class 6 has two divisions:

title.en: 2.27 (a) - Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, which consists of substances that are liable to cause death or serious injury or to harm human health if swallowed or inhaled or if they come into contact with human skin; and
title.fr: 2.27 (a) - FR_Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, which consists of substances that are liable to cause death or serious injury or to harm human health if swallowed or inhaled or if they come into contact with human skin; and

title.en: 2.27 (b) - Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, which consists of infectious substances.
title.fr: 2.27 (b) - FR_Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, which consists of infectious substances.

title.en: - Criteria for Inclusion in Class 6.1, Toxic Substances
title.fr: - FR_Criteria for Inclusion in Class 6.1, Toxic Substances

title.en: 2.28 - A substance is included in Class 6.1
title.fr: 2.28 - FR_A substance is included in Class 6.1

title.en: 2.28 (a) - due to oral toxicity if its LD50 (oral) is less than or equal to 300 mg/kg;
title.fr: 2.28 (a) - FR_due to oral toxicity if its LD50 (oral) is less than or equal to 300 mg/kg;

title.en: 2.28 (b) - due to dermal toxicity if its LD50 (dermal) is less than or equal to 1 000 mg/kg; or
title.fr: 2.28 (b) - FR_due to dermal toxicity if its LD50 (dermal) is less than or equal to 1 000 mg/kg; or

title.en: 2.28 (c) - due to inhalation toxicity
title.fr: 2.28 (c) - FR_due to inhalation toxicity

title.en: 2.28 (c) (i) - by dust or mist if dust or mist is likely to be produced in a transport accident and its LC50 (inhalation) is less than or equal to 4 mg/L, or
title.fr: 2.28 (c) (i) - FR_by dust or mist if dust or mist is likely to be produced in a transport accident and its LC50 (inhalation) is less than or equal to 4 mg/L, or

title.en: 2.28 (c) (ii) - by vapour if its LC50 (inhalation) is less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3.
title.fr: 2.28 (c) (ii) - FR_by vapour if its LC50 (inhalation) is less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.29 (1) - When a substance is known to be included in Class 6.1 and that knowledge is based on documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications and testing is not done to determine the packing group, the substance must be included in Packing Group I.
