title.fr: 2.29 (1) - FR_When a substance is known to be included in Class 6.1 and that knowledge is based on documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications and testing is not done to determine the packing group, the substance must be included in Packing Group I.

title.en: 2.29 (2) - Substances that are included in Class 6.1 due to
title.fr: 2.29 (2) - FR_Substances that are included in Class 6.1 due to

title.en: 2.29 (2) (a) - oral toxicity are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (a) - FR_oral toxicity are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.29 (2) (a) (i) - Packing Group I, if the LD50 (oral) is less than or equal to 5 mg/kg,
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (a) (i) - FR_Packing Group I, if the LD50 (oral) is less than or equal to 5 mg/kg,

title.en: 2.29 (2) (a) (ii) - Packing Group II, if the LD50 (oral) is greater than 5 mg/kg but less than or equal to 50 mg/kg, or
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (a) (ii) - FR_Packing Group II, if the LD50 (oral) is greater than 5 mg/kg but less than or equal to 50 mg/kg, or

title.en: 2.29 (2) (a) (iii) - Packing Group III, if the LD50 (oral) is greater than 50 mg/kg but less than or equal to 300 mg/kg;
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (a) (iii) - FR_Packing Group III, if the LD50 (oral) is greater than 50 mg/kg but less than or equal to 300 mg/kg;

title.en: 2.29 (2) (b) - dermal toxicity are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (b) - FR_dermal toxicity are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.29 (2) (b) (i) - Packing Group I if the LD50 (dermal) is less than or equal to 50 mg/kg,
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (b) (i) - FR_Packing Group I if the LD50 (dermal) is less than or equal to 50 mg/kg,

title.en: 2.29 (2) (b) (ii) - Packing Group II if the LD50 (dermal) is greater than 50 mg/kg but less than or equal to 200 mg/kg, or
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (b) (ii) - FR_Packing Group II if the LD50 (dermal) is greater than 50 mg/kg but less than or equal to 200 mg/kg, or

title.en: 2.29 (2) (b) (iii) - Packing Group III if the LD50 (dermal) is greater than 200 mg/kg but less than or equal to 1 000 mg/kg;
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (b) (iii) - FR_Packing Group III if the LD50 (dermal) is greater than 200 mg/kg but less than or equal to 1 000 mg/kg;

title.en: 2.29 (2) (c) - inhalation toxicity by dust or mist are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (c) - FR_inhalation toxicity by dust or mist are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.29 (2) (c) (i) - Packing Group I if the LC50 (inhalation) is less than or equal to 0.2 mg/L,
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (c) (i) - FR_Packing Group I if the LC50 (inhalation) is less than or equal to 0.2 mg/L,

title.en: 2.29 (2) (c) (ii) - Packing Group II if the LC50 (inhalation) is greater than 0.2 mg/L but less than or equal to 2 mg/L, or
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (c) (ii) - FR_Packing Group II if the LC50 (inhalation) is greater than 0.2 mg/L but less than or equal to 2 mg/L, or

title.en: 2.29 (2) (c) (iii) - Packing Group III if the LC50 (inhalation) is greater than 2 mg/L but less than or equal to 4 mg/L; or
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (c) (iii) - FR_Packing Group III if the LC50 (inhalation) is greater than 2 mg/L but less than or equal to 4 mg/L; or

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) - inhalation toxicity by vapour are included in one of the following packing groups, where “V” is the saturated vapour concentration in millilitres per cubic metre of air at 20°C and at 101.3 kPa:
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) - FR_inhalation toxicity by vapour are included in one of the following packing groups, where “V” is the saturated vapour concentration in millilitres per cubic metre of air at 20°C and at 101.3 kPa:

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (i) - Packing Group I, if
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (i) - FR_Packing Group I, if

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (i) (A) - V is greater than or equal to 10 multiplied by the LC50, and
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (i) (A) - FR_V is greater than or equal to 10 multiplied by the LC50, and

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (i) (B) - the LC50 is less than or equal to 1 000 mL/m3,
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (i) (B) - FR_the LC50 is less than or equal to 1 000 mL/m3,

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) - Packing Group II, if
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) - FR_Packing Group II, if

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) (A) - V is greater than or equal to the LC50,
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) (A) - FR_V is greater than or equal to the LC50,

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) (B) - the LC50 is less than or equal to 3 000 mL/m3, and
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) (B) - FR_the LC50 is less than or equal to 3 000 mL/m3, and

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) (C) - the criteria for Packing Group I are not met, or
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (ii) (C) - FR_the criteria for Packing Group I are not met, or

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) - Packing Group III, if
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) - FR_Packing Group III, if

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) (A) - V is greater than or equal to 0.2 multiplied by the LC50,
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) (A) - FR_V is greater than or equal to 0.2 multiplied by the LC50,

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) (B) - the LC50 is less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3, and
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) (B) - FR_the LC50 is less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3, and

title.en: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) (C) - the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
title.fr: 2.29 (2) (d) (iii) (C) - FR_the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.

title.en: - Determination of LD50 (oral or dermal)
title.fr: - FR_Determination of LD50 (oral or dermal)

title.en: 2.30 - LD50 (oral or dermal) values for solid or liquid substances or for a mixture of solid or liquid substances must be determined
title.fr: 2.30 - FR_LD50 (oral or dermal) values for solid or liquid substances or for a mixture of solid or liquid substances must be determined

title.en: 2.30 (a) - by using the LD50 values published in technical journals or in government publications;
title.fr: 2.30 (a) - FR_by using the LD50 values published in technical journals or in government publications;

title.en: 2.30 (b) - in accordance with section 2.6.2.3 of Chapter 2.6 of the UN Recommendations; or
title.fr: 2.30 (b) - FR_in accordance with section 2.6.2.3 of Chapter 2.6 of the UN Recommendations; or

title.en: 2.30 (c) - for a mixture of solid or liquid substances, in accordance with section 2.31.
title.fr: 2.30 (c) - FR_for a mixture of solid or liquid substances, in accordance with section 2.31.

title.en: - Determination of LD50 (oral or dermal) of a Mixture of Substances
title.fr: - FR_Determination of LD50 (oral or dermal) of a Mixture of Substances

title.en: 2.31 - To determine the LD50 of a mixture of solid or liquid substances when the LD50 of each of the substances is known, use 1 000 mg/kg as the toxic limit and
title.fr: 2.31 - FR_To determine the LD50 of a mixture of solid or liquid substances when the LD50 of each of the substances is known, use 1 000 mg/kg as the toxic limit and

title.en: 2.31 (a) - if the mixture contains only one substance with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Substance A”), use the following calculation:
title.fr: 2.31 (a) - FR_if the mixture contains only one substance with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Substance A”), use the following calculation:

title.en: 2.31 (a) - LD50 of the mixture = LD50 of Substance Afraction by mass of Substance A in the mixture
title.fr: 2.31 (a) - FR_LD50 of the mixture = LD50 of Substance Afraction by mass of Substance A in the mixture

title.en: 2.31 (b) - if the mixture contains more than one substance with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Substance A”, “Substance B”, etc.),
title.fr: 2.31 (b) - FR_if the mixture contains more than one substance with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit (called “Substance A”, “Substance B”, etc.),

title.en: 2.31 (b) (i) - determine the lowest LD50 of all substances, assign that LD50 to all substances whose actual LD50 is less than or equal to the toxic limit, then use the calculation in paragraph (a) using that assigned LD50 and taking as the mass of Substance A in the formula the total of the masses of all substances whose actual LD50 is less than or equal to the toxic limit, or
title.fr: 2.31 (b) (i) - FR_determine the lowest LD50 of all substances, assign that LD50 to all substances whose actual LD50 is less than or equal to the toxic limit, then use the calculation in paragraph (a) using that assigned LD50 and taking as the mass of Substance A in the formula the total of the masses of all substances whose actual LD50 is less than or equal to the toxic limit, or

title.en: 2.31 (b) (ii) - use the following calculations:
title.fr: 2.31 (b) (ii) - FR_use the following calculations:

title.en: 2.31 (b) (ii) (A) - determine the contributing number (CN) of each of the substances with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula
title.fr: 2.31 (b) (ii) (A) - FR_determine the contributing number (CN) of each of the substances with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit using the formula

title.en: 2.31 (b) (ii) (A) - CN for Substance A= LD50 of Substance Afraction by mass of Substance A in the mixture
title.fr: 2.31 (b) (ii) (A) - FR_CN for Substance A= LD50 of Substance Afraction by mass of Substance A in the mixture

title.en: 2.31 (b) (ii) (B) - combine the contributing numbers (CN) of each substance with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit as
title.fr: 2.31 (b) (ii) (B) - FR_combine the contributing numbers (CN) of each substance with an LD50 less than or equal to the toxic limit as

title.en: 2.31 (b) (ii) (C) - obtain the LD50 of the mixture by dividing 1 by the number T (LD50 of the mixture = 1 / T).
title.fr: 2.31 (b) (ii) (C) - FR_obtain the LD50 of the mixture by dividing 1 by the number T (LD50 of the mixture = 1 / T).

title.en: - Determination of LC50 (dust, mist or vapour)
title.fr: - FR_Determination of LC50 (dust, mist or vapour)

title.en: 2.32 - LC50 values for a substance in the form of a dust, mist or vapour or for a mixture of substances in the form of a dust, mist or vapour must be determined
title.fr: 2.32 - FR_LC50 values for a substance in the form of a dust, mist or vapour or for a mixture of substances in the form of a dust, mist or vapour must be determined

title.en: 2.32 (a) - by using the LC50 values published in technical journals or in government publications;
title.fr: 2.32 (a) - FR_by using the LC50 values published in technical journals or in government publications;

title.en: 2.32 (b) - in accordance with sections 2.6.2.2.4.2 to 2.6.2.2.4.7 of Chapter 2.6 of the UN Recommendations; or
title.fr: 2.32 (b) - FR_in accordance with sections 2.6.2.2.4.2 to 2.6.2.2.4.7 of Chapter 2.6 of the UN Recommendations; or

title.en: 2.32 (c) - for a mixture of substances, in accordance with section 2.33.
title.fr: 2.32 (c) - FR_for a mixture of substances, in accordance with section 2.33.

title.en: - Determination of LC50 (dust, mist or vapour) of a Mixture of Substances
title.fr: - FR_Determination of LC50 (dust, mist or vapour) of a Mixture of Substances

title.en: 2.33 - To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.
title.fr: 2.33 - FR_To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.

title.en: - Determination of the Packing Group of a Mixture of Liquids with an Inhalation Toxicity by Vapour
title.fr: - FR_Determination of the Packing Group of a Mixture of Liquids with an Inhalation Toxicity by Vapour

title.en: 2.34 (1) - The first step in determining the packing group of a mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity by vapour when one or more of the substances has an LC50 (vapour) less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3, and the LC50 of each substance is known, is to determine the following data:
title.fr: 2.34 (1) - FR_The first step in determining the packing group of a mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity by vapour when one or more of the substances has an LC50 (vapour) less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3, and the LC50 of each substance is known, is to determine the following data:

title.en: 2.34 (1) (a) - determine the LC50 (vapour) for the mixture in accordance with section 2.33;
title.fr: 2.34 (1) (a) - FR_determine the LC50 (vapour) for the mixture in accordance with section 2.33;

title.en: 2.34 (1) (b) - where Pi is the vapour pressure of the ith substance in kPa at 20°C and an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa, determine the volatility, Vi, of each substance in the mixture as
title.fr: 2.34 (1) (b) - FR_where Pi is the vapour pressure of the ith substance in kPa at 20°C and an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa, determine the volatility, Vi, of each substance in the mixture as

title.en: 2.34 (1) (b) - Vi = Pi multiplied by 106 then divided by 101.3;
title.fr: 2.34 (1) (b) - FR_Vi = Pi multiplied by 106 then divided by 101.3;

title.en: 2.34 (1) (c) - determine the ratio of the volatility of a substance to its LC50 for each substance with an LC50 less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3 as
title.fr: 2.34 (1) (c) - FR_determine the ratio of the volatility of a substance to its LC50 for each substance with an LC50 less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3 as

title.en: 2.34 (1) (c) - Ri = Vi divided by the LC50 of the ith substance;
title.fr: 2.34 (1) (c) - FR_Ri = Vi divided by the LC50 of the ith substance;

title.en: 2.34 (1) (d) - set R equal to the sum of the Ri for each of the substances with an LC50 less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3 as
title.fr: 2.34 (1) (d) - FR_set R equal to the sum of the Ri for each of the substances with an LC50 less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3 as

title.en: 2.34 (2) - Using the data determined in accordance with subsection (1), the mixture is included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.34 (2) - FR_Using the data determined in accordance with subsection (1), the mixture is included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.34 (2) (a) - Packing Group I, if
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if

title.en: 2.34 (2) (a) (i) - R is greater than or equal to 10, and
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (a) (i) - FR_R is greater than or equal to 10, and

title.en: 2.34 (2) (a) (ii) - the LC50 (mixture) is less than or equal to 1 000 mL/m3;
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (a) (ii) - FR_the LC50 (mixture) is less than or equal to 1 000 mL/m3;

title.en: 2.34 (2) (b) - Packing Group II, if
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if

title.en: 2.34 (2) (b) (i) - R is greater than or equal to 1,
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (b) (i) - FR_R is greater than or equal to 1,

title.en: 2.34 (2) (b) (ii) - the LC50 (mixture) is less than or equal to 3 000 mL/m3, and
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (b) (ii) - FR_the LC50 (mixture) is less than or equal to 3 000 mL/m3, and

title.en: 2.34 (2) (b) (iii) - the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met; or
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (b) (iii) - FR_the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met; or

title.en: 2.34 (2) (c) - Packing Group III, if
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if

title.en: 2.34 (2) (c) (i) - R is greater than or equal to 0.2,
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (c) (i) - FR_R is greater than or equal to 0.2,

title.en: 2.34 (2) (c) (ii) - the LC50 (mixture) is less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3, and
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (c) (ii) - FR_the LC50 (mixture) is less than or equal to 5 000 mL/m3, and

title.en: 2.34 (2) (c) (iii) - the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
title.fr: 2.34 (2) (c) (iii) - FR_the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.

title.en: - Determination of the Packing Group of a Mixture of Liquids with an Inhalation Toxicity and an Unknown LC50
title.fr: - FR_Determination of the Packing Group of a Mixture of Liquids with an Inhalation Toxicity and an Unknown LC50

title.en: 2.35 (1) - A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group I if it meets the following criteria:
title.fr: 2.35 (1) - FR_A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group I if it meets the following criteria:

title.en: 2.35 (1) (a) - when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 1 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and
title.fr: 2.35 (1) (a) - FR_when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 1 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and

title.en: 2.35 (1) (b) - when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is diluted with 9 equal volumes of air to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.
title.fr: 2.35 (1) (b) - FR_when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is diluted with 9 equal volumes of air to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.

title.en: 2.35 (2) - A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group II if it meets the following criteria and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met:
title.fr: 2.35 (2) - FR_A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group II if it meets the following criteria and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I are not met:

title.en: 2.35 (2) (a) - when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 3 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and
title.fr: 2.35 (2) (a) - FR_when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 3 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and

title.en: 2.35 (2) (b) - when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is used to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.
title.fr: 2.35 (2) (b) - FR_when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is used to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.

title.en: 2.35 (3) - A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group III if it meets the following criteria and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met:
title.fr: 2.35 (3) - FR_A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group III if it meets the following criteria and the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met:

title.en: 2.35 (3) (a) - when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 5 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and
title.fr: 2.35 (3) (a) - FR_when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 5 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and

title.en: 2.35 (3) (b) - when the vapour pressure of the mixture is measured, the vapour concentration is greater than or equal to 1 000 mL/m3.
title.fr: 2.35 (3) (b) - FR_when the vapour pressure of the mixture is measured, the vapour concentration is greater than or equal to 1 000 mL/m3.

title.en: 2.35 (4) - If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to dust or mist are available, those figures can be multiplied by 4 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (dust or mist) multiplied by 4 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.
title.fr: 2.35 (4) - FR_If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to dust or mist are available, those figures can be multiplied by 4 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (dust or mist) multiplied by 4 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.

title.en: 2.35 (5) - If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to vapour are available, those figures can be multiplied by 2 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (vapour) multiplied by 2 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.
title.fr: 2.35 (5) - FR_If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to vapour are available, those figures can be multiplied by 2 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (vapour) multiplied by 2 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.

title.en: - Infectious Substances
title.fr: - FR_Infectious Substances

title.en: 2.36 (1) - Substances are included in Class 6.2, Category A or Category B if they are infectious substances and are listed in Appendix 3 to this Part or exhibit characteristics similar to a substance listed in that appendix.
title.fr: 2.36 (1) - FR_Substances are included in Class 6.2, Category A or Category B if they are infectious substances and are listed in Appendix 3 to this Part or exhibit characteristics similar to a substance listed in that appendix.

title.en: 2.36 (2) - Infectious substances that are included in Category A and that are in a form other than a culture may be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category B in accordance with the conditions set out in paragraphs 1.39(a) to (c) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases).
title.fr: 2.36 (2) - FR_Infectious substances that are included in Category A and that are in a form other than a culture may be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category B in accordance with the conditions set out in paragraphs 1.39(a) to (c) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases).

title.en: 2.36 (3) - Despite subsection (2), the following infectious substances included in Category A, and any substance that exhibits characteristics similar to these substances, must always be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category A:
title.fr: 2.36 (3) - FR_Despite subsection (2), the following infectious substances included in Category A, and any substance that exhibits characteristics similar to these substances, must always be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category A:

title.en: 2.36 (3) (a) - Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic fever virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (a) - FR_Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic fever virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (b) - Ebola virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (b) - FR_Ebola virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (c) - Flexal virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (c) - FR_Flexal virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (d) - Guanarito virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (d) - FR_Guanarito virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (e) - Hantaviruses causing hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (e) - FR_Hantaviruses causing hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (f) - Hantaviruses causing pulmonary syndrome;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (f) - FR_Hantaviruses causing pulmonary syndrome;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (g) - Hendra virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (g) - FR_Hendra virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (h) - Herpes B virus (Cercopithecine Herpesvirus-1);
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (h) - FR_Herpes B virus (Cercopithecine Herpesvirus-1);

title.en: 2.36 (3) (i) - Junin virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (i) - FR_Junin virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (j) - Kyasanur Forest virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (j) - FR_Kyasanur Forest virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (k) - Lassa virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (k) - FR_Lassa virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (l) - Machupo virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (l) - FR_Machupo virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (m) - Marburg virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (m) - FR_Marburg virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (n) - Monkeypox virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (n) - FR_Monkeypox virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (o) - Nipah virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (o) - FR_Nipah virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (p) - Omsk hemorrhagic fever virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (p) - FR_Omsk hemorrhagic fever virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (q) - Russian Spring – Summer encephalitis virus;
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (q) - FR_Russian Spring – Summer encephalitis virus;

title.en: 2.36 (3) (r) - Sabia virus; and
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (r) - FR_Sabia virus; and

title.en: 2.36 (3) (s) - Variola (smallpox virus).
title.fr: 2.36 (3) (s) - FR_Variola (smallpox virus).

title.en: - Medical or Clinical Waste
title.fr: - FR_Medical or Clinical Waste

title.en: 2.36.1 - Dangerous goods that are medical or clinical waste must be classified
title.fr: 2.36.1 - FR_Dangerous goods that are medical or clinical waste must be classified

title.en: 2.36.1 (a) - under UN2814 or, as applicable, under UN2900, if they contain Category A infectious substances;
title.fr: 2.36.1 (a) - FR_under UN2814 or, as applicable, under UN2900, if they contain Category A infectious substances;

title.en: 2.36.1 (b) - under UN3291, if they contain Category B infectious substances; or
title.fr: 2.36.1 (b) - FR_under UN3291, if they contain Category B infectious substances; or

title.en: 2.36.1 (c) - under UN3291, if the shipper has reasonable grounds to believe that they have a low probability of containing infectious substances.
title.fr: 2.36.1 (c) - FR_under UN3291, if the shipper has reasonable grounds to believe that they have a low probability of containing infectious substances.

title.en: - Class 7, Radioactive Materials
title.fr: - FR_Class 7, Radioactive Materials

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.37 - Substances defined as Class 7, Radioactive Materials in the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations are included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials.
title.fr: 2.37 - FR_Substances defined as Class 7, Radioactive Materials in the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations are included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.38 - There are no divisions for Class 7.
title.fr: 2.38 - FR_There are no divisions for Class 7.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.39 - There are no packing groups for Class 7.
title.fr: 2.39 - FR_There are no packing groups for Class 7.

title.en: - Class 8, Corrosives
title.fr: - FR_Class 8, Corrosives

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.40 - Substances are included in Class 8, Corrosives, if they
title.fr: 2.40 - FR_Substances are included in Class 8, Corrosives, if they

title.en: 2.40 (a) - are known to cause full thickness destruction of human skin, that is, skin lesions that are permanent and destroy all layers of the outer skin through to the internal tissues;
title.fr: 2.40 (a) - FR_are known to cause full thickness destruction of human skin, that is, skin lesions that are permanent and destroy all layers of the outer skin through to the internal tissues;

title.en: 2.40 (b) - cause full thickness skin destruction, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 430 or OECD Guideline 431; or
title.fr: 2.40 (b) - FR_cause full thickness skin destruction, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 430 or OECD Guideline 431; or

title.en: 2.40 (c) - do not cause full thickness destruction of skin, but exhibit a corrosion rate that exceeds 6.25 mm per year at a test temperature of 55°C, as determined in accordance with section 37 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria.
title.fr: 2.40 (c) - FR_do not cause full thickness destruction of skin, but exhibit a corrosion rate that exceeds 6.25 mm per year at a test temperature of 55°C, as determined in accordance with section 37 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.41 - There are no divisions for Class 8.
title.fr: 2.41 - FR_There are no divisions for Class 8.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.42 (1) - If a substance is known to be included in Class 8, Corrosives, and that knowledge is based on documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications and testing is not done to determine the packing group, the substance must be included in Packing Group I.
title.fr: 2.42 (1) - FR_If a substance is known to be included in Class 8, Corrosives, and that knowledge is based on documentary evidence published in technical journals or government publications and testing is not done to determine the packing group, the substance must be included in Packing Group I.

title.en: 2.42 (2) - Class 8, Corrosives, are included in one of the following packing groups:
title.fr: 2.42 (2) - FR_Class 8, Corrosives, are included in one of the following packing groups:

title.en: 2.42 (2) (a) - Packing Group I, if
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if

title.en: 2.42 (2) (a) (i) - they are known to cause full thickness destruction of human skin, that is, skin lesions that are permanent and that destroy all layers of the outer skin through to the internal tissues, or
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (a) (i) - FR_they are known to cause full thickness destruction of human skin, that is, skin lesions that are permanent and that destroy all layers of the outer skin through to the internal tissues, or

title.en: 2.42 (2) (a) (ii) - full thickness destruction of intact skin tissue occurs within an observation period of 60 minutes after an exposure time of 3 minutes or less, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 404 or OECD Guideline 435;
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (a) (ii) - FR_full thickness destruction of intact skin tissue occurs within an observation period of 60 minutes after an exposure time of 3 minutes or less, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 404 or OECD Guideline 435;

title.en: 2.42 (2) (b) - Packing Group II, if full thickness destruction of skin occurs within an observation period of 14 days after an exposure time of more than 3 minutes but not more than 60 minutes, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 404 or OECD Guideline 435; or
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if full thickness destruction of skin occurs within an observation period of 14 days after an exposure time of more than 3 minutes but not more than 60 minutes, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 404 or OECD Guideline 435; or

title.en: 2.42 (2) (c) - Packing Group III, if
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if

title.en: 2.42 (2) (c) (i) - full thickness destruction of intact skin tissue occurs within an observation period of 14 days after an exposure time of more than 60 minutes but not more than 4 hours, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 404 or OECD Guideline 435, or
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (c) (i) - FR_full thickness destruction of intact skin tissue occurs within an observation period of 14 days after an exposure time of more than 60 minutes but not more than 4 hours, as determined in accordance with OECD Guideline 404 or OECD Guideline 435, or

title.en: 2.42 (2) (c) (ii) - they exhibit a corrosion rate that exceeds 6.25 mm per year at a test temperature of 55°C on steel or aluminum surfaces as determined in accordance with subparagraph 2.8.2.5(c)(ii) of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 2.42 (2) (c) (ii) - FR_they exhibit a corrosion rate that exceeds 6.25 mm per year at a test temperature of 55°C on steel or aluminum surfaces as determined in accordance with subparagraph 2.8.2.5(c)(ii) of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: 2.42 (3) - An in vitro test may be used instead of the test in the OECD Guidelines.
title.fr: 2.42 (3) - FR_An in vitro test may be used instead of the test in the OECD Guidelines.

title.en: - Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances or Organisms
title.fr: - FR_Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances or Organisms

title.en: - General
title.fr: - FR_General

title.en: 2.43 - A substance is included in Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances or Organisms, if it
title.fr: 2.43 - FR_A substance is included in Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances or Organisms, if it

title.en: 2.43 (a) - is included in Class 9 in column 3 of Schedule 1; or
title.fr: 2.43 (a) - FR_is included in Class 9 in column 3 of Schedule 1; or

title.en: 2.43 (b) - is not included in Class 9 in column 3 of Schedule 1 and does not meet the criteria for inclusion in any of Classes 1 to 8 and
title.fr: 2.43 (b) - FR_is not included in Class 9 in column 3 of Schedule 1 and does not meet the criteria for inclusion in any of Classes 1 to 8 and

title.en: 2.43 (b) (ii) - is a marine pollutant under section 2.7 of Part 2 (Classification), or
title.fr: 2.43 (b) (ii) - FR_is a marine pollutant under section 2.7 of Part 2 (Classification), or

title.en: 2.43 (b) (iii) - except for asphalt or tar, is offered for transport or transported at a temperature greater than or equal to 100°C if it is in a liquid state or at a temperature greater than or equal to 240°C if it is in a solid state.
title.fr: 2.43 (b) (iii) - FR_except for asphalt or tar, is offered for transport or transported at a temperature greater than or equal to 100°C if it is in a liquid state or at a temperature greater than or equal to 240°C if it is in a solid state.

title.en: - Lithium Cells and Batteries
title.fr: - FR_Lithium Cells and Batteries

title.en: 2.43.1 (1) - A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport lithium cells and batteries under any of the following shipping names unless the cells and batteries meet the conditions set out in subsection (2):
title.fr: 2.43.1 (1) - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport lithium cells and batteries under any of the following shipping names unless the cells and batteries meet the conditions set out in subsection (2):

title.en: 2.43.1 (1) (a) - UN3090, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES;
title.fr: 2.43.1 (1) (a) - FR_UN3090, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES;

title.en: 2.43.1 (1) (b) - UN3091, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT;
title.fr: 2.43.1 (1) (b) - FR_UN3091, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT;

title.en: 2.43.1 (1) (c) - UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES; or
title.fr: 2.43.1 (1) (c) - FR_UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES; or

title.en: 2.43.1 (1) (d) - UN3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT.
title.fr: 2.43.1 (1) (d) - FR_UN3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT.

title.en: 2.43.1 (2) - The conditions are as follows:
title.fr: 2.43.1 (2) - FR_The conditions are as follows:

title.en: 2.43.1 (2) (a) - the cell or battery type passes each test set out in subsection 38.3 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria;
title.fr: 2.43.1 (2) (a) - FR_the cell or battery type passes each test set out in subsection 38.3 of Part III of the Manual of Tests and Criteria;

title.en: 2.43.1 (2) (b) - each cell or battery has a safety venting device or is designed to prevent a violent rupture under normal conditions of transport;
title.fr: 2.43.1 (2) (b) - FR_each cell or battery has a safety venting device or is designed to prevent a violent rupture under normal conditions of transport;

title.en: 2.43.1 (2) (c) - each cell or battery is equipped to prevent external short circuits; and
title.fr: 2.43.1 (2) (c) - FR_each cell or battery is equipped to prevent external short circuits; and

title.en: 2.43.1 (2) (d) - each battery containing cells or a series of cells connected in parallel is equipped with diodes, fuses or other devices that prevent dangerous reverse current flow.
title.fr: 2.43.1 (2) (d) - FR_each battery containing cells or a series of cells connected in parallel is equipped with diodes, fuses or other devices that prevent dangerous reverse current flow.

title.en: - Divisions
title.fr: - FR_Divisions

title.en: 2.44 - There are no divisions for Class 9.
title.fr: 2.44 - FR_There are no divisions for Class 9.

title.en: - Packing Groups
title.fr: - FR_Packing Groups

title.en: 2.45 - Substances included in Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances and Organisms, are included in Packing Group III unless they are included in a different packing group shown for them in column 4 of Schedule 1.
title.fr: 2.45 - FR_Substances included in Class 9, Miscellaneous Products, Substances and Organisms, are included in Packing Group III unless they are included in a different packing group shown for them in column 4 of Schedule 1.

title.en: PART 3 - Documentation
title.fr: PART 3 - FR_Documentation

title.en: - Consignor Responsibilities
title.fr: - FR_Consignor Responsibilities

title.en: 3.1 (1) - Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must prepare and give to that carrier a shipping document or, if the carrier agrees, an electronic copy of the shipping document.
title.fr: 3.1 (1) - FR_Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must prepare and give to that carrier a shipping document or, if the carrier agrees, an electronic copy of the shipping document.

title.en: 3.1 (2) - When dangerous goods are imported into Canada, the consignor must, before the dangerous goods are transported in Canada, ensure that the carrier has a shipping document or, with the agreement of the carrier, an electronic copy of the shipping document that contains the information required by these Regulations.
title.fr: 3.1 (2) - FR_When dangerous goods are imported into Canada, the consignor must, before the dangerous goods are transported in Canada, ensure that the carrier has a shipping document or, with the agreement of the carrier, an electronic copy of the shipping document that contains the information required by these Regulations.

title.en: - Carrier Responsibilities
title.fr: - FR_Carrier Responsibilities

title.en: 3.2 (1) - A carrier must not take possession of dangerous goods for transport unless the carrier has the shipping document for the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 3.2 (1) - FR_A carrier must not take possession of dangerous goods for transport unless the carrier has the shipping document for the dangerous goods.

title.en: 3.2 (2) - A carrier who accepts an electronic copy of a shipping document must produce a shipping document from the electronic copy before taking possession of the dangerous goods for transport.
title.fr: 3.2 (2) - FR_A carrier who accepts an electronic copy of a shipping document must produce a shipping document from the electronic copy before taking possession of the dangerous goods for transport.

title.en: 3.2 (3) - Dangerous goods in transport are in the possession of a carrier from the time the carrier takes possession of them for transport until another person takes possession of them.
title.fr: 3.2 (3) - FR_Dangerous goods in transport are in the possession of a carrier from the time the carrier takes possession of them for transport until another person takes possession of them.

title.en: 3.2 (4) - While the dangerous goods are in transport and in the possession of a carrier, the carrier must keep the shipping document in the location specified by sections 3.7 to 3.10.
title.fr: 3.2 (4) - FR_While the dangerous goods are in transport and in the possession of a carrier, the carrier must keep the shipping document in the location specified by sections 3.7 to 3.10.

title.en: 3.2 (5) - At or before the time another carrier takes possession of the dangerous goods, the carrier must give the shipping document or a copy of the shipping document to that other carrier or, with that other carrier’s agreement, an electronic copy of it.
title.fr: 3.2 (5) - FR_At or before the time another carrier takes possession of the dangerous goods, the carrier must give the shipping document or a copy of the shipping document to that other carrier or, with that other carrier’s agreement, an electronic copy of it.

title.en: 3.2 (6) - At or before the time a person, other than another carrier, takes possession of the dangerous goods, the carrier of the dangerous goods must give to that person a document that identifies the dangerous goods or, with that person’s agreement, an electronic copy of a document that identifies the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 3.2 (6) - FR_At or before the time a person, other than another carrier, takes possession of the dangerous goods, the carrier of the dangerous goods must give to that person a document that identifies the dangerous goods or, with that person’s agreement, an electronic copy of a document that identifies the dangerous goods.

title.en: 3.2 (7) - A carrier may replace a shipping document provided by the consignor with a new shipping document or with a copy of the shipping document in a different format.
title.fr: 3.2 (7) - FR_A carrier may replace a shipping document provided by the consignor with a new shipping document or with a copy of the shipping document in a different format.

title.en: - Consist for Transport by Rail
title.fr: - FR_Consist for Transport by Rail

title.en: 3.3 (1) - When a train includes a railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), the person in charge of the train must prepare and give a consist to a member of the train crew. The information on the consist must be kept up to date by the train crew and kept with the shipping document.
title.fr: 3.3 (1) - FR_When a train includes a railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), the person in charge of the train must prepare and give a consist to a member of the train crew. The information on the consist must be kept up to date by the train crew and kept with the shipping document.

title.en: 3.3 (2) - The consist must include, for each railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks),
title.fr: 3.3 (2) - FR_The consist must include, for each railway vehicle containing dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks),

title.en: 3.3 (2) (a) - the numerical location of the railway vehicle in the train, numbering the first vehicle at the head of the train as 1, the next vehicle as 2 and so on, excluding the locomotive or locomotives wherever they are located in the train;
title.fr: 3.3 (2) (a) - FR_the numerical location of the railway vehicle in the train, numbering the first vehicle at the head of the train as 1, the next vehicle as 2 and so on, excluding the locomotive or locomotives wherever they are located in the train;

title.en: 3.3 (2) (b) - the reporting mark of the railway vehicle;
title.fr: 3.3 (2) (b) - FR_the reporting mark of the railway vehicle;

title.en: 3.3 (2) (c) - for a tank car, the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods in the tank car; and
title.fr: 3.3 (2) (c) - FR_for a tank car, the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods in the tank car; and

title.en: 3.3 (2) (d) - for a railway vehicle other than a tank car,
title.fr: 3.3 (2) (d) - FR_for a railway vehicle other than a tank car,

title.en: 3.3 (2) (d) (i) - the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods, if the railway vehicle contains only dangerous goods with the same shipping name and UN number, or
title.fr: 3.3 (2) (d) (i) - FR_the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods, if the railway vehicle contains only dangerous goods with the same shipping name and UN number, or

title.en: 3.3 (2) (d) (ii) - the words “Dangerous Goods” or “Marchandises dangereuses”, if the railway vehicle contains dangerous goods that have different shipping names or UN numbers.
title.fr: 3.3 (2) (d) (ii) - FR_the words “Dangerous Goods” or “Marchandises dangereuses”, if the railway vehicle contains dangerous goods that have different shipping names or UN numbers.

title.en: 3.3 (3) - A carrier must be able to immediately provide to CANUTEC a copy of a consist whenever the train to which the consist applies is in operation or is involved in an accident.
title.fr: 3.3 (3) - FR_A carrier must be able to immediately provide to CANUTEC a copy of a consist whenever the train to which the consist applies is in operation or is involved in an accident.

title.en: - Legibility and Language
title.fr: - FR_Legibility and Language

title.en: 3.4 (1) - The information required on a shipping document and on a consist must be easy to identify, legible, in indelible print and in English or French.
title.fr: 3.4 (1) - FR_The information required on a shipping document and on a consist must be easy to identify, legible, in indelible print and in English or French.

title.en: 3.4 (2) - When the information related to dangerous goods is on the same shipping document with information related to non-dangerous goods, the dangerous goods information must be shown
title.fr: 3.4 (2) - FR_When the information related to dangerous goods is on the same shipping document with information related to non-dangerous goods, the dangerous goods information must be shown

title.en: 3.4 (2) (a) - before the information related to the non-dangerous goods and under the heading “Dangerous Goods” or “Marchandises dangereuses”;
title.fr: 3.4 (2) (a) - FR_before the information related to the non-dangerous goods and under the heading “Dangerous Goods” or “Marchandises dangereuses”;

title.en: 3.4 (2) (b) - printed or highlighted in a colour that contrasts with the print or highlight used for the information related to the non-dangerous goods; or
title.fr: 3.4 (2) (b) - FR_printed or highlighted in a colour that contrasts with the print or highlight used for the information related to the non-dangerous goods; or

title.en: 3.4 (2) (c) - following the letter “X” opposite the shipping name in a column under the heading “DG” or “MD”.
title.fr: 3.4 (2) (c) - FR_following the letter “X” opposite the shipping name in a column under the heading “DG” or “MD”.

title.en: - Information on a Shipping Document
title.fr: - FR_Information on a Shipping Document

title.en: 3.5 (1) - The following information must be included on a shipping document:
title.fr: 3.5 (1) - FR_The following information must be included on a shipping document:

title.en: 3.5 (1) (a) - the name and address of the place of business in Canada of the consignor;
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (a) - FR_the name and address of the place of business in Canada of the consignor;

title.en: 3.5 (1) (b) - the date the shipping document or an electronic copy of it was prepared or was first given to a carrier;
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (b) - FR_the date the shipping document or an electronic copy of it was prepared or was first given to a carrier;

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) - the description of each of the dangerous goods, in the following order:
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) - FR_the description of each of the dangerous goods, in the following order:

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (i) - the UN number,
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (i) - FR_the UN number,

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (ii) - the shipping name and, immediately after the shipping name unless it is already part of it,
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (ii) - FR_the shipping name and, immediately after the shipping name unless it is already part of it,

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (ii) (A) - for dangerous goods that are subject to special provision 16, the technical name, in parentheses, of at least one of the most dangerous substances that predominantly contributes to the hazard or hazards posed by the dangerous goods, and
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (ii) (A) - FR_for dangerous goods that are subject to special provision 16, the technical name, in parentheses, of at least one of the most dangerous substances that predominantly contributes to the hazard or hazards posed by the dangerous goods, and

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (ii) (B) - for a liquefied petroleum gas that has not been odorized, the words “Not Odourized” or “Not Odorized” or “Sans odorisant”,
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (ii) (B) - FR_for a liquefied petroleum gas that has not been odorized, the words “Not Odourized” or “Not Odorized” or “Sans odorisant”,

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (iii) - the primary class, which may be shown as a number only or under the heading “Class” or “Classe” or following the word “Class” or “Classe”,
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (iii) - FR_the primary class, which may be shown as a number only or under the heading “Class” or “Classe” or following the word “Class” or “Classe”,

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (iv) - for dangerous goods with a primary class of Class 1, Explosives, the compatibility group letter following the primary class,
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (iv) - FR_for dangerous goods with a primary class of Class 1, Explosives, the compatibility group letter following the primary class,

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (v) - the subsidiary class or classes, in parentheses, which may be shown as a number only or under the heading “subsidiary class” or “classe subsidiaire” or following the words “subsidiary class” or “classe subsidiaire”, except that, for transport by aircraft or by vessel, the subsidiary class or classes may be shown after the information required by this paragraph,
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (v) - FR_the subsidiary class or classes, in parentheses, which may be shown as a number only or under the heading “subsidiary class” or “classe subsidiaire” or following the words “subsidiary class” or “classe subsidiaire”, except that, for transport by aircraft or by vessel, the subsidiary class or classes may be shown after the information required by this paragraph,

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (vi) - the packing group roman numeral, which may be shown under the heading “PG” or “GE” or following the letters “PG” or “GE” or following the words “Packing Group” or “Groupe d’emballage”, and
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (vi) - FR_the packing group roman numeral, which may be shown under the heading “PG” or “GE” or following the letters “PG” or “GE” or following the words “Packing Group” or “Groupe d’emballage”, and

title.en: 3.5 (1) (c) (vii) - for dangerous goods that are subject to special provision 23, the words “toxic by inhalation” or “toxic – inhalation hazard” or “toxique par inhalation” or “toxicité par inhalation”;
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (c) (vii) - FR_for dangerous goods that are subject to special provision 23, the words “toxic by inhalation” or “toxic – inhalation hazard” or “toxique par inhalation” or “toxicité par inhalation”;

title.en: 3.5 (1) (d) - for each shipping name, the quantity of dangerous goods and the unit of measure used to express the quantity which, on a shipping document prepared in Canada, must be a unit of measure included in the International System of Units (SI) or a unit of measure acceptable for use under the SI system, except that for dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, the quantity must be expressed in net explosives quantity or, for explosives with UN numbers subject to special provision 85 or 86, in number of articles or net explosives quantity;
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (d) - FR_for each shipping name, the quantity of dangerous goods and the unit of measure used to express the quantity which, on a shipping document prepared in Canada, must be a unit of measure included in the International System of Units (SI) or a unit of measure acceptable for use under the SI system, except that for dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, the quantity must be expressed in net explosives quantity or, for explosives with UN numbers subject to special provision 85 or 86, in number of articles or net explosives quantity;

title.en: 3.5 (1) (e) - for dangerous goods in one or more small means of containment that require a label to be displayed on them in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), the number of small means of containment for each shipping name; and
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (e) - FR_for dangerous goods in one or more small means of containment that require a label to be displayed on them in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), the number of small means of containment for each shipping name; and

title.en: 3.5 (1) (f) - the words “24-Hour Number” or “Numéro 24 heures”, or an abbreviation of these words, followed by a telephone number, including the area code, at which the consignor can be reached immediately for technical information about the dangerous goods in transport, without breaking the telephone connection made by the caller.
title.fr: 3.5 (1) (f) - FR_the words “24-Hour Number” or “Numéro 24 heures”, or an abbreviation of these words, followed by a telephone number, including the area code, at which the consignor can be reached immediately for technical information about the dangerous goods in transport, without breaking the telephone connection made by the caller.

title.en: 3.5 (2) - The telephone number of a person who is not the consignor, such as CANUTEC, but who is competent to give the technical information required by paragraph (1)(f) in English or in French may be used. However, to use CANUTEC’s telephone number, the consignor must receive permission, in writing, from CANUTEC. A consignor who uses the telephone number of an organization or agency other than CANUTEC must ensure that the organization or agency has current, accurate information on the dangerous goods the consignor offers for transport and, if the organization or agency is located outside Canada, the telephone number must include the country code and, if required, the city code.
title.fr: 3.5 (2) - FR_The telephone number of a person who is not the consignor, such as CANUTEC, but who is competent to give the technical information required by paragraph (1)(f) in English or in French may be used. However, to use CANUTEC’s telephone number, the consignor must receive permission, in writing, from CANUTEC. A consignor who uses the telephone number of an organization or agency other than CANUTEC must ensure that the organization or agency has current, accurate information on the dangerous goods the consignor offers for transport and, if the organization or agency is located outside Canada, the telephone number must include the country code and, if required, the city code.

title.en: 3.5 (3) - A means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport must be accompanied by a shipping document that, despite subsections (1) and (5) and section 3.6, includes the following information if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment:
title.fr: 3.5 (3) - FR_A means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport must be accompanied by a shipping document that, despite subsections (1) and (5) and section 3.6, includes the following information if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment:

title.en: 3.5 (3) (a) - the shipping name, “FUMIGATED UNIT” or “ENGIN SOUS FUMIGATION”;
title.fr: 3.5 (3) (a) - FR_the shipping name, “FUMIGATED UNIT” or “ENGIN SOUS FUMIGATION”;

title.en: 3.5 (3) (b) - the class, Class 9;
title.fr: 3.5 (3) (b) - FR_the class, Class 9;

title.en: 3.5 (3) (c) - the UN number, UN3359;
title.fr: 3.5 (3) (c) - FR_the UN number, UN3359;

title.en: 3.5 (3) (d) - the quantity of the fumigant;
title.fr: 3.5 (3) (d) - FR_the quantity of the fumigant;

title.en: 3.5 (3) (e) - the date of fumigation; and
title.fr: 3.5 (3) (e) - FR_the date of fumigation; and

title.en: 3.5 (3) (f) - instructions for the disposal of residues of the fumigant or fumigation device.
title.fr: 3.5 (3) (f) - FR_instructions for the disposal of residues of the fumigant or fumigation device.

title.en: 3.5 (4) - Despite paragraph (1)(d), if the means of containment contains a residue, the words “Residue – Last Contained” or “Résidu – dernier contenu” may be added before or after the description of the dangerous goods. These words must not, however, be used for dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, that are in a small means of containment or for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials.
title.fr: 3.5 (4) - FR_Despite paragraph (1)(d), if the means of containment contains a residue, the words “Residue – Last Contained” or “Résidu – dernier contenu” may be added before or after the description of the dangerous goods. These words must not, however, be used for dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, that are in a small means of containment or for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials.

title.en: 3.5 (5) - If the quantity of dangerous goods required on a shipping document under paragraph (1)(d) or the number of small means of containment required under paragraph (1)(e) changes during transport, the carrier must show those changes on the shipping document or on a document attached to the shipping document.
title.fr: 3.5 (5) - FR_If the quantity of dangerous goods required on a shipping document under paragraph (1)(d) or the number of small means of containment required under paragraph (1)(e) changes during transport, the carrier must show those changes on the shipping document or on a document attached to the shipping document.

title.en: - Additional Information on a Shipping Document
title.fr: - FR_Additional Information on a Shipping Document

title.en: 3.6 (1) - In addition to the information required by subsection 3.5(1), the shipping document for dangerous goods for which an approved ERAP is required under subsection 7(1) of the Act must include
title.fr: 3.6 (1) - FR_In addition to the information required by subsection 3.5(1), the shipping document for dangerous goods for which an approved ERAP is required under subsection 7(1) of the Act must include

title.en: 3.6 (1) (a) - the ERAP reference number issued by Transport Canada, preceded or followed by the letters “ERAP” or “PIU”; and
title.fr: 3.6 (1) (a) - FR_the ERAP reference number issued by Transport Canada, preceded or followed by the letters “ERAP” or “PIU”; and

title.en: 3.6 (1) (b) - the ERAP telephone number required under paragraph 7.3(2)(f).
title.fr: 3.6 (1) (b) - FR_the ERAP telephone number required under paragraph 7.3(2)(f).

title.en: 3.6 (2) - If the 24-hour number required by paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and the ERAP telephone number are the same, that number may be shown on the same line on the shipping document.
title.fr: 3.6 (2) - FR_If the 24-hour number required by paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and the ERAP telephone number are the same, that number may be shown on the same line on the shipping document.

title.en: 3.6 (3) - In addition to the information required by subsection 3.5(1), the following information must be included on a shipping document:
title.fr: 3.6 (3) - FR_In addition to the information required by subsection 3.5(1), the following information must be included on a shipping document:

title.en: 3.6 (3) (a) - for dangerous goods in transport by vessel,
title.fr: 3.6 (3) (a) - FR_for dangerous goods in transport by vessel,

title.en: 3.6 (3) (a) (i) - the flash point for dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, and
title.fr: 3.6 (3) (a) (i) - FR_the flash point for dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, and

title.en: 3.6 (3) (a) (ii) - for dangerous goods that are marine pollutants under section 2.7 of Part 2 (Classification), the words “marine pollutant” or “polluant marin” and, for a pesticide that is a marine pollutant, the name and concentration of the most active substance in the pesticide;
title.fr: 3.6 (3) (a) (ii) - FR_for dangerous goods that are marine pollutants under section 2.7 of Part 2 (Classification), the words “marine pollutant” or “polluant marin” and, for a pesticide that is a marine pollutant, the name and concentration of the most active substance in the pesticide;

title.en: 3.6 (3) (b) - for dangerous goods included in Class 4.1, Flammable Solids, the control and emergency temperatures shown in section 2.4.2.3.2.3 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, if applicable;
title.fr: 3.6 (3) (b) - FR_for dangerous goods included in Class 4.1, Flammable Solids, the control and emergency temperatures shown in section 2.4.2.3.2.3 of Chapter 2.4 of the UN Recommendations, if applicable;

title.en: 3.6 (3) (c) - for dangerous goods included in Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, the control and emergency temperatures shown in section 2.5.3.2.4 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations, if applicable; and
title.fr: 3.6 (3) (c) - FR_for dangerous goods included in Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, the control and emergency temperatures shown in section 2.5.3.2.4 of Chapter 2.5 of the UN Recommendations, if applicable; and

title.en: 3.6 (3) (d) - for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, the additional information required for transport documents under the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 3.6 (3) (d) - FR_for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, the additional information required for transport documents under the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.en: - Consignor’s Certification
title.fr: - FR_Consignor’s Certification

title.en: 3.6.1 (1) - Beginning on July 15, 2015, a shipping document must include, after the information required under section 3.5, one of the following certifications:
title.fr: 3.6.1 (1) - FR_Beginning on July 15, 2015, a shipping document must include, after the information required under section 3.5, one of the following certifications:

title.en: 3.6.1 (1) (a) - “I hereby declare that the contents of this consignment are fully and accurately described above by the proper shipping name, are properly classified and packaged, have dangerous goods safety marks properly affixed or displayed on them, and are in all respects in proper condition for transport according to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations.”;
title.fr: 3.6.1 (1) (a) - FR_“I hereby declare that the contents of this consignment are fully and accurately described above by the proper shipping name, are properly classified and packaged, have dangerous goods safety marks properly affixed or displayed on them, and are in all respects in proper condition for transport according to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations.”;

title.en: 3.6.1 (1) (b) - the certification set out in section 172.204 of 49 CFR;
title.fr: 3.6.1 (1) (b) - FR_the certification set out in section 172.204 of 49 CFR;

title.en: 3.6.1 (1) (c) - the certification set out in section 5;4.1.6 of the ICAO Technical Instructions;
title.fr: 3.6.1 (1) (c) - FR_the certification set out in section 5;4.1.6 of the ICAO Technical Instructions;

title.en: 3.6.1 (1) (d) - the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the IMDG Code; or
title.fr: 3.6.1 (1) (d) - FR_the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the IMDG Code; or

title.en: 3.6.1 (1) (e) - the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 3.6.1 (1) (e) - FR_the certification set out in section 5.4.1.6 of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: 3.6.1 (2) - The certification must be made by an individual who is the consignor or by an individual acting on behalf of the consignor and must set out that individual’s name.
title.fr: 3.6.1 (2) - FR_The certification must be made by an individual who is the consignor or by an individual acting on behalf of the consignor and must set out that individual’s name.

title.en: 3.6.1 (3) - This section does not apply in respect of a large means of containment that contains a residue.
title.fr: 3.6.1 (3) - FR_This section does not apply in respect of a large means of containment that contains a residue.

title.en: - Location of a Shipping Document: Road
title.fr: - FR_Location of a Shipping Document: Road

title.en: 3.7 - The driver of a power unit that is attached to or is part of the cargo unit of a road vehicle transporting dangerous goods must ensure that a copy of the shipping document is kept, as follows:
title.fr: 3.7 - FR_The driver of a power unit that is attached to or is part of the cargo unit of a road vehicle transporting dangerous goods must ensure that a copy of the shipping document is kept, as follows:

title.en: 3.7 (a) - if the driver is in the power unit, in a pocket mounted on the driver’s door or within the driver’s reach; or
title.fr: 3.7 (a) - FR_if the driver is in the power unit, in a pocket mounted on the driver’s door or within the driver’s reach; or

title.en: 3.7 (b) - if the driver is out of the power unit, in a pocket mounted on the driver’s door, on the driver’s seat or in a location that is clearly visible to anyone entering through the driver’s door.
title.fr: 3.7 (b) - FR_if the driver is out of the power unit, in a pocket mounted on the driver’s door, on the driver’s seat or in a location that is clearly visible to anyone entering through the driver’s door.

title.en: - Location of a Shipping Document and Consist: Rail
title.fr: - FR_Location of a Shipping Document and Consist: Rail

title.en: 3.8 - The person in charge of a train transporting dangerous goods must ensure that a copy of the shipping document and, when a consist is required, a copy of the consist are kept,
title.fr: 3.8 - FR_The person in charge of a train transporting dangerous goods must ensure that a copy of the shipping document and, when a consist is required, a copy of the consist are kept,

title.en: 3.8 (a) - when one or more members of the train crew are present, in the possession of one of them; or
title.fr: 3.8 (a) - FR_when one or more members of the train crew are present, in the possession of one of them; or

title.en: 3.8 (b) - when no member of the train crew is present, in the first locomotive.
title.fr: 3.8 (b) - FR_when no member of the train crew is present, in the first locomotive.

title.en: - Location of a Shipping Document: Marine
title.fr: - FR_Location of a Shipping Document: Marine

title.en: 3.9 (1) - The master of a vessel containing dangerous goods or the master in control of a vessel containing dangerous goods must have readily available on or near the bridge of the vessel a paper copy or electronic copy of
title.fr: 3.9 (1) - FR_The master of a vessel containing dangerous goods or the master in control of a vessel containing dangerous goods must have readily available on or near the bridge of the vessel a paper copy or electronic copy of

title.en: 3.9 (1) (a) - the shipping document; or
title.fr: 3.9 (1) (a) - FR_the shipping document; or

title.en: 3.9 (1) (b) - a list that includes the classification of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 3.9 (1) (b) - FR_a list that includes the classification of the dangerous goods.

title.en: 3.9 (2) - If dangerous goods are transported by vessel on board a road vehicle that is accompanied by one or more drivers or a railway vehicle that is accompanied by one or more members of the train crew, a driver or a member of the train crew must notify the master of the vessel or the marine carrier of the presence of the dangerous goods and make available to the master a copy of the shipping document. However, the shipping document must be kept, for the road vehicle, in accordance with section 3.7 and, for the railway vehicle, in the possession of a member of the train crew.
title.fr: 3.9 (2) - FR_If dangerous goods are transported by vessel on board a road vehicle that is accompanied by one or more drivers or a railway vehicle that is accompanied by one or more members of the train crew, a driver or a member of the train crew must notify the master of the vessel or the marine carrier of the presence of the dangerous goods and make available to the master a copy of the shipping document. However, the shipping document must be kept, for the road vehicle, in accordance with section 3.7 and, for the railway vehicle, in the possession of a member of the train crew.

title.en: - Location of a Shipping Document: Storage in the Course of Transportation
title.fr: - FR_Location of a Shipping Document: Storage in the Course of Transportation

title.en: 3.10 (1) - A carrier must ensure that a shipping document is placed in a waterproof receptacle that is securely attached to or near the means of containment containing the dangerous goods, at a readily identifiable and accessible location, when the dangerous goods are in transport if
title.fr: 3.10 (1) - FR_A carrier must ensure that a shipping document is placed in a waterproof receptacle that is securely attached to or near the means of containment containing the dangerous goods, at a readily identifiable and accessible location, when the dangerous goods are in transport if

title.en: 3.10 (1) (a) - they are left in an unsupervised area
title.fr: 3.10 (1) (a) - FR_they are left in an unsupervised area

title.en: 3.10 (1) (a) (i) - after being unloaded from a means of transport,
title.fr: 3.10 (1) (a) (i) - FR_after being unloaded from a means of transport,

title.en: 3.10 (1) (a) (ii) - after the cargo unit of a road vehicle containing them has been disconnected from the power unit, or
title.fr: 3.10 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_after the cargo unit of a road vehicle containing them has been disconnected from the power unit, or

title.en: 3.10 (1) (a) (iii) - when the railway vehicle containing them is no longer part of a train; and
title.fr: 3.10 (1) (a) (iii) - FR_when the railway vehicle containing them is no longer part of a train; and

title.en: 3.10 (1) (b) - possession of the dangerous goods has not been transferred to another person.
title.fr: 3.10 (1) (b) - FR_possession of the dangerous goods has not been transferred to another person.

title.en: 3.10 (2) - When dangerous goods in transport are left in a supervised area, the person in charge of the supervised area is considered to have taken possession of the dangerous goods. The carrier must leave a copy of the shipping document with that person, who must keep it and give it to the next person who takes possession of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 3.10 (2) - FR_When dangerous goods in transport are left in a supervised area, the person in charge of the supervised area is considered to have taken possession of the dangerous goods. The carrier must leave a copy of the shipping document with that person, who must keep it and give it to the next person who takes possession of the dangerous goods.

title.en: 3.10 (3) - When the person in charge of a supervised area is absent from the area, that person must ensure that the copy of the shipping document is
title.fr: 3.10 (3) - FR_When the person in charge of a supervised area is absent from the area, that person must ensure that the copy of the shipping document is

title.en: 3.10 (3) (a) - placed in a waterproof receptacle securely attached to or near the means of containment containing the dangerous goods, at a readily identifiable and accessible location; or
title.fr: 3.10 (3) (a) - FR_placed in a waterproof receptacle securely attached to or near the means of containment containing the dangerous goods, at a readily identifiable and accessible location; or

title.en: 3.10 (3) (b) - left in the possession of an employee who is present in the supervised area and is designated for this purpose by the person in charge of the supervised area.
title.fr: 3.10 (3) (b) - FR_left in the possession of an employee who is present in the supervised area and is designated for this purpose by the person in charge of the supervised area.

title.en: 3.10 (4) - Despite the locations specified in subsections (1) to (3), when dangerous goods that are in transport by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel are stored in a supervised or unsupervised area, the shipping document or an electronic copy of it may be left at the office of a person referred to in one of the following paragraphs if the conditions in subsections (5) and (6) are complied with:
title.fr: 3.10 (4) - FR_Despite the locations specified in subsections (1) to (3), when dangerous goods that are in transport by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel are stored in a supervised or unsupervised area, the shipping document or an electronic copy of it may be left at the office of a person referred to in one of the following paragraphs if the conditions in subsections (5) and (6) are complied with:

title.en: 3.10 (4) (a) - the rail dispatcher for the area in which the railway vehicle is located;
title.fr: 3.10 (4) (a) - FR_the rail dispatcher for the area in which the railway vehicle is located;

title.en: 3.10 (4) (b) - the person responsible for the port at which the dangerous goods are located; or
title.fr: 3.10 (4) (b) - FR_the person responsible for the port at which the dangerous goods are located; or

title.en: 3.10 (4) (c) - the marine terminal manager at the terminal where the dangerous goods are located.
title.fr: 3.10 (4) (c) - FR_the marine terminal manager at the terminal where the dangerous goods are located.

title.en: 3.10 (5) - When a shipping record is left at the office of a person referred to in subsection (4),
title.fr: 3.10 (5) - FR_When a shipping record is left at the office of a person referred to in subsection (4),

title.en: 3.10 (5) (a) - use of the telephone number of that office must be approved in accordance with subsection (6); and
title.fr: 3.10 (5) (a) - FR_use of the telephone number of that office must be approved in accordance with subsection (6); and

title.en: 3.10 (5) (b) - that person or that person’s representative must provide immediately, at the request of a federal, provincial or municipal official including a member of a fire department, a facsimile or electronic copy of the shipping record or, if requested, a voice description of the information on the shipping record.
title.fr: 3.10 (5) (b) - FR_that person or that person’s representative must provide immediately, at the request of a federal, provincial or municipal official including a member of a fire department, a facsimile or electronic copy of the shipping record or, if requested, a voice description of the information on the shipping record.

title.en: 3.10 (6) - The telephone number of the office of a person referred to in subsection (4) must not be used to comply with subsection (5), unless that person gives CANUTEC the following information and receives approval, in writing, from CANUTEC to use that telephone number:
title.fr: 3.10 (6) - FR_The telephone number of the office of a person referred to in subsection (4) must not be used to comply with subsection (5), unless that person gives CANUTEC the following information and receives approval, in writing, from CANUTEC to use that telephone number:

title.en: 3.10 (6) (a) - the name and address of the person;
title.fr: 3.10 (6) (a) - FR_the name and address of the person;

title.en: 3.10 (6) (b) - the telephone number of the office of the person;
title.fr: 3.10 (6) (b) - FR_the telephone number of the office of the person;

title.en: 3.10 (6) (c) - the physical area to which the telephone number applies and, in the case of a port or a marine terminal, evidence that public access to the area is controlled;
title.fr: 3.10 (6) (c) - FR_the physical area to which the telephone number applies and, in the case of a port or a marine terminal, evidence that public access to the area is controlled;

title.en: 3.10 (6) (d) - the period of time, not to exceed 5 years, for which CANUTEC’s approval is requested; and
title.fr: 3.10 (6) (d) - FR_the period of time, not to exceed 5 years, for which CANUTEC’s approval is requested; and

title.en: 3.10 (6) (e) - the dangerous goods to which the approval applies.
title.fr: 3.10 (6) (e) - FR_the dangerous goods to which the approval applies.

title.en: 3.10 (7) - The Director General may revoke, in writing, the approval to use a telephone number if
title.fr: 3.10 (7) - FR_The Director General may revoke, in writing, the approval to use a telephone number if

title.en: 3.10 (7) (a) - the person referred to in subsection (4), or that person’s representative, does not answer the telephone;
title.fr: 3.10 (7) (a) - FR_the person referred to in subsection (4), or that person’s representative, does not answer the telephone;

title.en: 3.10 (7) (b) - the person referred to in subsection (4), or that person’s representative, does not provide immediately, at the request of a federal, provincial or municipal official including a member of a fire department, a facsimile or an electronic copy of the shipping record or, if requested, a voice description of the information on the shipping record; or
title.fr: 3.10 (7) (b) - FR_the person referred to in subsection (4), or that person’s representative, does not provide immediately, at the request of a federal, provincial or municipal official including a member of a fire department, a facsimile or an electronic copy of the shipping record or, if requested, a voice description of the information on the shipping record; or

title.en: 3.10 (7) (c) - public access to a port or marine terminal is not controlled.
title.fr: 3.10 (7) (c) - FR_public access to a port or marine terminal is not controlled.

title.en: - Keeping Shipping Document Information
title.fr: - FR_Keeping Shipping Document Information

title.en: 3.11 (1) - A consignor must be able to produce a copy of any shipping document
title.fr: 3.11 (1) - FR_A consignor must be able to produce a copy of any shipping document

title.en: 3.11 (1) (a) - for two years after the date the shipping document or an electronic copy of it was prepared or given to a carrier by the consignor;
title.fr: 3.11 (1) (a) - FR_for two years after the date the shipping document or an electronic copy of it was prepared or given to a carrier by the consignor;
