title.en: 3.11 (1) (b) - for dangerous goods imported into Canada, for two years after the date the consignor ensured that the carrier, on entry into Canada, had a shipping document or an electronic copy of one; and
title.fr: 3.11 (1) (b) - FR_for dangerous goods imported into Canada, for two years after the date the consignor ensured that the carrier, on entry into Canada, had a shipping document or an electronic copy of one; and

title.en: 3.11 (1) (c) - within 15 days after the day on which the consignor receives a written request from an inspector.
title.fr: 3.11 (1) (c) - FR_within 15 days after the day on which the consignor receives a written request from an inspector.

title.en: 3.11 (2) - When dangerous goods are no longer in transport, each carrier who transported the dangerous goods must be able to produce a copy of the shipping document that related to the dangerous goods and was required to be in the possession of that carrier while the dangerous goods were in transport
title.fr: 3.11 (2) - FR_When dangerous goods are no longer in transport, each carrier who transported the dangerous goods must be able to produce a copy of the shipping document that related to the dangerous goods and was required to be in the possession of that carrier while the dangerous goods were in transport

title.en: 3.11 (2) (a) - for two years after the date the dangerous goods are no longer in transport; and
title.fr: 3.11 (2) (a) - FR_for two years after the date the dangerous goods are no longer in transport; and

title.en: 3.11 (2) (b) - within 15 days after the day on which the carrier receives a written request from an inspector.
title.fr: 3.11 (2) (b) - FR_within 15 days after the day on which the carrier receives a written request from an inspector.

title.en: 3.11 (3) - Subsection (2) does not apply to a carrier who transported dangerous goods
title.fr: 3.11 (3) - FR_Subsection (2) does not apply to a carrier who transported dangerous goods

title.en: 3.11 (3) (a) - from a place outside Canada, through Canada to a place outside Canada or for a portion of such transportation; or
title.fr: 3.11 (3) (a) - FR_from a place outside Canada, through Canada to a place outside Canada or for a portion of such transportation; or

title.en: 3.11 (3) (b) - entirely outside Canada
title.fr: 3.11 (3) (b) - FR_entirely outside Canada

title.en: 3.11 (3) (b) (i) - on board a vessel, or
title.fr: 3.11 (3) (b) (i) - FR_on board a vessel, or

title.en: 3.11 (3) (b) (ii) - on board an aircraft that is registered in Canada and leased to a foreign carrier.
title.fr: 3.11 (3) (b) (ii) - FR_on board an aircraft that is registered in Canada and leased to a foreign carrier.

title.en: 3.11 (4) - Subsection (2) does not apply to a carrier who is involved only in handling the dangerous goods, including storing them in the course of transport.
title.fr: 3.11 (4) - FR_Subsection (2) does not apply to a carrier who is involved only in handling the dangerous goods, including storing them in the course of transport.

title.en: 3.11 (5) - The shipping documents referred to in this section may be kept as electronic copies.
title.fr: 3.11 (5) - FR_The shipping documents referred to in this section may be kept as electronic copies.

title.en: PART 4 - Dangerous Goods Safety Marks
title.fr: PART 4 - FR_Dangerous Goods Safety Marks

title.en: - Requirements for Dangerous Goods Safety Marks
title.fr: - FR_Requirements for Dangerous Goods Safety Marks

title.en: 4.1 - A person must not offer for transport, transport or import a means of containment that contains dangerous goods unless each dangerous goods safety mark required by this Part and illustrated in the appendix to this Part, or illustrated in Chapter 5.2 or 5.3 of the UN Recommendations, is displayed on it in accordance with this Part.
title.fr: 4.1 - FR_A person must not offer for transport, transport or import a means of containment that contains dangerous goods unless each dangerous goods safety mark required by this Part and illustrated in the appendix to this Part, or illustrated in Chapter 5.2 or 5.3 of the UN Recommendations, is displayed on it in accordance with this Part.

title.en: - Voluntary Display of a Placard
title.fr: - FR_Voluntary Display of a Placard

title.en: 4.1.1 - When a person transports dangerous goods in or on a road vehicle or railway vehicle and the person voluntarily displays a placard on the vehicle, the following provisions apply:
title.fr: 4.1.1 - FR_When a person transports dangerous goods in or on a road vehicle or railway vehicle and the person voluntarily displays a placard on the vehicle, the following provisions apply:

title.en: 4.1.1 (a) - section 4.2;
title.fr: 4.1.1 (a) - FR_section 4.2;

title.en: 4.1.1 (b) - sections 4.6 and 4.7;
title.fr: 4.1.1 (b) - FR_sections 4.6 and 4.7;

title.en: 4.1.1 (c) - subsection 4.9(2);
title.fr: 4.1.1 (c) - FR_subsection 4.9(2);

title.en: 4.1.1 (e) - paragraphs 4.15.3(a) and (b); and
title.fr: 4.1.1 (e) - FR_paragraphs 4.15.3(a) and (b); and
4.1.1 (f) - FR_section 4.16.

title.en: - Misleading Dangerous Goods Safety Marks
title.fr: - FR_Misleading Dangerous Goods Safety Marks

title.en: 4.2 (1) - As provided for in section 6.1 of the Act, a person must not display a dangerous goods safety mark on a means of containment or a means of transport if the mark is misleading as to the presence or nature of any danger.
title.fr: 4.2 (1) - FR_As provided for in section 6.1 of the Act, a person must not display a dangerous goods safety mark on a means of containment or a means of transport if the mark is misleading as to the presence or nature of any danger.

title.en: 4.2 (2) - As provided for in section 6.1 of the Act, a person must not display a mark other than a dangerous goods safety mark on a means of containment or a means of transport if the other mark is likely to be mistaken for a dangerous goods safety mark or is misleading as to the presence or nature of any danger.
title.fr: 4.2 (2) - FR_As provided for in section 6.1 of the Act, a person must not display a mark other than a dangerous goods safety mark on a means of containment or a means of transport if the other mark is likely to be mistaken for a dangerous goods safety mark or is misleading as to the presence or nature of any danger.

title.en: - Display of Dangerous Goods Safety Marks Before Loading or Packing a Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Display of Dangerous Goods Safety Marks Before Loading or Packing a Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.3 - A person must not load or pack dangerous goods into a large means of containment for transport unless, immediately before the loading or packing, the large means of containment has displayed on it the dangerous goods safety marks that will be required when the loading or packing is complete.
title.fr: 4.3 - FR_A person must not load or pack dangerous goods into a large means of containment for transport unless, immediately before the loading or packing, the large means of containment has displayed on it the dangerous goods safety marks that will be required when the loading or packing is complete.

title.en: - Consignor Responsibilities
title.fr: - FR_Consignor Responsibilities

title.en: 4.4 (1) - Before importing dangerous goods or allowing a carrier in Canada to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must
title.fr: 4.4 (1) - FR_Before importing dangerous goods or allowing a carrier in Canada to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must

title.en: 4.4 (1) (a) - display or ensure the display of the required dangerous goods safety marks on each small means of containment that contains the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 4.4 (1) (a) - FR_display or ensure the display of the required dangerous goods safety marks on each small means of containment that contains the dangerous goods;

title.en: 4.4 (1) (b) - display or ensure the display of the required dangerous goods safety marks on each large means of containment that contains the dangerous goods; and
title.fr: 4.4 (1) (b) - FR_display or ensure the display of the required dangerous goods safety marks on each large means of containment that contains the dangerous goods; and

title.en: 4.4 (1) (c) - provide to the carrier the dangerous goods safety marks for the dangerous goods that the consignor is offering for transport or importing and that are to be transported in a large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.4 (1) (c) - FR_provide to the carrier the dangerous goods safety marks for the dangerous goods that the consignor is offering for transport or importing and that are to be transported in a large means of containment.

title.en: 4.4 (2) - The consignor is not required to provide the dangerous goods safety marks referred to in paragraph (1)(c) if they
title.fr: 4.4 (2) - FR_The consignor is not required to provide the dangerous goods safety marks referred to in paragraph (1)(c) if they

title.en: 4.4 (2) (a) - are already displayed on the large means of containment; or
title.fr: 4.4 (2) (a) - FR_are already displayed on the large means of containment; or

title.en: 4.4 (2) (b) - are not the correct ones to display because of the presence of other dangerous goods in the large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.4 (2) (b) - FR_are not the correct ones to display because of the presence of other dangerous goods in the large means of containment.

title.en: - Carrier Responsibilities
title.fr: - FR_Carrier Responsibilities

title.en: 4.5 - The carrier of dangerous goods must
title.fr: 4.5 - FR_The carrier of dangerous goods must

title.en: 4.5 (a) - ensure that the required dangerous goods safety marks remain displayed on the small means of containment while the dangerous goods are in transport;
title.fr: 4.5 (a) - FR_ensure that the required dangerous goods safety marks remain displayed on the small means of containment while the dangerous goods are in transport;

title.en: 4.5 (b) - display the required dangerous goods safety marks on the large means of containment, unless they are already displayed on it, and ensure that they remain displayed while the dangerous goods are in transport; and
title.fr: 4.5 (b) - FR_display the required dangerous goods safety marks on the large means of containment, unless they are already displayed on it, and ensure that they remain displayed while the dangerous goods are in transport; and

title.en: 4.5 (c) - provide and display, or remove, the dangerous goods safety marks if the requirements for dangerous goods safety marks change while the dangerous goods are in transport.
title.fr: 4.5 (c) - FR_provide and display, or remove, the dangerous goods safety marks if the requirements for dangerous goods safety marks change while the dangerous goods are in transport.

title.en: - Visibility, Legibility and Colour
title.fr: - FR_Visibility, Legibility and Colour

title.en: 4.6 - Dangerous goods safety marks must be
title.fr: 4.6 - FR_Dangerous goods safety marks must be

title.en: 4.6 (a) - visible, legible and displayed against a background of contrasting colour;
title.fr: 4.6 (a) - FR_visible, legible and displayed against a background of contrasting colour;

title.en: 4.6 (b) - made of durable and weather-resistant material that will withstand the conditions to which they will be exposed without substantial detachment or deterioration of their colour, symbols, letters, text or numbers; and
title.fr: 4.6 (b) - FR_made of durable and weather-resistant material that will withstand the conditions to which they will be exposed without substantial detachment or deterioration of their colour, symbols, letters, text or numbers; and

title.en: 4.6 (c) - displayed in the colours specified in
title.fr: 4.6 (c) - FR_displayed in the colours specified in

title.en: 4.6 (c) (i) - the appendix to this Part, which colours must conform to the following standards in the PANTONE ® Formula Guide, published by Pantone Inc., 590 Commerce Boulevard, Carlstadt, New Jersey 07072-3098, United States:
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (i) - FR_the appendix to this Part, which colours must conform to the following standards in the PANTONE ® Formula Guide, published by Pantone Inc., 590 Commerce Boulevard, Carlstadt, New Jersey 07072-3098, United States:

title.en: 4.6 (c) (i) (A) - for blue, PANTONE 285,
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (i) (A) - FR_for blue, PANTONE 285,

title.en: 4.6 (c) (i) (B) - for green, PANTONE 335,
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (i) (B) - FR_for green, PANTONE 335,

title.en: 4.6 (c) (i) (C) - for orange, PANTONE 151,
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (i) (C) - FR_for orange, PANTONE 151,

title.en: 4.6 (c) (i) (D) - for red, PANTONE 186, and
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (i) (D) - FR_for red, PANTONE 186, and

title.en: 4.6 (c) (i) (E) - for yellow, PANTONE 109,
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (i) (E) - FR_for yellow, PANTONE 109,

title.en: 4.6 (c) (ii) - Part 172 of 49 CFR, or
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (ii) - FR_Part 172 of 49 CFR, or

title.en: 4.6 (c) (iii) - Chapters 5.2 and 5.3 of the UN Recommendations.
title.fr: 4.6 (c) (iii) - FR_Chapters 5.2 and 5.3 of the UN Recommendations.

title.en: - Labels and Placards: Size and Orientation
title.fr: - FR_Labels and Placards: Size and Orientation

title.en: 4.7 (1) - Labels and placards must be displayed on a means of containment as they are illustrated in the appendix to this Part, that is, a square on a point.
title.fr: 4.7 (1) - FR_Labels and placards must be displayed on a means of containment as they are illustrated in the appendix to this Part, that is, a square on a point.

title.en: 4.7 (2) - Each side of a label must be at least 100 mm in length with a line running 5 mm inside the edge. However, except for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, if that size label, together with the shipping name, technical name and UN number, cannot be displayed because of the irregular shape or size of the small means of containment, each side of the label may be reduced in length by the same amount to the point where the label, together with the shipping name, technical name and UN number, will fit that small means of containment, but must not be reduced to less than 30 mm.
title.fr: 4.7 (2) - FR_Each side of a label must be at least 100 mm in length with a line running 5 mm inside the edge. However, except for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, if that size label, together with the shipping name, technical name and UN number, cannot be displayed because of the irregular shape or size of the small means of containment, each side of the label may be reduced in length by the same amount to the point where the label, together with the shipping name, technical name and UN number, will fit that small means of containment, but must not be reduced to less than 30 mm.

title.en: 4.7 (3) - Each side of a placard must be at least 250 mm in length and, except for the DANGER placard, have a line running 12.5 mm inside the edge. However, except for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, if that size placard cannot be displayed because of the irregular shape or size of the large means of containment, each side of the placard may be reduced in length by the same amount to the point where the placard will fit that large means of containment, but must not be reduced to less than 100 mm.
title.fr: 4.7 (3) - FR_Each side of a placard must be at least 250 mm in length and, except for the DANGER placard, have a line running 12.5 mm inside the edge. However, except for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, if that size placard cannot be displayed because of the irregular shape or size of the large means of containment, each side of the placard may be reduced in length by the same amount to the point where the placard will fit that large means of containment, but must not be reduced to less than 100 mm.

title.en: 4.7 (4) - If the size of a label or a placard is reduced, every symbol, letter and number required on that label or placard must be reduced proportionately.
title.fr: 4.7 (4) - FR_If the size of a label or a placard is reduced, every symbol, letter and number required on that label or placard must be reduced proportionately.

title.en: 4.7 (5) - If a large means of containment contains dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, and a Class 7 placard is required to be displayed in accordance with this Part, the means of containment must have displayed on it the Class 7 placard required or the appropriate optional Class 7 placard illustrated in the appendix to this Part.
title.fr: 4.7 (5) - FR_If a large means of containment contains dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, and a Class 7 placard is required to be displayed in accordance with this Part, the means of containment must have displayed on it the Class 7 placard required or the appropriate optional Class 7 placard illustrated in the appendix to this Part.

title.en: - Ways to Display a UN Number
title.fr: - FR_Ways to Display a UN Number

title.en: 4.8 (1) - A UN number that is required by this Part to be displayed on a small means of containment or on a tag attached to it must be displayed in one of the following ways:
title.fr: 4.8 (1) - FR_A UN number that is required by this Part to be displayed on a small means of containment or on a tag attached to it must be displayed in one of the following ways:

title.en: 4.8 (1) (a) - next to the primary class label for the dangerous goods; or
title.fr: 4.8 (1) (a) - FR_next to the primary class label for the dangerous goods; or

title.en: 4.8 (1) (b) - within a white rectangle located on the primary class label for the dangerous goods, without the prefix “UN”, but it must not obscure the symbol, class number, compatibility group letter or text on the label.
title.fr: 4.8 (1) (b) - FR_within a white rectangle located on the primary class label for the dangerous goods, without the prefix “UN”, but it must not obscure the symbol, class number, compatibility group letter or text on the label.

title.en: 4.8 (2) - A UN number that is required by this Part to be displayed on a large means of containment must be displayed in black numerals not less than 65 mm high in one of the following ways:
title.fr: 4.8 (2) - FR_A UN number that is required by this Part to be displayed on a large means of containment must be displayed in black numerals not less than 65 mm high in one of the following ways:

title.en: 4.8 (2) (a) - on an orange panel placed next to the primary class placard for the dangerous goods, without the prefix “UN”; or
title.fr: 4.8 (2) (a) - FR_on an orange panel placed next to the primary class placard for the dangerous goods, without the prefix “UN”; or

title.en: 4.8 (2) (b) - within a white rectangle located on the primary class placard for the dangerous goods, without the prefix “UN”, but it must not obscure the symbol, class number, compatibility group letter or text on the placard.
title.fr: 4.8 (2) (b) - FR_within a white rectangle located on the primary class placard for the dangerous goods, without the prefix “UN”, but it must not obscure the symbol, class number, compatibility group letter or text on the placard.

title.en: - Removal or Change of Dangerous Goods Safety Marks
title.fr: - FR_Removal or Change of Dangerous Goods Safety Marks

title.en: 4.9 (1) - When the conditions that required the display of dangerous goods safety marks change, the person having the charge, management or control of the means of containment must determine, as a result of the new conditions, whether the dangerous goods safety marks must be changed or removed.
title.fr: 4.9 (1) - FR_When the conditions that required the display of dangerous goods safety marks change, the person having the charge, management or control of the means of containment must determine, as a result of the new conditions, whether the dangerous goods safety marks must be changed or removed.

title.en: 4.9 (2) - The person who neutralizes the contents of the means of containment or who unloads, unpacks, cleans or purges the means of containment must cover or remove the dangerous goods safety mark when the danger indicated by the dangerous goods safety mark is no longer present in the means of containment.
title.fr: 4.9 (2) - FR_The person who neutralizes the contents of the means of containment or who unloads, unpacks, cleans or purges the means of containment must cover or remove the dangerous goods safety mark when the danger indicated by the dangerous goods safety mark is no longer present in the means of containment.

title.en: 4.9 (3) - When the DANGER placard is permitted to be displayed on a large means of containment, a person may continue to display that placard, in place of any other placard, until the large means of containment no longer contains any of the dangerous goods identified by that placard.
title.fr: 4.9 (3) - FR_When the DANGER placard is permitted to be displayed on a large means of containment, a person may continue to display that placard, in place of any other placard, until the large means of containment no longer contains any of the dangerous goods identified by that placard.

title.en: - Labels on a Small Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Labels on a Small Means of Containment

title.en: 4.10 (1) - One label must be displayed on a small means of containment for the primary class and one for each subsidiary class set out in column 3 of Schedule 1 for each of the dangerous goods in transport in the small means of containment, except that
title.fr: 4.10 (1) - FR_One label must be displayed on a small means of containment for the primary class and one for each subsidiary class set out in column 3 of Schedule 1 for each of the dangerous goods in transport in the small means of containment, except that

title.en: 4.10 (1) (a) - a label is not required to be displayed on a small means of containment that is inside another small means of containment if the other small means of containment has a label displayed on it and is not opened during loading or unloading or while the dangerous goods are in transport;
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (a) - FR_a label is not required to be displayed on a small means of containment that is inside another small means of containment if the other small means of containment has a label displayed on it and is not opened during loading or unloading or while the dangerous goods are in transport;

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b) - the oxidizing gas label, illustrated in the appendix to this Part, must be displayed on a small means of containment for the following dangerous goods:
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b) - FR_the oxidizing gas label, illustrated in the appendix to this Part, must be displayed on a small means of containment for the following dangerous goods:

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b) (i) - UN1072, OXYGEN, COMPRESSED,
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b) (i) - FR_UN1072, OXYGEN, COMPRESSED,

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b) (ii) - UN1073, OXYGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID,
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_UN1073, OXYGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID,

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b) (iii) - UN3156, COMPRESSED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S., and
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_UN3156, COMPRESSED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S., and

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b) (iv) - UN3157, LIQUEFIED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S.;
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b) (iv) - FR_UN3157, LIQUEFIED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S.;

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b.1) - the Class 9, lithium battery label, illustrated in the appendix to this Part, must be displayed on a small means of containment for the following dangerous goods:
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b.1) - FR_the Class 9, lithium battery label, illustrated in the appendix to this Part, must be displayed on a small means of containment for the following dangerous goods:

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (i) - UN3090, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES,
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (i) - FR_UN3090, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES,

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (ii) - UN3091, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT,
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (ii) - FR_UN3091, LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT,

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (iii) - UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, and
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (iii) - FR_UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, and

title.en: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (iv) - UN3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT;
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (b.1) (iv) - FR_UN3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT or LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT;

title.en: 4.10 (1) (c) - if the dangerous goods are included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, two labels must be displayed on the small means of containment for the primary class; and
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (c) - FR_if the dangerous goods are included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, two labels must be displayed on the small means of containment for the primary class; and

title.en: 4.10 (1) (d) - when the dangerous goods are included in Class 2, Gases, and are contained in a combination of cylinders each with a capacity greater than 225 L that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement, and are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, and have a combined capacity exceeding 450 L, the combination of cylinders may be placarded as one large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.10 (1) (d) - FR_when the dangerous goods are included in Class 2, Gases, and are contained in a combination of cylinders each with a capacity greater than 225 L that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement, and are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, and have a combined capacity exceeding 450 L, the combination of cylinders may be placarded as one large means of containment.

title.en: 4.10 (2) - For the subsidiary class of Class 1, the label to be displayed is the label for Class 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3 illustrated in the appendix to this Part.
title.fr: 4.10 (2) - FR_For the subsidiary class of Class 1, the label to be displayed is the label for Class 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3 illustrated in the appendix to this Part.

title.en: 4.10 (3) - When a label is required to be displayed, it must be displayed
title.fr: 4.10 (3) - FR_When a label is required to be displayed, it must be displayed

title.en: 4.10 (3) (a) - on any side of the outer surface of a small means of containment other than the side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport;
title.fr: 4.10 (3) (a) - FR_on any side of the outer surface of a small means of containment other than the side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport;

title.en: 4.10 (3) (b) - on or near the shoulder of a cylinder containing dangerous goods; or
title.fr: 4.10 (3) (b) - FR_on or near the shoulder of a cylinder containing dangerous goods; or

title.en: 4.10 (3) (c) - in the case of a label for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, on two opposite sides of the outer surface of a small means of containment, other than the side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport.
title.fr: 4.10 (3) (c) - FR_in the case of a label for dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, on two opposite sides of the outer surface of a small means of containment, other than the side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport.

title.en: 4.10 (4) - Despite subsection (3), a label with sides that are reduced to 30 mm in length in accordance with subsection 4.7(2) may be displayed on a tag that is securely attached to a small means of containment.
title.fr: 4.10 (4) - FR_Despite subsection (3), a label with sides that are reduced to 30 mm in length in accordance with subsection 4.7(2) may be displayed on a tag that is securely attached to a small means of containment.

title.en: 4.10 (5) - Despite subsection (1), a label is not required to be displayed on a small means of containment that contains a radioactive material if the shipping name and UN number of the radioactive material are displayed on the small means of containment and
title.fr: 4.10 (5) - FR_Despite subsection (1), a label is not required to be displayed on a small means of containment that contains a radioactive material if the shipping name and UN number of the radioactive material are displayed on the small means of containment and

title.en: 4.10 (5) (a) - the radioactive material is contained in an exposure device, as defined in the Nuclear Substances and Radiation Devices Regulations, and the small means of containment is marked in accordance with paragraph 16(5)(a) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations; or
title.fr: 4.10 (5) (a) - FR_the radioactive material is contained in an exposure device, as defined in the Nuclear Substances and Radiation Devices Regulations, and the small means of containment is marked in accordance with paragraph 16(5)(a) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations; or

title.en: 4.10 (5) (b) - the radioactive material is LSA-I material, as defined in subsection 1(1) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations, and the small means of containment is marked in accordance with paragraph 16(5)(c) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 4.10 (5) (b) - FR_the radioactive material is LSA-I material, as defined in subsection 1(1) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations, and the small means of containment is marked in accordance with paragraph 16(5)(c) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.en: - Safety Marks on an Overpack
title.fr: - FR_Safety Marks on an Overpack

title.en: 4.10.1 (1) - When a safety mark is required by this Part to be displayed on a small means of containment and the small means of containment is inside an overpack, the person who prepares the overpack must display
title.fr: 4.10.1 (1) - FR_When a safety mark is required by this Part to be displayed on a small means of containment and the small means of containment is inside an overpack, the person who prepares the overpack must display

title.en: 4.10.1 (1) (a) - the word “Overpack” or “Suremballage”, in letters that are at least 12 mm high on a contrasting background, on at least one side of the overpack;
title.fr: 4.10.1 (1) (a) - FR_the word “Overpack” or “Suremballage”, in letters that are at least 12 mm high on a contrasting background, on at least one side of the overpack;

title.en: 4.10.1 (1) (b) - the information required by subsection (3) on one side of the overpack, if its capacity is less than 1.8 m3 (64 cubic feet); and
title.fr: 4.10.1 (1) (b) - FR_the information required by subsection (3) on one side of the overpack, if its capacity is less than 1.8 m3 (64 cubic feet); and

title.en: 4.10.1 (1) (c) - the information required by subsection (3) on two opposite sides of the overpack, if its capacity is greater than or equal to 1.8 m3 (64 cubic feet).
title.fr: 4.10.1 (1) (c) - FR_the information required by subsection (3) on two opposite sides of the overpack, if its capacity is greater than or equal to 1.8 m3 (64 cubic feet).

title.en: 4.10.1 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply if a safety mark for each class of dangerous goods inside the overpack is visible through the overpack.
title.fr: 4.10.1 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply if a safety mark for each class of dangerous goods inside the overpack is visible through the overpack.

title.en: 4.10.1 (3) - The following information must be displayed on the overpack:
title.fr: 4.10.1 (3) - FR_The following information must be displayed on the overpack:

title.en: 4.10.1 (3) (a) - the primary class label and each subsidiary class label for each of the dangerous goods contained in the overpack, except that only one label is required for dangerous goods that are included in the same class; and
title.fr: 4.10.1 (3) (a) - FR_the primary class label and each subsidiary class label for each of the dangerous goods contained in the overpack, except that only one label is required for dangerous goods that are included in the same class; and

title.en: 4.10.1 (3) (b) - the shipping name and UN number of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 4.10.1 (3) (b) - FR_the shipping name and UN number of the dangerous goods.

title.en: 4.10.1 (4) - When dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, are transported in an overpack and a label is required to be displayed by this Part, the overpack must be prepared in accordance with section 16(4) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 4.10.1 (4) - FR_When dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, are transported in an overpack and a label is required to be displayed by this Part, the overpack must be prepared in accordance with section 16(4) of the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.en: - Safety Marks on a Consolidation Bin
title.fr: - FR_Safety Marks on a Consolidation Bin

title.en: 4.10.2 - When a label is required by this Part to be displayed on a small means of containment that is inside a consolidation bin, an indication of each class of dangerous goods contained in the consolidation bin must be clearly and legibly marked on a tag or fixed display device that is attached to the bin.
title.fr: 4.10.2 - FR_When a label is required by this Part to be displayed on a small means of containment that is inside a consolidation bin, an indication of each class of dangerous goods contained in the consolidation bin must be clearly and legibly marked on a tag or fixed display device that is attached to the bin.

title.en: - Shipping Name and Technical Name on a Small Means of Containment or on a Tag
title.fr: - FR_Shipping Name and Technical Name on a Small Means of Containment or on a Tag

title.en: 4.11 (1) - When dangerous goods in transport are in a small means of containment on which a primary class label for the dangerous goods must be displayed, the shipping name of the dangerous goods must be displayed next to the primary class label.
title.fr: 4.11 (1) - FR_When dangerous goods in transport are in a small means of containment on which a primary class label for the dangerous goods must be displayed, the shipping name of the dangerous goods must be displayed next to the primary class label.

title.en: 4.11 (2) - When dangerous goods in transport are subject to special provision 16 and are in a small means of containment on which the shipping name is displayed, the technical name of at least one of the most dangerous substances that predominantly contributes to the hazard or hazards posed by the dangerous goods must be displayed, in parentheses, following the shipping name.
title.fr: 4.11 (2) - FR_When dangerous goods in transport are subject to special provision 16 and are in a small means of containment on which the shipping name is displayed, the technical name of at least one of the most dangerous substances that predominantly contributes to the hazard or hazards posed by the dangerous goods must be displayed, in parentheses, following the shipping name.

title.en: 4.11 (3) - When the primary class label for dangerous goods in transport is displayed on a tag in accordance with subsection 4.10(4), the shipping name and, when required by subsection (2), the technical name of the dangerous goods must also be displayed on the tag.
title.fr: 4.11 (3) - FR_When the primary class label for dangerous goods in transport is displayed on a tag in accordance with subsection 4.10(4), the shipping name and, when required by subsection (2), the technical name of the dangerous goods must also be displayed on the tag.

title.en: - UN Numbers on a Small Means of Containment or on a Tag
title.fr: - FR_UN Numbers on a Small Means of Containment or on a Tag

title.en: 4.12 (1) - When dangerous goods in transport are in a small means of containment on which the primary class label for the dangerous goods is displayed, the UN number for the dangerous goods must be displayed on or next to the primary class label.
title.fr: 4.12 (1) - FR_When dangerous goods in transport are in a small means of containment on which the primary class label for the dangerous goods is displayed, the UN number for the dangerous goods must be displayed on or next to the primary class label.

title.en: 4.12 (2) - When the primary class label for dangerous goods in transport is displayed on a tag in accordance with subsection 4.10(4), the UN number must also be displayed on the tag on or next to the primary class label.
title.fr: 4.12 (2) - FR_When the primary class label for dangerous goods in transport is displayed on a tag in accordance with subsection 4.10(4), the UN number must also be displayed on the tag on or next to the primary class label.

title.en: - Class 7, Radioactive Material
title.fr: - FR_Class 7, Radioactive Material

title.en: 4.14 (1) - For dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Material, the label or placard required to be displayed by this Part must be determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 4.14 (1) - FR_For dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Material, the label or placard required to be displayed by this Part must be determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.en: 4.14 (2) - For dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Material, the following information must be determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations, and must be displayed on the primary class label for the dangerous goods:
title.fr: 4.14 (2) - FR_For dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Material, the following information must be determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations, and must be displayed on the primary class label for the dangerous goods:

title.en: 4.14 (2) (a) - the name or symbol of the radionuclide, except that if there is a mixture of radionuclides, the name or symbol of the most restrictive of the radionuclides in the mixture; and
title.fr: 4.14 (2) (a) - FR_the name or symbol of the radionuclide, except that if there is a mixture of radionuclides, the name or symbol of the most restrictive of the radionuclides in the mixture; and

title.en: 4.14 (2) (b) - the activity and the transport index of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 4.14 (2) (b) - FR_the activity and the transport index of the dangerous goods.

title.en: - Placards on a Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Placards on a Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.15 (1) - The primary class placard for each of the dangerous goods contained in a large means of containment, other than a vessel or an aircraft, must be displayed on each side and on each end of the large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.15 (1) - FR_The primary class placard for each of the dangerous goods contained in a large means of containment, other than a vessel or an aircraft, must be displayed on each side and on each end of the large means of containment.

title.en: 4.15 (2) - If two or more dangerous goods have different UN numbers but are identified by the same placard or placards, the placard or placards are required to be displayed only once on each side and on each end of a large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.15 (2) - FR_If two or more dangerous goods have different UN numbers but are identified by the same placard or placards, the placard or placards are required to be displayed only once on each side and on each end of a large means of containment.

title.en: - Subsidiary Class Placards on a Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Subsidiary Class Placards on a Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.15.1 - A subsidiary class placard for dangerous goods must be displayed, next to the primary class placard for the dangerous goods, on each side and on each end of a large means of containment if the dangerous goods require an ERAP and
title.fr: 4.15.1 - FR_A subsidiary class placard for dangerous goods must be displayed, next to the primary class placard for the dangerous goods, on each side and on each end of a large means of containment if the dangerous goods require an ERAP and

title.en: 4.15.1 (a) - have a subsidiary class of Class 1, Explosives, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3 in the appendix to this Part;
title.fr: 4.15.1 (a) - FR_have a subsidiary class of Class 1, Explosives, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3 in the appendix to this Part;

title.en: 4.15.1 (b) - have a subsidiary class of Class 4.3, Water-reactive Substances, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 4.3 in the appendix to this Part;
title.fr: 4.15.1 (b) - FR_have a subsidiary class of Class 4.3, Water-reactive Substances, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 4.3 in the appendix to this Part;

title.en: 4.15.1 (c) - have a subsidiary class of Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, and are included in Packing Group I due to inhalation toxicity, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 6.1 in the appendix to this Part; or
title.fr: 4.15.1 (c) - FR_have a subsidiary class of Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, and are included in Packing Group I due to inhalation toxicity, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 6.1 in the appendix to this Part; or

title.en: 4.15.1 (d) - have a subsidiary class of Class 8, Corrosives, and are UN2977, RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL, URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE, FISSILE, or UN2978, RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL, URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE, non-fissile or fissile excepted, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 8 in the appendix to this Part.
title.fr: 4.15.1 (d) - FR_have a subsidiary class of Class 8, Corrosives, and are UN2977, RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL, URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE, FISSILE, or UN2978, RADIOACTIVE MATERIAL, URANIUM HEXAFLUORIDE, non-fissile or fissile excepted, in which case the placard is the one illustrated for Class 8 in the appendix to this Part.

title.en: - UN Numbers on a Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_UN Numbers on a Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.15.2 - UN numbers, except UN numbers for dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, must be displayed on a large means of containment in accordance with subsection 4.8(2) if the dangerous goods
title.fr: 4.15.2 - FR_UN numbers, except UN numbers for dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, must be displayed on a large means of containment in accordance with subsection 4.8(2) if the dangerous goods

title.en: 4.15.2 (a) - are in a quantity or concentration for which an ERAP is required; or
title.fr: 4.15.2 (a) - FR_are in a quantity or concentration for which an ERAP is required; or

title.en: 4.15.2 (b) - are a liquid or a gas in direct contact with the large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.15.2 (b) - FR_are a liquid or a gas in direct contact with the large means of containment.

title.en: - Placards and UN Numbers on a Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Placards and UN Numbers on a Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.15.3 - A placard, or a placard and UN number, must be displayed on each side and on each end of a large means of containment, except that
title.fr: 4.15.3 - FR_A placard, or a placard and UN number, must be displayed on each side and on each end of a large means of containment, except that

title.en: 4.15.3 (a) - in the case of a large means of containment that is permanently connected to a frame, such as a truck frame or a supporting frame for the means of containment, the placard, or the placard and UN number, may be displayed on the frame if the resulting position of the placard, or the placard and UN number, is equivalent on each side and on each end of the means of containment;
title.fr: 4.15.3 (a) - FR_in the case of a large means of containment that is permanently connected to a frame, such as a truck frame or a supporting frame for the means of containment, the placard, or the placard and UN number, may be displayed on the frame if the resulting position of the placard, or the placard and UN number, is equivalent on each side and on each end of the means of containment;

title.en: 4.15.3 (b) - in the case of a large means of containment that is a trailer unit, the placard, or the placard and UN number, may be displayed on the front of the vehicle that is attached to the trailer unit rather than on the leading end of the trailer unit; and
title.fr: 4.15.3 (b) - FR_in the case of a large means of containment that is a trailer unit, the placard, or the placard and UN number, may be displayed on the front of the vehicle that is attached to the trailer unit rather than on the leading end of the trailer unit; and

title.en: 4.15.3 (c) - in the case of a large means of containment that is an intermediate bulk container (IBC) with a capacity greater than 450 L but less than or equal to 3 000 L,
title.fr: 4.15.3 (c) - FR_in the case of a large means of containment that is an intermediate bulk container (IBC) with a capacity greater than 450 L but less than or equal to 3 000 L,

title.en: 4.15.3 (c) (i) - a placard and UN number may be displayed on two opposite sides of the IBC, or
title.fr: 4.15.3 (c) (i) - FR_a placard and UN number may be displayed on two opposite sides of the IBC, or

title.en: 4.15.3 (c) (ii) - a label for each primary and subsidiary class as well as a UN number and a shipping name may be displayed on two opposite sides of the IBC.
title.fr: 4.15.3 (c) (ii) - FR_a label for each primary and subsidiary class as well as a UN number and a shipping name may be displayed on two opposite sides of the IBC.

title.en: - Visibility of Labels, Placards and UN Numbers on a Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Visibility of Labels, Placards and UN Numbers on a Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.15.4 (1) - When a large means of containment that has labels or placards displayed on it is inside another large means of containment and those labels or placards are not visible, the placards required by this Part must be displayed on the outer large means of containment. The UN numbers that are required by this Part must also be displayed on the outer large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.15.4 (1) - FR_When a large means of containment that has labels or placards displayed on it is inside another large means of containment and those labels or placards are not visible, the placards required by this Part must be displayed on the outer large means of containment. The UN numbers that are required by this Part must also be displayed on the outer large means of containment.

title.en: 4.15.4 (2) - When a large means of containment that has labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, displayed on it is loaded onto another large means of containment and those labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, are visible, the placards, or placards and UN numbers, are not required to be displayed on the other large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.15.4 (2) - FR_When a large means of containment that has labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, displayed on it is loaded onto another large means of containment and those labels, placards, labels and UN numbers, or placards and UN numbers, are visible, the placards, or placards and UN numbers, are not required to be displayed on the other large means of containment.

title.en: - DANGER Placard
title.fr: - FR_DANGER Placard

title.en: 4.16 (1) - Except in the case of the dangerous goods listed in subsection (2) or a flammable gas referred to in subsection (3), a DANGER placard is permitted to be displayed on a large means of containment instead of any other placard required by section 4.15, if
title.fr: 4.16 (1) - FR_Except in the case of the dangerous goods listed in subsection (2) or a flammable gas referred to in subsection (3), a DANGER placard is permitted to be displayed on a large means of containment instead of any other placard required by section 4.15, if

title.en: 4.16 (1) (a) - the large means of containment contains two or more dangerous goods that require different placards; and
title.fr: 4.16 (1) (a) - FR_the large means of containment contains two or more dangerous goods that require different placards; and

title.en: 4.16 (1) (b) - the dangerous goods loaded into the large means of containment are contained in two or more small means of containment.
title.fr: 4.16 (1) (b) - FR_the dangerous goods loaded into the large means of containment are contained in two or more small means of containment.

title.en: 4.16 (2) - The DANGER placard referred to in subsection (1) must not be displayed on a large means of containment for
title.fr: 4.16 (2) - FR_The DANGER placard referred to in subsection (1) must not be displayed on a large means of containment for

title.en: 4.16 (2) (a) - dangerous goods that have a gross mass greater than 1 000 kg, are included in the same class and are offered for transport by one consignor;
title.fr: 4.16 (2) (a) - FR_dangerous goods that have a gross mass greater than 1 000 kg, are included in the same class and are offered for transport by one consignor;

title.en: 4.16 (2) (b) - dangerous goods that require an ERAP;
title.fr: 4.16 (2) (b) - FR_dangerous goods that require an ERAP;

title.en: 4.16 (2) (c) - dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives;
title.fr: 4.16 (2) (c) - FR_dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives;

title.en: 4.16 (2) (d) - dangerous goods included in Class 2.3, Toxic Gases;

title.en: - Placarding Exemption for Dangerous Goods Having a Gross Mass of 500 kg or Less

title.en: 4.16.1 (1) - Except in the case of the dangerous goods listed in subsection (2), a placard is not required to be displayed on a road vehicle or railway vehicle if the dangerous goods in or on the road vehicle or railway vehicle have a gross mass that is less than or equal to 500 kg.

title.en: 4.17 (1) - Despite section 4.15, a placard is not required to be displayed for explosives that are included in
title.fr: 4.17 (1) - FR_Despite section 4.15, a placard is not required to be displayed for explosives that are included in

title.fr: 4.17 (2) - FR_Despite section 4.15, only the placard for the explosives with the lowest division number is required to be displayed for explosives that are included in more than one division and are in a large means of containment, except in the following cases:

title.en: - Options for Class 2, Gases
title.fr: - FR_Options for Class 2, Gases

title.en: 4.18 - Despite section 4.15, if a road vehicle transporting toxic gases, flammable gases or oxygen, or gases included in Class 2.2, Non-Flammable and Non-toxic Gases, is placarded with the Toxic Gases placard, the following placards are not required to be displayed on the road vehicle:
title.fr: 4.18 - FR_Despite section 4.15, if a road vehicle transporting toxic gases, flammable gases or oxygen, or gases included in Class 2.2, Non-Flammable and Non-toxic Gases, is placarded with the Toxic Gases placard, the following placards are not required to be displayed on the road vehicle:

title.en: 4.18 (a) - the Flammable Gases placard;
title.fr: 4.18 (a) - FR_the Flammable Gases placard;

title.en: 4.18 (b) - the Oxidizing Gases placard; and
title.fr: 4.18 (b) - FR_the Oxidizing Gases placard; and

title.en: 4.18 (c) - the Non-Flammable and Non-toxic Gases placard.
title.fr: 4.18 (c) - FR_the Non-Flammable and Non-toxic Gases placard.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases: Placards for Oxidizing Gases
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases: Placards for Oxidizing Gases

title.en: 4.18.1 - When dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, and contained in a large means of containment are oxidizing gases, the oxidizing gas placard illustrated in the appendix to this Part must be displayed on the large means of containment for the following dangerous goods instead of the placard required by section 4.15, but if an ERAP is required for the dangerous goods the UN number must also be displayed:
title.fr: 4.18.1 - FR_When dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, and contained in a large means of containment are oxidizing gases, the oxidizing gas placard illustrated in the appendix to this Part must be displayed on the large means of containment for the following dangerous goods instead of the placard required by section 4.15, but if an ERAP is required for the dangerous goods the UN number must also be displayed:

title.en: 4.18.1 (a) - UN1072, OXYGEN, COMPRESSED;
title.fr: 4.18.1 (a) - FR_UN1072, OXYGEN, COMPRESSED;

title.en: 4.18.1 (b) - UN1073, OXYGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID;
title.fr: 4.18.1 (b) - FR_UN1073, OXYGEN, REFRIGERATED LIQUID;

title.en: 4.18.1 (c) - UN3156, COMPRESSED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S.; and
title.fr: 4.18.1 (c) - FR_UN3156, COMPRESSED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S.; and

title.en: 4.18.1 (d) - UN3157, LIQUEFIED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S.
title.fr: 4.18.1 (d) - FR_UN3157, LIQUEFIED GAS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases: Placards for UN1005, ANHYDROUS AMMONIA
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases: Placards for UN1005, ANHYDROUS AMMONIA

title.en: 4.18.2 - When UN1005, ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, is contained in a large means of containment, the large means of containment must have displayed on it
title.fr: 4.18.2 - FR_When UN1005, ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, is contained in a large means of containment, the large means of containment must have displayed on it

title.en: 4.18.2 (a) - the Class 2.3 placard and a UN number; or
title.fr: 4.18.2 (a) - FR_the Class 2.3 placard and a UN number; or

title.en: 4.18.2 (b) - the anhydrous ammonia placard and, on at least two sides, the words “Anhydrous Ammonia, Inhalation Hazard” or “Ammoniac anhydre, dangereux par inhalation” in letters
title.fr: 4.18.2 (b) - FR_the anhydrous ammonia placard and, on at least two sides, the words “Anhydrous Ammonia, Inhalation Hazard” or “Ammoniac anhydre, dangereux par inhalation” in letters

title.en: 4.18.2 (b) (i) - at least 6 mm wide and 100 mm high in the case of a tank car,
title.fr: 4.18.2 (b) (i) - FR_at least 6 mm wide and 100 mm high in the case of a tank car,

title.en: 4.18.2 (b) (ii) - at least 4 mm wide and 25 mm high in the case of a portable tank, and
title.fr: 4.18.2 (b) (ii) - FR_at least 4 mm wide and 25 mm high in the case of a portable tank, and

title.en: 4.18.2 (b) (iii) - at least 6 mm wide and 50 mm high in the case of all other large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.18.2 (b) (iii) - FR_at least 6 mm wide and 50 mm high in the case of all other large means of containment.

title.en: - Class 2, Gases: Placards for Tube Trailers
title.fr: - FR_Class 2, Gases: Placards for Tube Trailers

title.en: 4.18.3 - When dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, are contained in a combination of tubes that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement and are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, the combination of tubes may be placarded as if it were one large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.18.3 - FR_When dangerous goods included in Class 2, Gases, are contained in a combination of tubes that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement and are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, the combination of tubes may be placarded as if it were one large means of containment.

title.en: - Placards and UN Numbers on a Compartmentalized Large Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Placards and UN Numbers on a Compartmentalized Large Means of Containment

title.en: 4.19 (1) - When dangerous goods included in different primary classes are transported in different compartments of a compartmentalized large means of containment,
title.fr: 4.19 (1) - FR_When dangerous goods included in different primary classes are transported in different compartments of a compartmentalized large means of containment,

title.en: 4.19 (1) (a) - the primary class placard and the UN number for the dangerous goods in each compartment must be displayed on each side of that compartment; and
title.fr: 4.19 (1) (a) - FR_the primary class placard and the UN number for the dangerous goods in each compartment must be displayed on each side of that compartment; and

title.en: 4.19 (1) (b) - each placard and UN number displayed in accordance with paragraph (a) must be displayed on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment but each specific placard need only be displayed once on each end.
title.fr: 4.19 (1) (b) - FR_each placard and UN number displayed in accordance with paragraph (a) must be displayed on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment but each specific placard need only be displayed once on each end.

title.en: 4.19 (2) - When all compartments in a compartmentalized large means of containment contain dangerous goods included in the same primary class,
title.fr: 4.19 (2) - FR_When all compartments in a compartmentalized large means of containment contain dangerous goods included in the same primary class,

title.en: 4.19 (2) (a) - the primary class placard must be displayed on each side and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment; and
title.fr: 4.19 (2) (a) - FR_the primary class placard must be displayed on each side and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment; and

title.en: 4.19 (2) (b) - the UN number of the dangerous goods in a compartment must be displayed on each side of that compartment and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment, except that, if all the dangerous goods are included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, only the UN number of the dangerous goods with the lowest flash point is required to be displayed on each side and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.19 (2) (b) - FR_the UN number of the dangerous goods in a compartment must be displayed on each side of that compartment and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment, except that, if all the dangerous goods are included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, only the UN number of the dangerous goods with the lowest flash point is required to be displayed on each side and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment.

title.en: 4.19 (3) - Despite paragraph (2)(b), if a compartmentalized large means of containment contains UN3475, ETHANOL AND GASOLINE MIXTURE, the number “3475” must be displayed, in addition to the UN number — without the prefix “UN” — of the dangerous goods with the lowest flash point, on each side and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.19 (3) - FR_Despite paragraph (2)(b), if a compartmentalized large means of containment contains UN3475, ETHANOL AND GASOLINE MIXTURE, the number “3475” must be displayed, in addition to the UN number — without the prefix “UN” — of the dangerous goods with the lowest flash point, on each side and on each end of the compartmentalized large means of containment.

title.en: - Elevated Temperature Sign
title.fr: - FR_Elevated Temperature Sign

title.en: 4.20 (1) - In addition to the requirements for placards and UN numbers in section 4.15, the elevated temperature sign must be displayed for dangerous goods that are contained in a large means of containment and that are offered for transport or transported at a temperature greater than or equal to
title.fr: 4.20 (1) - FR_In addition to the requirements for placards and UN numbers in section 4.15, the elevated temperature sign must be displayed for dangerous goods that are contained in a large means of containment and that are offered for transport or transported at a temperature greater than or equal to

title.en: 4.20 (1) (a) - 100°C if the dangerous goods are in a liquid state; and
title.fr: 4.20 (1) (a) - FR_100°C if the dangerous goods are in a liquid state; and

title.en: 4.20 (1) (b) - 240°C if the dangerous goods are in a solid state.
title.fr: 4.20 (1) (b) - FR_240°C if the dangerous goods are in a solid state.

title.en: 4.20 (2) - The elevated temperature sign must be displayed on each side and on each end of the large means of containment next to each primary class placard for the dangerous goods or, if there is a subsidiary class placard, next to the subsidiary class placard.
title.fr: 4.20 (2) - FR_The elevated temperature sign must be displayed on each side and on each end of the large means of containment next to each primary class placard for the dangerous goods or, if there is a subsidiary class placard, next to the subsidiary class placard.

title.en: - Fumigation Sign
title.fr: - FR_Fumigation Sign

title.en: 4.21 (1) - If the fumigation of a large means of containment is done using dangerous goods, the fumigation sign must be displayed at or next to each entryway through which a person can enter into the large means of containment. The consignor must ensure that the fumigation sign is displayed by the person in charge of the fumigation process and that the sign has displayed on it the name of the fumigant, the date and time the fumigant was applied and the date of ventilation.
title.fr: 4.21 (1) - FR_If the fumigation of a large means of containment is done using dangerous goods, the fumigation sign must be displayed at or next to each entryway through which a person can enter into the large means of containment. The consignor must ensure that the fumigation sign is displayed by the person in charge of the fumigation process and that the sign has displayed on it the name of the fumigant, the date and time the fumigant was applied and the date of ventilation.

title.en: 4.21 (2) - The fumigation sign must continue to be displayed on a large means of containment that has been fumigated until
title.fr: 4.21 (2) - FR_The fumigation sign must continue to be displayed on a large means of containment that has been fumigated until

title.en: 4.21 (2) (a) - the large means of containment has been ventilated to remove harmful concentrations of the fumigant; and
title.fr: 4.21 (2) (a) - FR_the large means of containment has been ventilated to remove harmful concentrations of the fumigant; and

title.en: 4.21 (2) (b) - the dangerous goods that were in the large means of containment during the fumigation have been unloaded.
title.fr: 4.21 (2) (b) - FR_the dangerous goods that were in the large means of containment during the fumigation have been unloaded.

title.en: - Marine Pollutant Mark
title.fr: - FR_Marine Pollutant Mark

title.en: 4.22 (1) - In addition to the requirements for placards and UN numbers in section 4.15, the marine pollutant mark must be displayed in the following locations, for dangerous goods that are marine pollutants in transport by vessel:
title.fr: 4.22 (1) - FR_In addition to the requirements for placards and UN numbers in section 4.15, the marine pollutant mark must be displayed in the following locations, for dangerous goods that are marine pollutants in transport by vessel:

title.en: 4.22 (1) (a) - on a small means of containment, next to the primary class label for the dangerous goods or, if there is a subsidiary class label, next to the subsidiary class label; and
title.fr: 4.22 (1) (a) - FR_on a small means of containment, next to the primary class label for the dangerous goods or, if there is a subsidiary class label, next to the subsidiary class label; and

title.en: 4.22 (1) (b) - on each side and each end of a large means of containment next to the placard that is required to be displayed for the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 4.22 (1) (b) - FR_on each side and each end of a large means of containment next to the placard that is required to be displayed for the dangerous goods.

title.en: 4.22 (2) (b) - contained in

title.fr: 4.22 (2) (b) (i) - FR_a small means of containment and are in a quantity that is less than or equal to 5 L for a liquid marine pollutant or 5 kg for a solid marine pollutant, or

title.en: 4.22 (2) (b) (ii) - a large means of containment and
title.fr: 4.22 (2) (b) (ii) - FR_a large means of containment and

title.en: 4.22 (2) (b) (ii) (B) - are transported by vessel on a domestic voyage, and
title.fr: 4.22 (2) (b) (ii) (B) - FR_are transported by vessel on a domestic voyage, and

title.en: 4.22 (2) (b) (ii) (C) - the large means of containment does not contain Class 1, Explosives, other than explosives included in Class 1.4, Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, or Class 7, Radioactive Materials.
title.fr: 4.22 (2) (b) (ii) (C) - FR_the large means of containment does not contain Class 1, Explosives, other than explosives included in Class 1.4, Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, or Class 7, Radioactive Materials.

title.en: 4.22 (3) - The placard and UN number are not required to be displayed for substances identified as marine pollutants in subparagraph 2.43(b)(ii) when the marine pollutant mark is not required to be displayed in accordance with subsection (2).

title.en: - Category B Mark
title.fr: - FR_Category B Mark

title.en: 4.22.1 - The Category B mark illustrated in the appendix to this Part must be displayed, instead of the Class 6.2, Infectious Substances label, on a small means of containment containing infectious substances included in UN3373, BIOLOGICAL SUBSTANCE, CATEGORY B.
title.fr: 4.22.1 - FR_The Category B mark illustrated in the appendix to this Part must be displayed, instead of the Class 6.2, Infectious Substances label, on a small means of containment containing infectious substances included in UN3373, BIOLOGICAL SUBSTANCE, CATEGORY B.

title.en: - Toxic – Inhalation Hazard
title.fr: - FR_Toxic – Inhalation Hazard

title.en: 4.23 - A person must not import, offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods that are included in Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, in accordance with paragraph 2.28(c) of Part 2 (Classification) or Class 2.3, Toxic Gases, in accordance with paragraph 2.14(c) of Part 2 (Classification), unless the words “inhalation hazard” or “dangereux par inhalation” are displayed
title.fr: 4.23 - FR_A person must not import, offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods that are included in Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, in accordance with paragraph 2.28(c) of Part 2 (Classification) or Class 2.3, Toxic Gases, in accordance with paragraph 2.14(c) of Part 2 (Classification), unless the words “inhalation hazard” or “dangereux par inhalation” are displayed

title.en: 4.23 (a) - in the case of a small means of containment, in letters at least 12 mm high, next to the shipping name, unless these words are already part of the shipping name; and
title.fr: 4.23 (a) - FR_in the case of a small means of containment, in letters at least 12 mm high, next to the shipping name, unless these words are already part of the shipping name; and

title.en: 4.23 (b) - in the case of a large means of containment, on two opposite sides of the large means of containment, in addition to any placard or placard and UN number required by this Part, in letters
title.fr: 4.23 (b) - FR_in the case of a large means of containment, on two opposite sides of the large means of containment, in addition to any placard or placard and UN number required by this Part, in letters

title.en: 4.23 (b) (i) - at least 6 mm wide and 100 mm high in the case of a tank car,
title.fr: 4.23 (b) (i) - FR_at least 6 mm wide and 100 mm high in the case of a tank car,

title.en: 4.23 (b) (ii) - at least 4 mm wide and 25 mm high in the case of a portable tank or an intermediate bulk container (IBC), and
title.fr: 4.23 (b) (ii) - FR_at least 4 mm wide and 25 mm high in the case of a portable tank or an intermediate bulk container (IBC), and

title.en: 4.23 (b) (iii) - at least 6 mm wide and 50 mm high in the case of all other large means of containment.
title.fr: 4.23 (b) (iii) - FR_at least 6 mm wide and 50 mm high in the case of all other large means of containment.

title.fr: 4.24 (1) (a) - FR_“UN3090” for lithium metal cells or batteries;

title.fr: 4.24 (1) (c) - FR_“UN3091” or “UN3481”, as appropriate, for lithium cells or batteries that are contained in, or packed with, equipment.

title.en: 4.24 (2) - When a means of containment contains lithium cells or batteries assigned to different UN numbers, all applicable UN numbers must be indicated on one or more marks.
title.fr: 4.24 (2) - FR_When a means of containment contains lithium cells or batteries assigned to different UN numbers, all applicable UN numbers must be indicated on one or more marks.

title.en: 4.24 (3) - Subject to subsection (4), the mark must be at least 120 mm wide × 110 mm high and the hatching must be at least 5 mm wide.
title.fr: 4.24 (3) - FR_Subject to subsection (4), the mark must be at least 120 mm wide × 110 mm high and the hatching must be at least 5 mm wide.

title.en: 4.24 (4) - The dimensions of the mark may be reduced for a means of containment that is an irregular shape or size if
title.fr: 4.24 (4) - FR_The dimensions of the mark may be reduced for a means of containment that is an irregular shape or size if

title.en: 4.24 (4) (a) - the mark is at least 105 mm wide × 74 mm high; and
title.fr: 4.24 (4) (a) - FR_the mark is at least 105 mm wide × 74 mm high; and

title.en: 4.24 (4) (b) - every symbol, letter and number required on the mark is reduced proportionately.
title.fr: 4.24 (4) (b) - FR_every symbol, letter and number required on the mark is reduced proportionately.
