title.en: PART 5 - Means of Containment
title.fr: PART 5 - FR_Means of Containment

title.en: - Selecting and Using Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Selecting and Using Means of Containment

title.en: 5.1.1 (1) - A person must not handle, offer for transport, transport or import dangerous goods in a means of containment unless the means of containment is required or permitted by this Part to be used for the transportation of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 5.1.1 (1) - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport, transport or import dangerous goods in a means of containment unless the means of containment is required or permitted by this Part to be used for the transportation of the dangerous goods.

title.en: 5.1.1 (2) - A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods in a standardized means of containment unless the standardized means of containment is in standard.
title.fr: 5.1.1 (2) - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods in a standardized means of containment unless the standardized means of containment is in standard.

title.en: 5.1.1 (3) - A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods in a means of containment that is required or permitted by this Part unless the means of containment is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety.
title.fr: 5.1.1 (3) - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods in a means of containment that is required or permitted by this Part unless the means of containment is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety.

title.en: - Requirements for a Standardized Means of Containment to Be in Standard
title.fr: - FR_Requirements for a Standardized Means of Containment to Be in Standard

title.en: 5.2 - A standardized means of containment is in standard with a specific safety standard if it has displayed on it the certification safety marks required by the standard and
title.fr: 5.2 - FR_A standardized means of containment is in standard with a specific safety standard if it has displayed on it the certification safety marks required by the standard and

title.en: 5.2 (a) - was in compliance with the requirements of the standard when each certification safety mark was first displayed; and
title.fr: 5.2 (a) - FR_was in compliance with the requirements of the standard when each certification safety mark was first displayed; and

title.en: 5.2 (b) - remains in compliance with the requirements of the standard that had to be complied with when each certification safety mark was first displayed.
title.fr: 5.2 (b) - FR_remains in compliance with the requirements of the standard that had to be complied with when each certification safety mark was first displayed.

title.en: - Certification Safety Marks on a Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Certification Safety Marks on a Means of Containment

title.en: 5.3 - Any mark required by a safety standard is a certification safety mark and must be visible and legible when it is displayed on a means of containment.
title.fr: 5.3 - FR_Any mark required by a safety standard is a certification safety mark and must be visible and legible when it is displayed on a means of containment.

title.en: - Loading and Securing
title.fr: - FR_Loading and Securing

title.en: 5.4 - A person must load and secure dangerous goods in a means of containment and must load and secure the means of containment on a means of transport in such a way as to prevent, under normal conditions of transport, damage to the means of containment or to the means of transport that could lead to an accidental release of the dangerous goods.
title.fr: 5.4 - FR_A person must load and secure dangerous goods in a means of containment and must load and secure the means of containment on a means of transport in such a way as to prevent, under normal conditions of transport, damage to the means of containment or to the means of transport that could lead to an accidental release of the dangerous goods.

title.en: - Filling Limits
title.fr: - FR_Filling Limits

title.en: 5.5 (1) - A person filling a means of containment with dangerous goods must not exceed the maximum quantity limit specified in a safety standard or safety requirement applicable to that means of containment.
title.fr: 5.5 (1) - FR_A person filling a means of containment with dangerous goods must not exceed the maximum quantity limit specified in a safety standard or safety requirement applicable to that means of containment.

title.en: 5.5 (2) - If the maximum quantity limit for a means of containment is not specified in a safety standard or safety requirement, the person filling the means of containment with dangerous goods
title.fr: 5.5 (2) - FR_If the maximum quantity limit for a means of containment is not specified in a safety standard or safety requirement, the person filling the means of containment with dangerous goods

title.en: 5.5 (2) (a) - must not exceed the maximum quantity limit established by the manufacturer for the means of containment; and
title.fr: 5.5 (2) (a) - FR_must not exceed the maximum quantity limit established by the manufacturer for the means of containment; and

title.en: 5.5 (2) (b) - must ensure that the means of containment could not become liquid full at any temperature that is less than or equal to 55°C.
title.fr: 5.5 (2) (b) - FR_must ensure that the means of containment could not become liquid full at any temperature that is less than or equal to 55°C.

title.en: - UN Standardized Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_UN Standardized Means of Containment

title.en: 5.6 - A means of containment is a UN standardized means of containment if it has displayed on it the applicable UN marks illustrated in Chapter 6.1, Chapter 6.3 and Chapter 6.5 of the UN Recommendations and
title.fr: 5.6 - FR_A means of containment is a UN standardized means of containment if it has displayed on it the applicable UN marks illustrated in Chapter 6.1, Chapter 6.3 and Chapter 6.5 of the UN Recommendations and

title.en: 5.6 (a) - it is in compliance with
title.fr: 5.6 (a) - FR_it is in compliance with

title.en: 5.6 (a) (i) - sections 2 and 3 and Part I of CGSB-43.125 for a Type P620 means of containment,
title.fr: 5.6 (a) (i) - FR_sections 2 and 3 and Part I of CGSB-43.125 for a Type P620 means of containment,

title.en: 5.6 (a) (ii) - sections 2 and 3 and Part I of CGSB-43.146, or
title.fr: 5.6 (a) (ii) - FR_sections 2 and 3 and Part I of CGSB-43.146, or

title.en: 5.6 (a) (iii) - sections 2 and 3 and Part 1 of TP 14850; or
title.fr: 5.6 (a) (iii) - FR_sections 2 and 3 and Part 1 of TP 14850; or

title.en: 5.6 (b) - it was manufactured outside Canada in compliance with Chapter 6.1, 6.3 or 6.5 of the UN Recommendations and with the national regulations of the country of manufacture.
title.fr: 5.6 (b) - FR_it was manufactured outside Canada in compliance with Chapter 6.1, 6.3 or 6.5 of the UN Recommendations and with the national regulations of the country of manufacture.

title.en: - Class 1, Explosives
title.fr: - FR_Class 1, Explosives

title.en: - Compatibility Groups
title.fr: - FR_Compatibility Groups

title.en: 5.7 (1) - A person must not load or transport with other explosives in the same means of transport, except for a vessel, explosives that have a compatibility group letter listed in column 1 of a row in the following table unless the compatibility group letter of the other explosives is listed in column 2 of the same row:
title.fr: 5.7 (1) - FR_A person must not load or transport with other explosives in the same means of transport, except for a vessel, explosives that have a compatibility group letter listed in column 1 of a row in the following table unless the compatibility group letter of the other explosives is listed in column 2 of the same row:

title.en: 5.7 (2) - For a mixed load of two or more explosives with compatibility groups C, D, E, N or S, the compatibility group of the mixed load is the first compatibility group of E, D, C, N or S present in the mixed load.
title.fr: 5.7 (2) - FR_For a mixed load of two or more explosives with compatibility groups C, D, E, N or S, the compatibility group of the mixed load is the first compatibility group of E, D, C, N or S present in the mixed load.

title.en: 5.7 (3) - Despite subsection (1), detonators in compatibility group B may be loaded or transported in the same road vehicle with explosives in compatibility group D or N. The compatibility group of the mixed load is D.
title.fr: 5.7 (3) - FR_Despite subsection (1), detonators in compatibility group B may be loaded or transported in the same road vehicle with explosives in compatibility group D or N. The compatibility group of the mixed load is D.

title.en: 5.7 (4) - Despite subsection (1), explosive articles included in compatibility group G, except for fireworks with UN number UN0333, UN0334, UN0335 or UN0336, may be loaded or transported in the same road vehicle together with explosive articles included in compatibility group C, D or E. The compatibility group of the mixed load is E.
title.fr: 5.7 (4) - FR_Despite subsection (1), explosive articles included in compatibility group G, except for fireworks with UN number UN0333, UN0334, UN0335 or UN0336, may be loaded or transported in the same road vehicle together with explosive articles included in compatibility group C, D or E. The compatibility group of the mixed load is E.

title.en: 5.7 (5) - For a mixed load of two explosives with one of the compatibility groups being S, the compatibility group of the mixed load is that of the other compatibility group.
title.fr: 5.7 (5) - FR_For a mixed load of two explosives with one of the compatibility groups being S, the compatibility group of the mixed load is that of the other compatibility group.

title.en: - Means of Containment for Class 1, Explosives
title.fr: - FR_Means of Containment for Class 1, Explosives

title.en: 5.8 - A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, unless they are in a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.151.
title.fr: 5.8 - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, unless they are in a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.151.

title.en: - UN1950, AEROSOLS, and UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES
title.fr: - FR_UN1950, AEROSOLS, and UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES

title.en: 5.11 - Despite section 5.10, a person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are UN1950, AEROSOLS, or UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES, unless they are contained in a means of containment that is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.123.
title.fr: 5.11 - FR_Despite section 5.10, a person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are UN1950, AEROSOLS, or UN2037, GAS CARTRIDGES, unless they are contained in a means of containment that is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.123.

title.en: - Classes 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 and 9 Dangerous Goods
title.fr: - FR_Classes 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 and 9 Dangerous Goods

title.en: - Small Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Small Means of Containment

title.en: 5.12 (1) - A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 in a small means of containment unless it is a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with Part II of CGSB-43.146 or a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with sections 2 and 3 and with Part 2 of TP 14850.
title.fr: 5.12 (1) - FR_A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 in a small means of containment unless it is a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with Part II of CGSB-43.146 or a means of containment that is selected and used in accordance with sections 2 and 3 and with Part 2 of TP 14850.

title.en: 5.12 (2) - A person must not reuse a steel or plastic drum with a capacity greater than or equal to 150 L to handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are liquid and are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless
title.fr: 5.12 (2) - FR_A person must not reuse a steel or plastic drum with a capacity greater than or equal to 150 L to handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods that are liquid and are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless

title.en: 5.12 (2) (a) - for a steel drum, the requirements for the reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair in Part II of CGSB-43.126 are complied with and the drum reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair facility is registered with Transport Canada in accordance with the requirements of Appendix A of CGSB-43.126; or
title.fr: 5.12 (2) (a) - FR_for a steel drum, the requirements for the reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair in Part II of CGSB-43.126 are complied with and the drum reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair facility is registered with Transport Canada in accordance with the requirements of Appendix A of CGSB-43.126; or

title.en: 5.12 (2) (b) - for a plastic drum, the requirements for the reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair in Part III of CGSB-43.126 are complied with and the drum reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair facility is registered with Transport Canada in accordance with the requirements of Appendix A of CGSB-43.126.
title.fr: 5.12 (2) (b) - FR_for a plastic drum, the requirements for the reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair in Part III of CGSB-43.126 are complied with and the drum reconditioning, remanufacturing and repair facility is registered with Transport Canada in accordance with the requirements of Appendix A of CGSB-43.126.

title.en: 5.12 (3) - The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized small means of containment manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with section 4.4 of TP 14850. The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized intermediate bulk container (IBC) manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with clause 4.8 of CGSB-43.146.
title.fr: 5.12 (3) - FR_The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized small means of containment manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with section 4.4 of TP 14850. The manufacturer or subsequent distributor of a UN standardized intermediate bulk container (IBC) manufactured in Canada must provide a notice to the initial user in accordance with clause 4.8 of CGSB-43.146.

title.en: 5.12 (4) - A person must not reuse an IBC for liquids, or an IBC for solids, that is filled or discharged under pressure to offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods that are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless it has been leak tested and inspected in accordance with clause 12.6 of CGSB-43.146.
title.fr: 5.12 (4) - FR_A person must not reuse an IBC for liquids, or an IBC for solids, that is filled or discharged under pressure to offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods that are included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 unless it has been leak tested and inspected in accordance with clause 12.6 of CGSB-43.146.

title.en: 5.12 (5) - In addition to the requirements set out in subsection (1), a person who uses a means of containment that is required under CGSB-43.146 for the offering for transport of dangerous goods must follow the requirements of clauses 12.2, 12.3 and 12.4 of CGSB-43.146.
title.fr: 5.12 (5) - FR_In addition to the requirements set out in subsection (1), a person who uses a means of containment that is required under CGSB-43.146 for the offering for transport of dangerous goods must follow the requirements of clauses 12.2, 12.3 and 12.4 of CGSB-43.146.

title.en: 5.14 (1) (c) - for transport by aircraft, Part 12 (Air) of these Regulations; and
title.fr: 5.14 (1) (c) - FR_for transport by aircraft, Part 12 (Air) of these Regulations; and

title.en: 5.14 (2) - In addition to the requirements of subparagraphs (1)(a)(ii) and (d)(iii), a person who uses a standardized means of containment that is required by CSA B621 to offer for transport dangerous goods included in Class 3, 4, 5, 6.1, 8 or 9 must use a means of containment

title.en: - Class 6.2, Infectious Substances
title.fr: - FR_Class 6.2, Infectious Substances

title.en: - Means of Containment for Class 6.2, Infectious Substances
title.fr: - FR_Means of Containment for Class 6.2, Infectious Substances

title.en: 5.16 (1) - A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods included in Category A or Category B of Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, unless the dangerous goods are in a means of containment that is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.125.
title.fr: 5.16 (1) - FR_A person must not offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods included in Category A or Category B of Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, unless the dangerous goods are in a means of containment that is manufactured, selected and used in accordance with CGSB-43.125.

title.en: 5.16 (2) - If the means of containment is made available as a kit, the packaging manufacturer and subsequent distributor must provide the packaging information required under section 4.4 of CGSB-43.125 to the packaging purchaser at each initial purchase and to a packaging user upon request.
title.fr: 5.16 (2) - FR_If the means of containment is made available as a kit, the packaging manufacturer and subsequent distributor must provide the packaging information required under section 4.4 of CGSB-43.125 to the packaging purchaser at each initial purchase and to a packaging user upon request.

title.en: - Class 7, Radioactive Materials
title.fr: - FR_Class 7, Radioactive Materials

title.en: - Means of Containment for Class 7, Radioactive Materials
title.fr: - FR_Means of Containment for Class 7, Radioactive Materials

title.en: 5.17 - A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, in a means of containment unless the means of containment is in compliance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 5.17 - FR_A person must not handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, in a means of containment unless the means of containment is in compliance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.en: - Consolidation Bins
title.fr: - FR_Consolidation Bins

title.en: - Consolidation Bins
title.fr: - FR_Consolidation Bins

title.en: 5.18 - A person must not use a consolidation bin to handle or transport dangerous goods in a road vehicle unless
title.fr: 5.18 - FR_A person must not use a consolidation bin to handle or transport dangerous goods in a road vehicle unless

title.en: 5.18 (a) - the capacity of the consolidation bin is less than or equal to 1.8 m3 (64 cubic feet);
title.fr: 5.18 (a) - FR_the capacity of the consolidation bin is less than or equal to 1.8 m3 (64 cubic feet);

title.en: 5.18 (b) - the consolidation bin is reusable and constructed of plastic, wood or metal; and
title.fr: 5.18 (b) - FR_the consolidation bin is reusable and constructed of plastic, wood or metal; and

title.en: 5.18 (c) - the consolidation bin is blocked or braced within the road vehicle.
title.fr: 5.18 (c) - FR_the consolidation bin is blocked or braced within the road vehicle.

title.en: PART 6 - Training
title.fr: PART 6 - FR_Training

title.en: - Training Certificate Requirements
title.fr: - FR_Training Certificate Requirements

title.en: 6.1 (1) - A person who handles, offers for transport or transports dangerous goods must
title.fr: 6.1 (1) - FR_A person who handles, offers for transport or transports dangerous goods must

title.en: 6.1 (1) (a) - be adequately trained and hold a training certificate in accordance with this Part; or
title.fr: 6.1 (1) (a) - FR_be adequately trained and hold a training certificate in accordance with this Part; or

title.en: 6.1 (1) (b) - perform those activities in the presence and under the direct supervision of a person who is adequately trained and who holds a training certificate in accordance with this Part.
title.fr: 6.1 (1) (b) - FR_perform those activities in the presence and under the direct supervision of a person who is adequately trained and who holds a training certificate in accordance with this Part.

title.en: 6.1 (2) - An employer must not direct or allow an employee to handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods unless the employee
title.fr: 6.1 (2) - FR_An employer must not direct or allow an employee to handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods unless the employee

title.en: 6.1 (2) (a) - is adequately trained and holds a training certificate in accordance with this Part; or
title.fr: 6.1 (2) (a) - FR_is adequately trained and holds a training certificate in accordance with this Part; or

title.en: 6.1 (2) (b) - performs those activities in the presence and under the direct supervision of a person who is adequately trained and who holds a training certificate in accordance with this Part.
title.fr: 6.1 (2) (b) - FR_performs those activities in the presence and under the direct supervision of a person who is adequately trained and who holds a training certificate in accordance with this Part.

title.en: - Adequate Training
title.fr: - FR_Adequate Training

title.en: 6.2 - A person is adequately trained if the person has a sound knowledge of all the topics listed in paragraphs (a) to (m) that relate directly to the person’s duties and to the dangerous goods the person is expected to handle, offer for transport or transport:
title.fr: 6.2 - FR_A person is adequately trained if the person has a sound knowledge of all the topics listed in paragraphs (a) to (m) that relate directly to the person’s duties and to the dangerous goods the person is expected to handle, offer for transport or transport:

title.en: 6.2 (a) - the classification criteria and test methods in Part 2 (Classification);
title.fr: 6.2 (a) - FR_the classification criteria and test methods in Part 2 (Classification);

title.en: 6.2 (b) - shipping names;
title.fr: 6.2 (b) - FR_shipping names;

title.en: 6.2 (c) - the use of Schedules 1, 2 and 3;
title.fr: 6.2 (c) - FR_the use of Schedules 1, 2 and 3;

title.en: 6.2 (d) - the shipping document and train consist requirements in Part 3 (Documentation);
title.fr: 6.2 (d) - FR_the shipping document and train consist requirements in Part 3 (Documentation);

title.en: 6.2 (e) - the dangerous goods safety marks requirements in Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks);
title.fr: 6.2 (e) - FR_the dangerous goods safety marks requirements in Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks);

title.en: 6.2 (f) - the certification safety marks requirements, safety requirements and safety standards in Part 5 (Means of Containment);
title.fr: 6.2 (f) - FR_the certification safety marks requirements, safety requirements and safety standards in Part 5 (Means of Containment);

title.en: 6.2 (g) - the ERAP requirements in Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan);
title.fr: 6.2 (g) - FR_the ERAP requirements in Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan);

title.en: 6.2 (h) - the report requirements in Part 8 (Reporting Requirements);
title.fr: 6.2 (h) - FR_the report requirements in Part 8 (Reporting Requirements);

title.en: 6.2 (i) - safe handling and transportation practices for dangerous goods, including the characteristics of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 6.2 (i) - FR_safe handling and transportation practices for dangerous goods, including the characteristics of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 6.2 (j) - the proper use of any equipment used to handle or transport the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 6.2 (j) - FR_the proper use of any equipment used to handle or transport the dangerous goods;

title.en: 6.2 (k) - the reasonable emergency measures the person must take to reduce or eliminate any danger to public safety that results or may reasonably be expected to result from an accidental release of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 6.2 (k) - FR_the reasonable emergency measures the person must take to reduce or eliminate any danger to public safety that results or may reasonably be expected to result from an accidental release of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 6.2 (l) - for air transport, the aspects of training set out in Chapter 4, Training, of Part 1, General, of the ICAO Technical Instructions for the persons named in that Chapter and the requirements in Part 12 (Air) of these Regulations; and
title.fr: 6.2 (l) - FR_for air transport, the aspects of training set out in Chapter 4, Training, of Part 1, General, of the ICAO Technical Instructions for the persons named in that Chapter and the requirements in Part 12 (Air) of these Regulations; and

title.en: 6.2 (m) - for marine transport, the requirements of the IMDG Code and the requirements of Part 11 (Marine) of these Regulations.
title.fr: 6.2 (m) - FR_for marine transport, the requirements of the IMDG Code and the requirements of Part 11 (Marine) of these Regulations.

title.en: - Issuance and Contents of a Training Certificate
title.fr: - FR_Issuance and Contents of a Training Certificate

title.en: 6.3 (1) - An employer who has reasonable grounds to believe that an employee is adequately trained and will perform duties to which the training relates must issue a training certificate to the employee that includes the following information:
title.fr: 6.3 (1) - FR_An employer who has reasonable grounds to believe that an employee is adequately trained and will perform duties to which the training relates must issue a training certificate to the employee that includes the following information:

title.en: 6.3 (1) (a) - the name and address of the place of business of the employer;
title.fr: 6.3 (1) (a) - FR_the name and address of the place of business of the employer;

title.en: 6.3 (1) (b) - the employee’s name;
title.fr: 6.3 (1) (b) - FR_the employee’s name;

title.en: 6.3 (1) (c) - the date the training certificate expires, preceded by the words “Expires on” or “Date d’expiration”; and
title.fr: 6.3 (1) (c) - FR_the date the training certificate expires, preceded by the words “Expires on” or “Date d’expiration”; and

title.en: 6.3 (1) (d) - the aspects of handling, offering for transport or transporting dangerous goods for which the employee is trained, including the specific topics set out in section 6.2.
title.fr: 6.3 (1) (d) - FR_the aspects of handling, offering for transport or transporting dangerous goods for which the employee is trained, including the specific topics set out in section 6.2.

title.en: 6.3 (2) - A self-employed person who has reasonable grounds to believe that he or she is adequately trained and who will perform duties to which the training relates must issue to himself or herself a training certificate that includes the information required by subsection (1).
title.fr: 6.3 (2) - FR_A self-employed person who has reasonable grounds to believe that he or she is adequately trained and who will perform duties to which the training relates must issue to himself or herself a training certificate that includes the information required by subsection (1).

title.en: 6.3 (3) - The training certificate must be signed
title.fr: 6.3 (3) - FR_The training certificate must be signed

title.en: 6.3 (3) (a) - by the employee and by the employer or another employee acting on behalf of the employer; or
title.fr: 6.3 (3) (a) - FR_by the employee and by the employer or another employee acting on behalf of the employer; or

title.en: 6.3 (3) (b) - in the case of a self-employed person, by that person.
title.fr: 6.3 (3) (b) - FR_in the case of a self-employed person, by that person.

title.en: 6.3 (4) - Despite subsection (1), if the employer of a person who is a member of a vessel’s complement has reasonable grounds to believe that the person’s certificate of competency issued in accordance with the Marine Certification Regulations is acceptable evidence that the person is adequately trained, the employer is not required to issue the training certificate. The certificate of competency is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when the certificate of competency is valid in Canada.
title.fr: 6.3 (4) - FR_Despite subsection (1), if the employer of a person who is a member of a vessel’s complement has reasonable grounds to believe that the person’s certificate of competency issued in accordance with the Marine Certification Regulations is acceptable evidence that the person is adequately trained, the employer is not required to issue the training certificate. The certificate of competency is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when the certificate of competency is valid in Canada.

title.en: - Foreign Carriers
title.fr: - FR_Foreign Carriers

title.en: 6.4 (1) - A document that is issued to a driver of a road vehicle licensed in the United States or to a member of the crew of a train subject to 49 CFR for the transportation of dangerous goods and that indicates that the driver or the crew member is trained in accordance with sections 172.700 to 172.704 of 49 CFR is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the United States.
title.fr: 6.4 (1) - FR_A document that is issued to a driver of a road vehicle licensed in the United States or to a member of the crew of a train subject to 49 CFR for the transportation of dangerous goods and that indicates that the driver or the crew member is trained in accordance with sections 172.700 to 172.704 of 49 CFR is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the United States.

title.en: 6.4 (2) - A document that is issued to a foreign member of the flight crew of an aircraft registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Civil Aviation Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by air is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations, in accordance with Article 33 of the Convention on International Civil Aviation, when that document is valid in the Member State.
title.fr: 6.4 (2) - FR_A document that is issued to a foreign member of the flight crew of an aircraft registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Civil Aviation Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by air is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations, in accordance with Article 33 of the Convention on International Civil Aviation, when that document is valid in the Member State.

title.en: 6.4 (3) - A document that is issued to a foreign member of the crew of a vessel registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Maritime Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by vessel is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the Member State.
title.fr: 6.4 (3) - FR_A document that is issued to a foreign member of the crew of a vessel registered in a country that is a Member State of the International Maritime Organization and that indicates that the crew member is trained to transport dangerous goods by vessel is a valid training certificate for the purposes of these Regulations when that document is valid in the Member State.

title.en: - Expiry of a Training Certificate
title.fr: - FR_Expiry of a Training Certificate

title.en: 6.5 - A training certificate expires
title.fr: 6.5 - FR_A training certificate expires

title.en: 6.5 (a) - for transport by aircraft, 24 months after its date of issuance; and
title.fr: 6.5 (a) - FR_for transport by aircraft, 24 months after its date of issuance; and

title.en: 6.5 (b) - for transport by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel, 36 months after its date of issuance.
title.fr: 6.5 (b) - FR_for transport by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel, 36 months after its date of issuance.

title.en: - Keeping Proof of Training: Employer’s and Self-Employed Person’s Responsibility
title.fr: - FR_Keeping Proof of Training: Employer’s and Self-Employed Person’s Responsibility

title.en: 6.6 - An employer or a self-employed person must keep a record of training or a statement of experience, as well as a copy of a training certificate, in electronic or paper form, beginning on the date the training certificate is issued and continuing until two years after the date it expires.
title.fr: 6.6 - FR_An employer or a self-employed person must keep a record of training or a statement of experience, as well as a copy of a training certificate, in electronic or paper form, beginning on the date the training certificate is issued and continuing until two years after the date it expires.

title.en: - Showing Proof of Training: Employer’s and Self-Employed Person’s Responsibility
title.fr: - FR_Showing Proof of Training: Employer’s and Self-Employed Person’s Responsibility

title.en: 6.7 - Within 15 days after the date of a written request by an inspector, the employer of a person who holds a training certificate or a self-employed person must provide a copy of the training certificate to the inspector and, if applicable, a copy of the record of training or the statement of experience and a description of the training material used in the person’s training.
title.fr: 6.7 - FR_Within 15 days after the date of a written request by an inspector, the employer of a person who holds a training certificate or a self-employed person must provide a copy of the training certificate to the inspector and, if applicable, a copy of the record of training or the statement of experience and a description of the training material used in the person’s training.

title.en: - Showing Proof of Training: Trained Person’s Responsibility
title.fr: - FR_Showing Proof of Training: Trained Person’s Responsibility

title.en: 6.8 - A person who handles, offers for transport or transports dangerous goods, or who directly supervises another person engaged in these activities, must give his or her training certificate, or a copy of it, to an inspector immediately on request.
title.fr: 6.8 - FR_A person who handles, offers for transport or transports dangerous goods, or who directly supervises another person engaged in these activities, must give his or her training certificate, or a copy of it, to an inspector immediately on request.

title.en: - Requirement to Have an Approved ERAP
title.fr: - FR_Requirement to Have an Approved ERAP

title.en: 7.2 (1) - For the purposes of subsection 7(1) of the Act, an approved ERAP is required for
title.fr: 7.2 (1) - FR_For the purposes of subsection 7(1) of the Act, an approved ERAP is required for

title.en: 7.2 (1) (a) - dangerous goods that have the same UN number and that are contained in a single means of containment, if the quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1;
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (a) - FR_dangerous goods that have the same UN number and that are contained in a single means of containment, if the quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1;

title.en: 7.2 (1) (b) - dangerous goods, in a road vehicle or a railway vehicle, that have the same UN number and that are contained in more than one means of containment, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1 and are included in one of the following classes:
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (b) - FR_dangerous goods, in a road vehicle or a railway vehicle, that have the same UN number and that are contained in more than one means of containment, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1 and are included in one of the following classes:

title.en: 7.2 (1) (b) (i) - Class 3, Flammable Liquids, with a subsidiary class of Class 6.1, Toxic Substances,
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (b) (i) - FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids, with a subsidiary class of Class 6.1, Toxic Substances,

title.en: 7.2 (1) (b) (ii) - Class 4, Flammable Solids; Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion; Substances That on Contact with Water Emit Flammable Gases (Water-reactive substances),
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_Class 4, Flammable Solids; Substances Liable to Spontaneous Combustion; Substances That on Contact with Water Emit Flammable Gases (Water-reactive substances),

title.en: 7.2 (1) (b) (iii) - Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, that are Type B or Type C,
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_Class 5.2, Organic Peroxides, that are Type B or Type C,

title.en: 7.2 (1) (b) (iv) - Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, that are included in Packing Group I;
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (b) (iv) - FR_Class 6.1, Toxic Substances, that are included in Packing Group I;

title.en: 7.2 (1) (c) - dangerous goods, in a road vehicle or a railway vehicle, that have the same UN number, and that are contained in more than one large means of containment, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1;
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (c) - FR_dangerous goods, in a road vehicle or a railway vehicle, that have the same UN number, and that are contained in more than one large means of containment, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1;

title.en: 7.2 (1) (d) - dangerous goods, in a road vehicle or a railway vehicle, that are included in Class 1, Explosives, and that are contained in one or more means of containment, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1 for the explosives with the lowest index number in that column;
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (d) - FR_dangerous goods, in a road vehicle or a railway vehicle, that are included in Class 1, Explosives, and that are contained in one or more means of containment, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1 for the explosives with the lowest index number in that column;

title.en: 7.2 (1) (e) - dangerous goods that are included in Class 2, Gases, that have the same UN number, that are contained in more than one means of containment — each of which has a capacity greater than 225 L — that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement and that are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1;
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (e) - FR_dangerous goods that are included in Class 2, Gases, that have the same UN number, that are contained in more than one means of containment — each of which has a capacity greater than 225 L — that are a single unit as a result of being interconnected through a piping arrangement and that are permanently mounted on a structural frame for transport, if the total quantity of those dangerous goods exceeds the ERAP index in column 7 of Schedule 1;

title.en: 7.2 (1) (f) - any of the following dangerous goods that are transported by rail in a tank car, if the quantity of those dangerous goods in the tank car exceeds 10 000 L:
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) - FR_any of the following dangerous goods that are transported by rail in a tank car, if the quantity of those dangerous goods in the tank car exceeds 10 000 L:

title.en: 7.2 (1) (f) (i) - UN1170, ETHANOL with more than 24% ethanol, by volume, ETHANOL SOLUTION with more than 24% ethanol, by volume, ETHYL ALCOHOL with more than 24% ethanol, by volume, or ETHYL ALCOHOL SOLUTION with more than 24% ethanol, by volume,
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (i) - FR_UN1170, ETHANOL with more than 24% ethanol, by volume, ETHANOL SOLUTION with more than 24% ethanol, by volume, ETHYL ALCOHOL with more than 24% ethanol, by volume, or ETHYL ALCOHOL SOLUTION with more than 24% ethanol, by volume,

title.en: 7.2 (1) (f) (ii) - UN1202, DIESEL FUEL, GAS OIL, or HEATING OIL, LIGHT,
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (ii) - FR_UN1202, DIESEL FUEL, GAS OIL, or HEATING OIL, LIGHT,

title.en: 7.2 (1) (f) (iv) - UN1267, PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL,
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (iv) - FR_UN1267, PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL,

title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (v) - FR_UN1268, PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S., or PETROLEUM PRODUCTS, N.O.S.,

title.en: 7.2 (1) (f) (vi) - UN1863, FUEL, AVIATION, TURBINE ENGINE,

title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (vii) - FR_UN1987, ALCOHOLS, N.O.S.,

title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (viii) - FR_UN1993, FLAMMABLE LIQUID, N.O.S.,

title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (ix) - FR_UN3295, HYDROCARBONS, LIQUID, N.O.S.,

title.fr: 7.2 (1) (f) (x) - FR_UN3475, ETHANOL AND GASOLINE MIXTURE, with more than 10% ethanol, ETHANOL AND MOTOR SPIRIT MIXTURE, with more than 10% ethanol, or ETHANOL AND PETROL MIXTURE, with more than 10% ethanol, and

title.en: 7.2 (1) (g) - any quantity of dangerous goods that are Risk Group 4 human pathogens within the meaning of the Human Pathogens and Toxins Act.
title.fr: 7.2 (1) (g) - FR_any quantity of dangerous goods that are Risk Group 4 human pathogens within the meaning of the Human Pathogens and Toxins Act.

title.en: 7.2 (2) - Any substance that would require an ERAP if its classification were determined in accordance with Part 2 (Classification) requires an approved ERAP if its appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations is to be used under subsection 2.2(4).
title.fr: 7.2 (2) - FR_Any substance that would require an ERAP if its classification were determined in accordance with Part 2 (Classification) requires an approved ERAP if its appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations is to be used under subsection 2.2(4).

title.en: - Application for Approval of an ERAP
title.fr: - FR_Application for Approval of an ERAP

title.en: 7.3 (1) - A person must apply to the Minister in writing for the approval of an ERAP.
title.fr: 7.3 (1) - FR_A person must apply to the Minister in writing for the approval of an ERAP.

title.en: 7.3 (2) - The application for approval must be signed by the applicant and must include a copy of the ERAP and the following information:
title.fr: 7.3 (2) - FR_The application for approval must be signed by the applicant and must include a copy of the ERAP and the following information:

title.en: 7.3 (2) (a) - the name and contact information of the applicant;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (a) - FR_the name and contact information of the applicant;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (b) - a description of the applicant’s operations;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (b) - FR_a description of the applicant’s operations;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (c) - the name and contact information of any third party who assisted in the preparation of the application;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (c) - FR_the name and contact information of any third party who assisted in the preparation of the application;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (d) - the classification of the dangerous goods to which the ERAP relates and the mode of transport used;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (d) - FR_the classification of the dangerous goods to which the ERAP relates and the mode of transport used;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (e) - for each mode of transport used,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (e) - FR_for each mode of transport used,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (e) (i) - the frequency of the transportation of the dangerous goods,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (e) (i) - FR_the frequency of the transportation of the dangerous goods,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (e) (ii) - the type and specification of the means of containment used to transport the dangerous goods, and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (e) (ii) - FR_the type and specification of the means of containment used to transport the dangerous goods, and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (e) (iii) - the geographical area in which the dangerous goods are transported;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (e) (iii) - FR_the geographical area in which the dangerous goods are transported;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (f) - the ERAP telephone number, including the area code, at which a person identified in the ERAP can be reached at any time while the dangerous goods are handled or transported;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (f) - FR_the ERAP telephone number, including the area code, at which a person identified in the ERAP can be reached at any time while the dangerous goods are handled or transported;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (g) - a description of the communications systems that will be available at the location of a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (g) - FR_a description of the communications systems that will be available at the location of a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (h) - the name and contact information of any third-party emergency responders, their role and a copy of the agreement between the applicant and the third party;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (h) - FR_the name and contact information of any third-party emergency responders, their role and a copy of the agreement between the applicant and the third party;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (i) - the following information regarding the ERAP response equipment:
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (i) - FR_the following information regarding the ERAP response equipment:

title.en: 7.3 (2) (i) (i) - a detailed list of the equipment,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (i) (i) - FR_a detailed list of the equipment,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (i) (ii) - the location of the equipment,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (i) (ii) - FR_the location of the equipment,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (i) (iii) - the name of the person responsible for the operation of the equipment at each location,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (i) (iii) - FR_the name of the person responsible for the operation of the equipment at each location,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (i) (iv) - for each location, the dangerous goods in respect of which the equipment is to be used during emergency measures, and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (i) (iv) - FR_for each location, the dangerous goods in respect of which the equipment is to be used during emergency measures, and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (i) (v) - the geographical areas where the equipment at each location is to be used;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (i) (v) - FR_the geographical areas where the equipment at each location is to be used;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (j) - the following information respecting the ERAP response personnel, including technical advisors, team leaders and response teams:
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (j) - FR_the following information respecting the ERAP response personnel, including technical advisors, team leaders and response teams:

title.en: 7.3 (2) (j) (i) - their names and contact information,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (j) (i) - FR_their names and contact information,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (j) (ii) - their responsibilities,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (j) (ii) - FR_their responsibilities,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (j) (iii) - any training they have taken, and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (j) (iii) - FR_any training they have taken, and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (j) (iv) - description of their knowledge and experience in respect of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (j) (iv) - FR_description of their knowledge and experience in respect of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (k) - the response capability in respect of the dangerous goods, including
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (k) - FR_the response capability in respect of the dangerous goods, including

title.en: 7.3 (2) (k) (i) - the measures that can be taken in response to the release or anticipated release,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (k) (i) - FR_the measures that can be taken in response to the release or anticipated release,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (k) (ii) - the persons responsible for taking the measures referred to in subparagraph (i), and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (k) (ii) - FR_the persons responsible for taking the measures referred to in subparagraph (i), and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (k) (iii) - the ERAP equipment that will be used to take those measures;
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (k) (iii) - FR_the ERAP equipment that will be used to take those measures;

title.en: 7.3 (2) (l) - an estimate of the time required for the response personnel and equipment to reach the location of the release or anticipated release and a description of the mobilization and deployment steps in respect of the response personnel and equipment; and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (l) - FR_an estimate of the time required for the response personnel and equipment to reach the location of the release or anticipated release and a description of the mobilization and deployment steps in respect of the response personnel and equipment; and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) - a potential incident analysis, including
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) - FR_a potential incident analysis, including

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) - the following scenarios:
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) - FR_the following scenarios:

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (A) - an anticipated release of dangerous goods,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (A) - FR_an anticipated release of dangerous goods,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (B) - the release of less than 1% of the dangerous goods in a means of containment,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (B) - FR_the release of less than 1% of the dangerous goods in a means of containment,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (C) - the release of more than 50% of the dangerous goods in a means of containment, and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (C) - FR_the release of more than 50% of the dangerous goods in a means of containment, and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (D) - the exposure to fire of a means of containment that contains dangerous goods,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (i) (D) - FR_the exposure to fire of a means of containment that contains dangerous goods,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (ii) - the possible consequences of the release or anticipated release for each scenario,
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (ii) - FR_the possible consequences of the release or anticipated release for each scenario,

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (iii) - the measures, organized by tier in accordance with section 7.8, to be taken in response to the release or anticipated release for each scenario, and
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (iii) - FR_the measures, organized by tier in accordance with section 7.8, to be taken in response to the release or anticipated release for each scenario, and

title.en: 7.3 (2) (m) (iv) - the identification of the persons responsible for taking the measures referred to in subparagraph (iii).
title.fr: 7.3 (2) (m) (iv) - FR_the identification of the persons responsible for taking the measures referred to in subparagraph (iii).

title.en: - Application for Approval of an ERAP – Emergency Response Contractors
title.fr: - FR_Application for Approval of an ERAP – Emergency Response Contractors

title.en: 7.4 - A person who is not required to have an approved ERAP under subsection 7(1) of the Act, but who is able to take measures to respond to a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods for the purposes of paragraph 7.1(b) of the Act, may apply to the Minister in writing for the approval of an ERAP. The application must include a copy of the ERAP and the information referred to in paragraphs 7.3(2)(a), (b), (d), (g) and (i) to (l).
title.fr: 7.4 - FR_A person who is not required to have an approved ERAP under subsection 7(1) of the Act, but who is able to take measures to respond to a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods for the purposes of paragraph 7.1(b) of the Act, may apply to the Minister in writing for the approval of an ERAP. The application must include a copy of the ERAP and the information referred to in paragraphs 7.3(2)(a), (b), (d), (g) and (i) to (l).

title.en: - Application for Approval of Changes to Approved ERAP
title.fr: - FR_Application for Approval of Changes to Approved ERAP

title.en: 7.5 (1) - A person with an approved ERAP must, as soon as possible, apply to the Minister in writing for an approval of changes if any of the information referred to in paragraphs 7.3(2)(a) to (l) has changed since its approval.
title.fr: 7.5 (1) - FR_A person with an approved ERAP must, as soon as possible, apply to the Minister in writing for an approval of changes if any of the information referred to in paragraphs 7.3(2)(a) to (l) has changed since its approval.

title.en: 7.5 (2) - The application referred to in subsection (1) must be signed by the applicant and include
title.fr: 7.5 (2) - FR_The application referred to in subsection (1) must be signed by the applicant and include

title.en: 7.5 (2) (a) - a copy of the ERAP; and
title.fr: 7.5 (2) (a) - FR_a copy of the ERAP; and

title.en: 7.5 (2) (b) - the information referred to in paragraphs 7.3(2)(a) to (l) that has changed.
title.fr: 7.5 (2) (b) - FR_the information referred to in paragraphs 7.3(2)(a) to (l) that has changed.

title.en: - Request for Review of Decision
title.fr: - FR_Request for Review of Decision

title.en: 7.6 (1) - A person may request a review of the decision to refuse an application for approval of an ERAP or to revoke an ERAP approval within 30 days after being notified of the decision.
title.fr: 7.6 (1) - FR_A person may request a review of the decision to refuse an application for approval of an ERAP or to revoke an ERAP approval within 30 days after being notified of the decision.

title.en: 7.6 (2) - The request must be made to the Minister in writing and must include the reasons why the decision should be revised.
title.fr: 7.6 (2) - FR_The request must be made to the Minister in writing and must include the reasons why the decision should be revised.

title.en: - Authorization to Use an Approved ERAP
title.fr: - FR_Authorization to Use an Approved ERAP

title.en: 7.7 (1) - A person who is required to have an ERAP under subsection 7(1) of the Act may use, as an authorized user, the ERAP of another person who received approval for the ERAP if
title.fr: 7.7 (1) - FR_A person who is required to have an ERAP under subsection 7(1) of the Act may use, as an authorized user, the ERAP of another person who received approval for the ERAP if

title.en: 7.7 (1) (a) - the authorized user is not the producer of the dangerous goods to which the ERAP relates;
title.fr: 7.7 (1) (a) - FR_the authorized user is not the producer of the dangerous goods to which the ERAP relates;

title.en: 7.7 (1) (b) - the ERAP applies to the dangerous goods, the mode of transport, the means of containment and the geographical area in which the dangerous goods will be in transport;
title.fr: 7.7 (1) (b) - FR_the ERAP applies to the dangerous goods, the mode of transport, the means of containment and the geographical area in which the dangerous goods will be in transport;

title.en: 7.7 (1) (c) - the person who received approval for the ERAP agrees to take measures to respond to a release or anticipated release of the dangerous goods to which the ERAP relates; and
title.fr: 7.7 (1) (c) - FR_the person who received approval for the ERAP agrees to take measures to respond to a release or anticipated release of the dangerous goods to which the ERAP relates; and

title.en: 7.7 (1) (d) - the person who received approval for the ERAP provides a written authorization to the authorized user before the information referred to in subsection 3.6(1) is entered on the shipping document.
title.fr: 7.7 (1) (d) - FR_the person who received approval for the ERAP provides a written authorization to the authorized user before the information referred to in subsection 3.6(1) is entered on the shipping document.

title.en: 7.7 (2) - The authorized user must be able to produce a copy of the authorization referred to in paragraph (1)(d)
title.fr: 7.7 (2) - FR_The authorized user must be able to produce a copy of the authorization referred to in paragraph (1)(d)

title.en: 7.7 (2) (a) - for two years after the day on which the authorization is no longer in effect; and
title.fr: 7.7 (2) (a) - FR_for two years after the day on which the authorization is no longer in effect; and

title.en: 7.7 (2) (b) - within 15 days after the day on which the authorized user receives a written request from the Minister.
title.fr: 7.7 (2) (b) - FR_within 15 days after the day on which the authorized user receives a written request from the Minister.

title.en: - Implementation of an Approved ERAP
title.fr: - FR_Implementation of an Approved ERAP

title.en: 7.8 (1) - A person with an approved ERAP must implement it to tier 1 or tier 2 in response to a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods.
title.fr: 7.8 (1) - FR_A person with an approved ERAP must implement it to tier 1 or tier 2 in response to a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods.

title.en: 7.8 (2) - A person who implements an approved ERAP to tier 1 must
title.fr: 7.8 (2) - FR_A person who implements an approved ERAP to tier 1 must

title.en: 7.8 (2) (a) - provide technical or emergency response advice as soon as possible after a request for the advice; and
title.fr: 7.8 (2) (a) - FR_provide technical or emergency response advice as soon as possible after a request for the advice; and

title.en: 7.8 (2) (b) - remotely monitor the response to the release or anticipated release.
title.fr: 7.8 (2) (b) - FR_remotely monitor the response to the release or anticipated release.

title.en: 7.8 (3) - A person who implements an approved ERAP to tier 2 must
title.fr: 7.8 (3) - FR_A person who implements an approved ERAP to tier 2 must

title.en: 7.8 (3) (a) - provide technical or emergency response advice as soon as possible after a request for the advice;
title.fr: 7.8 (3) (a) - FR_provide technical or emergency response advice as soon as possible after a request for the advice;

title.en: 7.8 (3) (b) - monitor the response to the release or anticipated release; and
title.fr: 7.8 (3) (b) - FR_monitor the response to the release or anticipated release; and

title.en: 7.8 (3) (c) - send ERAP emergency response resources to the location of the release or anticipated release.
title.fr: 7.8 (3) (c) - FR_send ERAP emergency response resources to the location of the release or anticipated release.

title.en: 7.8 (4) - A person must not prevent another person who has an approved ERAP from taking emergency measures in response to a release or anticipated release.
title.fr: 7.8 (4) - FR_A person must not prevent another person who has an approved ERAP from taking emergency measures in response to a release or anticipated release.

title.en: - Compensation for the Authorized Implementation of an Approved ERAP
title.fr: - FR_Compensation for the Authorized Implementation of an Approved ERAP

title.en: 7.9 (1) - If a person implements an approved ERAP in accordance with paragraph 7.1(b) of the Act, the following expenses are authorized for the purposes of compensation under section 7.2 of the Act:
title.fr: 7.9 (1) - FR_If a person implements an approved ERAP in accordance with paragraph 7.1(b) of the Act, the following expenses are authorized for the purposes of compensation under section 7.2 of the Act:

title.en: 7.9 (1) (a) - expenses related to the death, disability or injury of the person or to the death, disability or injury of any of the person’s employees or contractors if
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (a) - FR_expenses related to the death, disability or injury of the person or to the death, disability or injury of any of the person’s employees or contractors if

title.en: 7.9 (1) (a) (i) - the person, the employee or the contractor is killed, disabled or injured during the implementation of the ERAP, and
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (a) (i) - FR_the person, the employee or the contractor is killed, disabled or injured during the implementation of the ERAP, and

title.en: 7.9 (1) (a) (ii) - the death, disability or injury is the result of an act or omission that was committed by the person in good faith and without negligence;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_the death, disability or injury is the result of an act or omission that was committed by the person in good faith and without negligence;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (b) - the cost of the person’s employees or contractors who are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (b) - FR_the cost of the person’s employees or contractors who are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (c) - the cost of using the person’s tools and other equipment, such as vehicles, pumps, hoses and generators, that are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (c) - FR_the cost of using the person’s tools and other equipment, such as vehicles, pumps, hoses and generators, that are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (d) - travel expenses, such as those incurred for meals, accommodation, fuel, oil and flights, for persons who are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (d) - FR_travel expenses, such as those incurred for meals, accommodation, fuel, oil and flights, for persons who are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (e) - rental fees for heavy equipment, such as cranes, bulldozers, pumps, compressors and generators, that are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (e) - FR_rental fees for heavy equipment, such as cranes, bulldozers, pumps, compressors and generators, that are reasonably required to implement the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (f) - other overhead costs that can reasonably be attributed to the implementation of the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (f) - FR_other overhead costs that can reasonably be attributed to the implementation of the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (g) - the cost of repairing tools and other equipment that are damaged during the implementation of the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (g) - FR_the cost of repairing tools and other equipment that are damaged during the implementation of the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (h) - the cost of replacing
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (h) - FR_the cost of replacing

title.en: 7.9 (1) (h) (i) - single-use equipment and supplies, such as packaging, personal protective equipment, personal protective clothing, chemicals and other consumables, that are reasonably required to implement the ERAP,
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (h) (i) - FR_single-use equipment and supplies, such as packaging, personal protective equipment, personal protective clothing, chemicals and other consumables, that are reasonably required to implement the ERAP,

title.en: 7.9 (1) (h) (ii) - tools and other equipment that are lost during the implementation of the ERAP, and
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (h) (ii) - FR_tools and other equipment that are lost during the implementation of the ERAP, and

title.en: 7.9 (1) (h) (iii) - tools and other equipment that are damaged beyond repair during the implementation of the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (h) (iii) - FR_tools and other equipment that are damaged beyond repair during the implementation of the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (i) - the cost of repairing or replacing personal property or movables or real property or immovables that have to be damaged to implement the ERAP;
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (i) - FR_the cost of repairing or replacing personal property or movables or real property or immovables that have to be damaged to implement the ERAP;

title.en: 7.9 (1) (j) - the cost of defending any legal action for which there is no personal liability under paragraph 20(c) of the Act; and
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (j) - FR_the cost of defending any legal action for which there is no personal liability under paragraph 20(c) of the Act; and

title.en: 7.9 (1) (k) - the cost of cleaning up after an incident, including handling and disposal costs for dangerous goods and contaminated materials.
title.fr: 7.9 (1) (k) - FR_the cost of cleaning up after an incident, including handling and disposal costs for dangerous goods and contaminated materials.

title.en: 7.9 (2) - The following expenses are not authorized for the purposes of compensation under section 7.2 of the Act:
title.fr: 7.9 (2) - FR_The following expenses are not authorized for the purposes of compensation under section 7.2 of the Act:

title.en: 7.9 (2) (a) - the cost of purchasing new equipment to implement the approved ERAP; and
title.fr: 7.9 (2) (a) - FR_the cost of purchasing new equipment to implement the approved ERAP; and

title.en: 7.9 (2) (b) - the cost of lost business or production during the implementation of the approved ERAP.
title.fr: 7.9 (2) (b) - FR_the cost of lost business or production during the implementation of the approved ERAP.

title.en: - Compensation Limits
title.fr: - FR_Compensation Limits

title.en: 7.10 (1) - Compensation under paragraph 7.9(1)(a) is limited to the compensation that would be paid in relation to the dead, disabled or injured person if the person were insured under
title.fr: 7.10 (1) - FR_Compensation under paragraph 7.9(1)(a) is limited to the compensation that would be paid in relation to the dead, disabled or injured person if the person were insured under

title.en: 7.10 (1) (a) - the Public Service Management Insurance Plan;
title.fr: 7.10 (1) (a) - FR_the Public Service Management Insurance Plan;

title.en: 7.10 (1) (b) - the Public Service Health Care Plan, with hospital coverage at level III; and
title.fr: 7.10 (1) (b) - FR_the Public Service Health Care Plan, with hospital coverage at level III; and

title.en: 7.10 (1) (c) - the Public Service Dental Care Plan.
title.fr: 7.10 (1) (c) - FR_the Public Service Dental Care Plan.

title.en: 7.10 (2) - Compensation under paragraph 7.9(1)(h) in relation to the replacement of the items listed in subparagraphs 7.9(1)(h)(i), (ii) and (iii) is limited to the cost of an item of equivalent capability and quality.
title.fr: 7.10 (2) - FR_Compensation under paragraph 7.9(1)(h) in relation to the replacement of the items listed in subparagraphs 7.9(1)(h)(i), (ii) and (iii) is limited to the cost of an item of equivalent capability and quality.

title.en: 7.10 (3) - Compensation under paragraph 7.9(1)(i) in relation to damaged property is limited to the fair market value of the property immediately before it is damaged by the person who implements the approved ERAP.
title.fr: 7.10 (3) - FR_Compensation under paragraph 7.9(1)(i) in relation to damaged property is limited to the fair market value of the property immediately before it is damaged by the person who implements the approved ERAP.

title.en: - Claims for Compensation
title.fr: - FR_Claims for Compensation

title.en: 7.11 - Claims for compensation must be submitted with supporting documentation to the Minister no later than three months after completion of the emergency response work.
title.fr: 7.11 - FR_Claims for compensation must be submitted with supporting documentation to the Minister no later than three months after completion of the emergency response work.

title.en: PART 8 - Reporting Requirements
title.fr: PART 8 - FR_Reporting Requirements

title.en: - Application and Interpretation
title.fr: - FR_Application and Interpretation

title.en: 8.1 - This Part applies in respect of
title.fr: 8.1 - FR_This Part applies in respect of

title.en: 8.1 (a) - the release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel;
title.fr: 8.1 (a) - FR_the release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel;

title.en: 8.1 (b) - the release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by aircraft;
title.fr: 8.1 (b) - FR_the release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by aircraft;

title.en: 8.1 (c) - undeclared and misdeclared dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by aircraft;
title.fr: 8.1 (c) - FR_undeclared and misdeclared dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by aircraft;

title.en: 8.1 (d) - the loss or theft of dangerous goods; and
title.fr: 8.1 (d) - FR_the loss or theft of dangerous goods; and

title.en: 8.1 (e) - unlawful interference with dangerous goods.
title.fr: 8.1 (e) - FR_unlawful interference with dangerous goods.

title.en: - Road, Rail and Marine Reports
title.fr: - FR_Road, Rail and Marine Reports

title.en: - Emergency Report — Road, Rail or Marine
title.fr: - FR_Emergency Report — Road, Rail or Marine

title.en: 8.2 - A person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel must, as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make an emergency report to any local authority that is responsible for responding to emergencies at the geographic location of the release or anticipated release if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:
title.fr: 8.2 - FR_A person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported by road vehicle, railway vehicle or vessel must, as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make an emergency report to any local authority that is responsible for responding to emergencies at the geographic location of the release or anticipated release if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:

title.en: - Information To Be Included in an Emergency Report — Road, Rail or Marine
title.fr: - FR_Information To Be Included in an Emergency Report — Road, Rail or Marine

title.en: 8.3 - An emergency report referred to in section 8.2 must include the following information:
title.fr: 8.3 - FR_An emergency report referred to in section 8.2 must include the following information:

title.en: 8.3 (a) - the name and contact information of the person making the report;
title.fr: 8.3 (a) - FR_the name and contact information of the person making the report;

title.en: 8.3 (b) - in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;
title.fr: 8.3 (b) - FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;

title.en: 8.3 (c) - in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.3 (c) - FR_in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;

title.en: 8.3 (d) - the mode of transport used;
title.fr: 8.3 (d) - FR_the mode of transport used;

title.en: 8.3 (e) - the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.3 (e) - FR_the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.3 (f) - the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.3 (f) - FR_the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;

title.en: 8.3 (g) - in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released; and
title.fr: 8.3 (g) - FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released; and

title.en: 8.3 (h) - if applicable, the type of incident leading to the release or anticipated release, including a collision, roll-over, derailment, overfill, fire, explosion or load-shift.
title.fr: 8.3 (h) - FR_if applicable, the type of incident leading to the release or anticipated release, including a collision, roll-over, derailment, overfill, fire, explosion or load-shift.

title.en: - Release or Anticipated Release Report — Road, Rail or Marine
title.fr: - FR_Release or Anticipated Release Report — Road, Rail or Marine

title.en: 8.4 (1) - Subject to subsection (2), a person who has made an emergency report referred to in section 8.2 must, as soon as possible after making it, make a report to the persons listed in subsection (4).
title.fr: 8.4 (1) - FR_Subject to subsection (2), a person who has made an emergency report referred to in section 8.2 must, as soon as possible after making it, make a report to the persons listed in subsection (4).

title.en: 8.4 (2) - Subject to subsection (3), the person is not required to make a report referred to in subsection (1) if the release or anticipated release did not result in
title.fr: 8.4 (2) - FR_Subject to subsection (3), the person is not required to make a report referred to in subsection (1) if the release or anticipated release did not result in

title.en: 8.4 (2) (a) - the death of a person;
title.fr: 8.4 (2) (a) - FR_the death of a person;

title.en: 8.4 (2) (b) - a person sustaining injuries that required immediate medical treatment by a health care provider;
title.fr: 8.4 (2) (b) - FR_a person sustaining injuries that required immediate medical treatment by a health care provider;

title.en: 8.4 (2) (c) - an evacuation of people or their shelter in place; or
title.fr: 8.4 (2) (c) - FR_an evacuation of people or their shelter in place; or

title.en: 8.4 (2) (d) - the closure of
title.fr: 8.4 (2) (d) - FR_the closure of

title.en: 8.4 (2) (d) (i) - a facility used in the loading and unloading of dangerous goods, or
title.fr: 8.4 (2) (d) (i) - FR_a facility used in the loading and unloading of dangerous goods, or

title.en: 8.4 (2) (d) (ii) - a road, a main railway line or a main waterway.
title.fr: 8.4 (2) (d) (ii) - FR_a road, a main railway line or a main waterway.

title.en: 8.4 (3) - The person is required to make a report referred to in subsection (1) if
title.fr: 8.4 (3) - FR_The person is required to make a report referred to in subsection (1) if

title.en: 8.4 (3) (a) - a means of containment has been damaged to the extent that its integrity is compromised; or
title.fr: 8.4 (3) (a) - FR_a means of containment has been damaged to the extent that its integrity is compromised; or

title.en: 8.4 (3) (b) - the centre sill or stub sill of a tank car is broken or there is a crack in the metal equal to or greater than 15 cm (6 in.).
title.fr: 8.4 (3) (b) - FR_the centre sill or stub sill of a tank car is broken or there is a crack in the metal equal to or greater than 15 cm (6 in.).

title.en: 8.4 (4) - For the purposes of subsection (1), the persons to whom a report must be made are
title.fr: 8.4 (4) - FR_For the purposes of subsection (1), the persons to whom a report must be made are

title.en: 8.4 (4) (b) - the consignor of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.4 (4) (b) - FR_the consignor of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.4 (4) (c) - in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission; and
title.fr: 8.4 (4) (c) - FR_in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission; and

title.en: 8.4 (4) (d) - in the case of a vessel, a Vessel Traffic Services Centre or a Canadian Coast Guard radio station.
title.fr: 8.4 (4) (d) - FR_in the case of a vessel, a Vessel Traffic Services Centre or a Canadian Coast Guard radio station.

title.en: 8.8 (1) - A person who has made a follow-up report referred to in section 8.6 must, as soon as possible, notify the Minister of any change to the information referred to in paragraph 8.7(f), (i), (j), (k), (l), (p) or (s) that occurs within one year after the day on which the follow-up report was made.

title.en: 8.8 (2) - The person must keep a copy of the report for two years after the day on which it is made.
title.fr: 8.8 (2) - FR_The person must keep a copy of the report for two years after the day on which it is made.

title.en: 8.8 (3) - The person must make the report available to an inspector within 15 days after the day on which the person receives a written request from the inspector.
