title.en: - Dangerous Goods Accident or Incident Report — Air
title.fr: - FR_Dangerous Goods Accident or Incident Report — Air

title.en: 8.9 (1) - Subject to subsection (3), a person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported at an aerodrome, at an air cargo facility or by aircraft must as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make a report if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:
title.fr: 8.9 (1) - FR_Subject to subsection (3), a person who is required by subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods that are being offered for transport, handled or transported at an aerodrome, at an air cargo facility or by aircraft must as soon as possible after a release or anticipated release, make a report if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:

title.en: 8.9 (2) - The report referred to in subsection (1) must be made to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888-226-8832) or 613-996-6666, and, in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, to the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.
title.fr: 8.9 (2) - FR_The report referred to in subsection (1) must be made to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888-226-8832) or 613-996-6666, and, in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, to the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.

title.en: 8.9 (3) - The person is not required to make the report referred to in subsection (1) if the release or anticipated release does not result in any of the following:
title.fr: 8.9 (3) - FR_The person is not required to make the report referred to in subsection (1) if the release or anticipated release does not result in any of the following:

title.en: 8.9 (3) (a) - the death or injury of a person;
title.fr: 8.9 (3) (a) - FR_the death or injury of a person;

title.en: 8.9 (3) (b) - damage to property or to the environment;
title.fr: 8.9 (3) (b) - FR_damage to property or to the environment;

title.en: 8.9 (3) (c) - signs that the integrity of a means of containment has been compromised, including signs of fire, of breakage or of fluid or radiation leakage;
title.fr: 8.9 (3) (c) - FR_signs that the integrity of a means of containment has been compromised, including signs of fire, of breakage or of fluid or radiation leakage;

title.en: 8.9 (3) (d) - serious jeopardy to persons on an aircraft or to the aircraft itself;
title.fr: 8.9 (3) (d) - FR_serious jeopardy to persons on an aircraft or to the aircraft itself;

title.en: 8.9 (3) (e) - an evacuation of people or their shelter in place; or
title.fr: 8.9 (3) (e) - FR_an evacuation of people or their shelter in place; or

title.en: 8.9 (3) (f) - the closure of an aerodrome, air cargo facility or runway.
title.fr: 8.9 (3) (f) - FR_the closure of an aerodrome, air cargo facility or runway.

title.en: - Information To Be Included in a Dangerous Goods Accident or Incident Report — Air
title.fr: - FR_Information To Be Included in a Dangerous Goods Accident or Incident Report — Air

title.en: 8.10 - A report referred to in section 8.9 must include the following information:
title.fr: 8.10 - FR_A report referred to in section 8.9 must include the following information:

title.en: 8.10 (a) - the name and contact information of the person making the report;
title.fr: 8.10 (a) - FR_the name and contact information of the person making the report;

title.en: 8.10 (b) - in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;
title.fr: 8.10 (b) - FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;

title.en: 8.10 (c) - in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.10 (c) - FR_in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;

title.en: 8.10 (d) - the name of the aircraft operator, aerodrome or air cargo facility;
title.fr: 8.10 (d) - FR_the name of the aircraft operator, aerodrome or air cargo facility;

title.en: 8.10 (e) - the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.10 (e) - FR_the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.10 (f) - the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.10 (f) - FR_the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;

title.en: 8.10 (g) - in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released;
title.fr: 8.10 (g) - FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released;

title.en: 8.10 (h) - if applicable, the type of incident leading to the release or anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.10 (h) - FR_if applicable, the type of incident leading to the release or anticipated release;

title.en: 8.10 (i) - a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.10 (i) - FR_a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.10 (j) - if applicable, the number of deaths and the number of persons who sustained injuries; and
title.fr: 8.10 (j) - FR_if applicable, the number of deaths and the number of persons who sustained injuries; and

title.en: 8.10 (k) - if applicable, an estimate of the number of people evacuated or sheltered in place.
title.fr: 8.10 (k) - FR_if applicable, an estimate of the number of people evacuated or sheltered in place.

title.en: - 30-Day Follow-up Report
title.fr: - FR_30-Day Follow-up Report

title.en: 8.11 - A person who has made a report referred to in section 8.9, or the person’s employer, must make a follow-up report in writing to the Minister within 30 days after the day on which the report was made.
title.fr: 8.11 - FR_A person who has made a report referred to in section 8.9, or the person’s employer, must make a follow-up report in writing to the Minister within 30 days after the day on which the report was made.

title.en: - Information To Be Included in a 30-Day Follow-up Report
title.fr: - FR_Information To Be Included in a 30-Day Follow-up Report

title.en: 8.12 - A follow-up report referred to in section 8.11 must include the following information:
title.fr: 8.12 - FR_A follow-up report referred to in section 8.11 must include the following information:

title.en: 8.12 (a) - the name and contact information of the person making the report;
title.fr: 8.12 (a) - FR_the name and contact information of the person making the report;

title.en: 8.12 (b) - the names and contact information of the consignor, consignee and aircraft operator;
title.fr: 8.12 (b) - FR_the names and contact information of the consignor, consignee and aircraft operator;

title.en: 8.12 (c) - in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;
title.fr: 8.12 (c) - FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the release;

title.en: 8.12 (d) - in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.12 (d) - FR_in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;

title.en: 8.12 (e) - the classification of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.12 (e) - FR_the classification of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.12 (f) - the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;
title.fr: 8.12 (f) - FR_the quantity of dangerous goods that was in the means of containment before the release or anticipated release;

title.en: 8.12 (g) - in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released;
title.fr: 8.12 (g) - FR_in the case of a release of dangerous goods, the quantity of dangerous goods estimated to have been released;

title.en: 8.12 (h) - a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.12 (h) - FR_a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.12 (i) - if applicable, a description of any failure of or damage to the means of containment;
title.fr: 8.12 (i) - FR_if applicable, a description of any failure of or damage to the means of containment;

title.en: 8.12 (j) - information about the events leading to the release or anticipated release of dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.12 (j) - FR_information about the events leading to the release or anticipated release of dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.12 (k) - information as to whether there was an explosion or fire;
title.fr: 8.12 (k) - FR_information as to whether there was an explosion or fire;

title.en: 8.12 (l) - the name and geographic location of any aerodrome, air cargo facility or runway that was closed, and the duration of the closure;
title.fr: 8.12 (l) - FR_the name and geographic location of any aerodrome, air cargo facility or runway that was closed, and the duration of the closure;

title.en: 8.12 (m) - if applicable, an estimate of the number of people evacuated or sheltered in place, and the duration of the evacuation or shelter in place;
title.fr: 8.12 (m) - FR_if applicable, an estimate of the number of people evacuated or sheltered in place, and the duration of the evacuation or shelter in place;

title.en: 8.12 (n) - if applicable, the number of deaths and the number of persons who sustained injuries;
title.fr: 8.12 (n) - FR_if applicable, the number of deaths and the number of persons who sustained injuries;

title.en: 8.12 (o) - if applicable, the ERAP reference number;
title.fr: 8.12 (o) - FR_if applicable, the ERAP reference number;

title.en: 8.12 (p) - the date on which the report referred to in section 8.9 was made;
title.fr: 8.12 (p) - FR_the date on which the report referred to in section 8.9 was made;

title.en: 8.12 (q) - an estimate of any financial loss incurred as a result of the release or anticipated release, and any emergency response costs or remediation costs related to it;
title.fr: 8.12 (q) - FR_an estimate of any financial loss incurred as a result of the release or anticipated release, and any emergency response costs or remediation costs related to it;

title.en: 8.12 (r) - a description of the route by which the dangerous goods were to be transported, including the names of any aerodromes along the route;
title.fr: 8.12 (r) - FR_a description of the route by which the dangerous goods were to be transported, including the names of any aerodromes along the route;

title.en: 8.12 (s) - a description of any serious jeopardy to persons on any aircraft or to the aircraft itself; and
title.fr: 8.12 (s) - FR_a description of any serious jeopardy to persons on any aircraft or to the aircraft itself; and

title.en: 8.12 (t) - a description of any damage to property or to the environment.
title.fr: 8.12 (t) - FR_a description of any damage to property or to the environment.

title.en: - 30-Day Follow-up Report — Notice and Retention of Report
title.fr: - FR_30-Day Follow-up Report — Notice and Retention of Report

title.en: 8.13 (1) - A person who has made a follow-up report referred to in section 8.11 must, as soon as possible, notify the Minister of any change to the information referred to in paragraph 8.12(e), (h), (i), (k), (n) or (q) that occurs within one year after the day on which the follow-up report was made.
title.fr: 8.13 (1) - FR_A person who has made a follow-up report referred to in section 8.11 must, as soon as possible, notify the Minister of any change to the information referred to in paragraph 8.12(e), (h), (i), (k), (n) or (q) that occurs within one year after the day on which the follow-up report was made.

title.en: 8.13 (2) - The person must keep a copy of the report for two years after the day on which it is made.
title.fr: 8.13 (2) - FR_The person must keep a copy of the report for two years after the day on which it is made.

title.en: 8.13 (3) - The person must make the report available to an inspector within 15 days after the day on which the person receives a written request from the inspector.
title.fr: 8.13 (3) - FR_The person must make the report available to an inspector within 15 days after the day on which the person receives a written request from the inspector.

title.en: - Undeclared or Misdeclared Dangerous Goods Report
title.fr: - FR_Undeclared or Misdeclared Dangerous Goods Report

title.en: 8.14 - A person must make a report to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888-226-8832) or 613-996-6666, as soon as possible after discovering, at an aerodrome or air cargo facility or on board an aircraft, dangerous goods that are not accompanied by the documentation or dangerous goods marks set out for the dangerous goods in Parts 1 to 6 and 8 of the ICAO Technical Instructions.
title.fr: 8.14 - FR_A person must make a report to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888-226-8832) or 613-996-6666, as soon as possible after discovering, at an aerodrome or air cargo facility or on board an aircraft, dangerous goods that are not accompanied by the documentation or dangerous goods marks set out for the dangerous goods in Parts 1 to 6 and 8 of the ICAO Technical Instructions.

title.en: - Information To Be Included in an Undeclared or Misdeclared Dangerous Goods Report
title.fr: - FR_Information To Be Included in an Undeclared or Misdeclared Dangerous Goods Report

title.en: 8.15 - A report referred to in section 8.14 must include the following information:
title.fr: 8.15 - FR_A report referred to in section 8.14 must include the following information:

title.fr: 8.15 (a) - FR_the name and contact information of the person making the report;

title.fr: 8.15 (b) - FR_the name of the aircraft operator, aerodrome or air cargo facility;

title.en: 8.15 (c) - the names and contact information of the consignor and consignee;
title.fr: 8.15 (c) - FR_the names and contact information of the consignor and consignee;

title.en: 8.15 (d) - the date of the discovery of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.15 (d) - FR_the date of the discovery of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.15 (e) - the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.15 (e) - FR_the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.15 (f) - a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.15 (f) - FR_a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.15 (g) - the gross mass or capacity of the means of containment and, if applicable, the total number of means of containment; and
title.fr: 8.15 (g) - FR_the gross mass or capacity of the means of containment and, if applicable, the total number of means of containment; and

title.en: 8.15 (h) - a description of the route by which the dangerous goods were to be transported, including the names of any aerodromes along the route.
title.fr: 8.15 (h) - FR_a description of the route by which the dangerous goods were to be transported, including the names of any aerodromes along the route.

title.en: - Dangerous Goods Occurrence Report (ICAO)
title.fr: - FR_Dangerous Goods Occurrence Report (ICAO)

title.en: 8.15.1 - A person must make a dangerous goods occurrence report (ICAO) to the Minister within seven days after discovering, at an aerodrome or air cargo facility or on board an aircraft, dangerous goods that have been transported on board an aircraft without
title.fr: 8.15.1 - FR_A person must make a dangerous goods occurrence report (ICAO) to the Minister within seven days after discovering, at an aerodrome or air cargo facility or on board an aircraft, dangerous goods that have been transported on board an aircraft without

title.en: 8.15.1 (a) - being loaded, segregated or secured in accordance with Chapter 2 of Part 7 of the ICAO Technical Instructions; or
title.fr: 8.15.1 (a) - FR_being loaded, segregated or secured in accordance with Chapter 2 of Part 7 of the ICAO Technical Instructions; or

title.en: 8.15.1 (b) - the pilot-in-command having been informed in accordance with section 7;4.1 of the ICAO Technical Instructions.
title.fr: 8.15.1 (b) - FR_the pilot-in-command having been informed in accordance with section 7;4.1 of the ICAO Technical Instructions.

title.en: - Information To Be Included in a Dangerous Goods Occurrence Report (ICAO)
title.fr: - FR_Information To Be Included in a Dangerous Goods Occurrence Report (ICAO)

title.en: 8.15.2 - A dangerous goods occurrence report (ICAO) referred to in section 8.15.1 must be in writing and include the following information:
title.fr: 8.15.2 - FR_A dangerous goods occurrence report (ICAO) referred to in section 8.15.1 must be in writing and include the following information:

title.en: 8.15.2 (a) - the name and contact information of the person making the report;
title.fr: 8.15.2 (a) - FR_the name and contact information of the person making the report;

title.fr: 8.15.2 (b) - FR_the name of the aircraft operator, aerodrome or air cargo facility;

title.en: 8.15.2 (c) - the names and contact information of the consignor and consignee;
title.fr: 8.15.2 (c) - FR_the names and contact information of the consignor and consignee;

title.en: 8.15.2 (d) - the date of the discovery of the occurrence referred to in paragraph 8.15.1(a) or (b);
title.fr: 8.15.2 (d) - FR_the date of the discovery of the occurrence referred to in paragraph 8.15.1(a) or (b);

title.en: 8.15.2 (e) - the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.15.2 (e) - FR_the shipping name or UN number of the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.15.2 (f) - a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;
title.fr: 8.15.2 (f) - FR_a description of the means of containment containing the dangerous goods;

title.en: 8.15.2 (g) - the gross mass or capacity of the means of containment and, if applicable, the total number of means of containment;
title.fr: 8.15.2 (g) - FR_the gross mass or capacity of the means of containment and, if applicable, the total number of means of containment;

title.en: 8.15.2 (h) - a description of the route by which the dangerous goods were, or were to be, transported, including the names of any aerodromes along the route; and
title.fr: 8.15.2 (h) - FR_a description of the route by which the dangerous goods were, or were to be, transported, including the names of any aerodromes along the route; and

title.en: 8.15.2 (i) - a detailed description of the circumstances that led to the discovery of the occurrence referred to in paragraph 8.15.1(a) or (b), as the case may be.
title.fr: 8.15.2 (i) - FR_a detailed description of the circumstances that led to the discovery of the occurrence referred to in paragraph 8.15.1(a) or (b), as the case may be.

title.en: - Loss or Theft Report
title.fr: - FR_Loss or Theft Report

title.en: 8.16 (1) - A person who is required by subsection 18(3) of the Act to report the loss or theft of dangerous goods must, as soon as possible after the loss or theft, report it by telephone to the persons listed in subsection (3) if the lost or stolen dangerous goods are in excess of the quantity set out in subsection (2).
title.fr: 8.16 (1) - FR_A person who is required by subsection 18(3) of the Act to report the loss or theft of dangerous goods must, as soon as possible after the loss or theft, report it by telephone to the persons listed in subsection (3) if the lost or stolen dangerous goods are in excess of the quantity set out in subsection (2).

title.en: - Unlawful Interference Report
title.fr: - FR_Unlawful Interference Report

title.en: 8.18 (1) - If there has been unlawful interference with dangerous goods while they were being imported, offered for transport, handled or transported, the person who had the charge, management or control of the goods must, as soon as possible after the discovery of the unlawful interference, report it by telephone to the persons listed in subsection (2).

title.fr: 8.18 (2) (b) - FR_in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 1, Explosives, or referred to in paragraph 8.16(2)(a) or subparagraph 8.16(2)(b)(i) or (c)(i), a Natural Resources Canada inspector, at 613-995-5555; and

title.en: 8.18 (2) (c) - in the case of dangerous goods included in Class 7, Radioactive Materials, the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.

title.en: 8.20 - A person who is required under subsection 18(1) of the Act to report a release or anticipated release of dangerous goods in respect of which an approved ERAP is required under subsection 7(1) of the Act must, as soon as possible after the release or anticipated release, make an ERAP incident report by telephone to the person at the ERAP telephone number required to be included on the shipping document under paragraph 3.6(1)(b), if the dangerous goods are, or could be, in excess of the quantity set out in the following table:

title.fr: - FR_Information To Be Included in an ERAP Incident Report

title.en: 8.21 - An ERAP incident report referred to in section 8.20 must include the following information:
title.fr: 8.21 - FR_An ERAP incident report referred to in section 8.20 must include the following information:

title.en: 8.21 (d) - in the case of an anticipated release of dangerous goods, the date, time and geographic location of the incident that led to the anticipated release;

title.en: 8.21 (e) - the mode of transport used;

title.en: 8.21 (k) - an indication of whether a transfer of the dangerous goods to another means of containment is anticipated or required; and

title.en: 8.22 - Each time a person implements an approved ERAP to tier 1 or tier 2, the person must, as soon as possible, make an ERAP implementation report to CANUTEC, at 1-888-CANUTEC (1-888‑226‑8832) or 613‑996‑6666.

title.en: PART 9 - Road
title.fr: PART 9 - FR_Road

title.en: - Transporting Dangerous Goods from the United States into or through Canada
title.fr: - FR_Transporting Dangerous Goods from the United States into or through Canada

title.en: 9.1 (1) - Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by road vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of 49 CFR, if
title.fr: 9.1 (1) - FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by road vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of 49 CFR, if

title.en: 9.1 (1) (a) - the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (a) - FR_the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes

title.en: 9.1 (1) (a) (i) - when dangerous goods are transported to a place in Canada, the name and address of the place of business in Canada of the consignor,
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (a) (i) - FR_when dangerous goods are transported to a place in Canada, the name and address of the place of business in Canada of the consignor,

title.en: 9.1 (1) (a) (ii) - when dangerous goods are transported from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada, the name and the address of the place of business of each consignor, except that in this case the name and address may be shown on a separate document attached to the shipping document and is required only while that person is the consignor,
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_when dangerous goods are transported from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada, the name and the address of the place of business of each consignor, except that in this case the name and address may be shown on a separate document attached to the shipping document and is required only while that person is the consignor,

title.en: 9.1 (1) (a) (iii) - the classification in Schedule 1 or in the UN Recommendations, for dangerous goods that have the letter “D” assigned to them in column 1 of the table to section 172.101 of 49 CFR, except for dangerous goods with the shipping name “Consumer commodity”, and
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (a) (iii) - FR_the classification in Schedule 1 or in the UN Recommendations, for dangerous goods that have the letter “D” assigned to them in column 1 of the table to section 172.101 of 49 CFR, except for dangerous goods with the shipping name “Consumer commodity”, and

title.en: 9.1 (1) (a) (iv) - if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1);
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (a) (iv) - FR_if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1);

title.en: 9.1 (1) (b) - the person complies with the following sections in Part 3 (Documentation):
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (b) - FR_the person complies with the following sections in Part 3 (Documentation):

title.en: 9.1 (1) (b) (i) - section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (b) (i) - FR_section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,

title.en: 9.1 (1) (b) (ii) - section 3.7, Location of a shipping document: road, and
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_section 3.7, Location of a shipping document: road, and

title.en: 9.1 (1) (b) (iii) - section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation; and
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation; and

title.en: 9.1 (1) (c) - on or after August 31, 2008, the labels and placards displayed for dangerous goods included in Class 2.3 or Class 6.1 are the labels and placards required in these Regulations for the dangerous goods. The labels and placards may be displayed before August 31, 2008.
title.fr: 9.1 (1) (c) - FR_on or after August 31, 2008, the labels and placards displayed for dangerous goods included in Class 2.3 or Class 6.1 are the labels and placards required in these Regulations for the dangerous goods. The labels and placards may be displayed before August 31, 2008.

title.en: 9.1 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply to dangerous goods that
title.fr: 9.1 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply to dangerous goods that

title.en: 9.1 (2) (a) - are forbidden for transport by these Regulations;
title.fr: 9.1 (2) (a) - FR_are forbidden for transport by these Regulations;

title.en: 9.1 (2) (b) - are not regulated by 49 CFR but are regulated by these Regulations; or
title.fr: 9.1 (2) (b) - FR_are not regulated by 49 CFR but are regulated by these Regulations; or

title.en: 9.1 (2) (d) - are given dangerous goods safety mark or packaging exceptions in 49 CFR that are not permitted by these Regulations.
title.fr: 9.1 (2) (d) - FR_are given dangerous goods safety mark or packaging exceptions in 49 CFR that are not permitted by these Regulations.

title.en: 9.1 (3) - A person who handles or transports dangerous goods by road vehicle in accordance with an exemption issued under Subpart B of Part 107 of 49 CFR may do so from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada if the exemption number appears on the shipping document.
title.fr: 9.1 (3) - FR_A person who handles or transports dangerous goods by road vehicle in accordance with an exemption issued under Subpart B of Part 107 of 49 CFR may do so from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada if the exemption number appears on the shipping document.

title.en: 9.1 (4) - If there is a conflict between the requirements of Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or Part 5 (Means of Containment) and an exemption referred to in subsection (3), the exemption prevails to the extent of the conflict.
title.fr: 9.1 (4) - FR_If there is a conflict between the requirements of Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or Part 5 (Means of Containment) and an exemption referred to in subsection (3), the exemption prevails to the extent of the conflict.

title.en: - Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from an Aircraft, an Aerodrome or an Air Cargo Facility
title.fr: - FR_Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from an Aircraft, an Aerodrome or an Air Cargo Facility

title.en: 9.2 (1) - Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by aircraft, a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by road vehicle to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, and documentation requirements of the ICAO Technical Instructions, if
title.fr: 9.2 (1) - FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by aircraft, a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by road vehicle to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, and documentation requirements of the ICAO Technical Instructions, if

title.en: 9.2 (1) (a) - the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and
title.fr: 9.2 (1) (a) - FR_the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and

title.en: 9.2 (1) (b) - the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):
title.fr: 9.2 (1) (b) - FR_the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):

title.en: 9.2 (1) (b) (i) - section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,
title.fr: 9.2 (1) (b) (i) - FR_section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,

title.en: 9.2 (1) (b) (ii) - paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,
title.fr: 9.2 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,

title.en: 9.2 (1) (b) (iii) - section 3.7, Location of a shipping document: road, and
title.fr: 9.2 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_section 3.7, Location of a shipping document: road, and

title.en: 9.2 (1) (b) (iv) - section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.
title.fr: 9.2 (1) (b) (iv) - FR_section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.

title.en: 9.2 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the ICAO Technical Instructions but are regulated by these Regulations.
title.fr: 9.2 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the ICAO Technical Instructions but are regulated by these Regulations.

title.en: 9.2 (3) - When dangerous goods are transported to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility, by a road vehicle, the road vehicle, or any means of containment visible from outside the road vehicle, must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 9.2 (3) - FR_When dangerous goods are transported to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility, by a road vehicle, the road vehicle, or any means of containment visible from outside the road vehicle, must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: - Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from a Vessel, a Port Facility or a Marine Terminal
title.fr: - FR_Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from a Vessel, a Port Facility or a Marine Terminal

title.en: 9.3 (1) - Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by vessel, a person may handle or transport by road vehicle an international consignment of dangerous goods to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of the IMDG Code if
title.fr: 9.3 (1) - FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by vessel, a person may handle or transport by road vehicle an international consignment of dangerous goods to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of the IMDG Code if

title.en: 9.3 (1) (a) - the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and
title.fr: 9.3 (1) (a) - FR_the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and

title.en: 9.3 (1) (b) - the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):
title.fr: 9.3 (1) (b) - FR_the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):

title.en: 9.3 (1) (b) (i) - section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,
title.fr: 9.3 (1) (b) (i) - FR_section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,

title.en: 9.3 (1) (b) (ii) - paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,
title.fr: 9.3 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,

title.en: 9.3 (1) (b) (iii) - section 3.7, Location of a shipping document: road, and
title.fr: 9.3 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_section 3.7, Location of a shipping document: road, and

title.en: 9.3 (1) (b) (iv) - section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.
title.fr: 9.3 (1) (b) (iv) - FR_section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.

title.en: 9.3 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the IMDG Code but are regulated by these Regulations.
title.fr: 9.3 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the IMDG Code but are regulated by these Regulations.

title.en: 9.3 (3) - When dangerous goods are transported in a large means of containment to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal, the large means of containment must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or the IMDG Code.
title.fr: 9.3 (3) - FR_When dangerous goods are transported in a large means of containment to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal, the large means of containment must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or the IMDG Code.

title.en: - Reshipping in Canada
title.fr: - FR_Reshipping in Canada

title.en: 9.4 (1) - When a consignment of dangerous goods is transported from a place outside Canada to a place in Canada and is reshipped within Canada by road vehicle, the dangerous goods safety marks displayed in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code at the time of entry into Canada may continue to be displayed, except that the large means of containment containing the dangerous goods must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 9.4 (1) - FR_When a consignment of dangerous goods is transported from a place outside Canada to a place in Canada and is reshipped within Canada by road vehicle, the dangerous goods safety marks displayed in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code at the time of entry into Canada may continue to be displayed, except that the large means of containment containing the dangerous goods must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: 9.4 (2) - The shipping document that accompanies the dangerous goods must include a notation that the dangerous goods safety marks are in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code, if they differ from the ones required to be displayed by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 9.4 (2) - FR_The shipping document that accompanies the dangerous goods must include a notation that the dangerous goods safety marks are in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code, if they differ from the ones required to be displayed by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: - Maximum Net Explosives Quantity in a Road Vehicle
title.fr: - FR_Maximum Net Explosives Quantity in a Road Vehicle

title.en: 9.5 - The total net explosives quantity of all explosives that are transported together in a road vehicle must be less than or equal to the following limits:
title.fr: 9.5 - FR_The total net explosives quantity of all explosives that are transported together in a road vehicle must be less than or equal to the following limits:

title.en: 9.5 (a) - 25 kg if any of the explosives are UN0190, SAMPLES, EXPLOSIVE;
title.fr: 9.5 (a) - FR_25 kg if any of the explosives are UN0190, SAMPLES, EXPLOSIVE;

title.en: 9.5 (b) - 2 000 kg if any of the explosives are included in Class 1.1A; and
title.fr: 9.5 (b) - FR_2 000 kg if any of the explosives are included in Class 1.1A; and

title.en: PART 10 - Rail
title.fr: PART 10 - FR_Rail

title.en: - Transporting Dangerous Goods from the United States into or through Canada
title.fr: - FR_Transporting Dangerous Goods from the United States into or through Canada

title.en: 10.1 (1) - Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of 49 CFR if
title.fr: 10.1 (1) - FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of 49 CFR if

title.en: 10.1 (1) (a) - the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (a) - FR_the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes

title.en: 10.1 (1) (a) (i) - when dangerous goods are transported to a place in Canada, the name and address of the place of business in Canada of the consignor,
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (a) (i) - FR_when dangerous goods are transported to a place in Canada, the name and address of the place of business in Canada of the consignor,

title.en: 10.1 (1) (a) (ii) - when dangerous goods are transported from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada, the name and the address of the place of business of each consignor, except that in this case the name and address may be shown on a separate document attached to the shipping document and is required only while that person is the consignor,
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (a) (ii) - FR_when dangerous goods are transported from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada, the name and the address of the place of business of each consignor, except that in this case the name and address may be shown on a separate document attached to the shipping document and is required only while that person is the consignor,

title.en: 10.1 (1) (a) (iii) - the classification in Schedule 1 or in the UN Recommendations, for dangerous goods that have the letter “D” assigned to them in column 1 of the table to section 172.101 of 49 CFR, except for dangerous goods with the shipping name “Consumer commodity”, and
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (a) (iii) - FR_the classification in Schedule 1 or in the UN Recommendations, for dangerous goods that have the letter “D” assigned to them in column 1 of the table to section 172.101 of 49 CFR, except for dangerous goods with the shipping name “Consumer commodity”, and

title.en: 10.1 (1) (a) (iv) - if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1);
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (a) (iv) - FR_if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1);

title.en: 10.1 (1) (b) - the person complies with the following sections in Part 3 (Documentation):
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (b) - FR_the person complies with the following sections in Part 3 (Documentation):

title.en: 10.1 (1) (b) (i) - section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (b) (i) - FR_section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,

title.en: 10.1 (1) (b) (ii) - section 3.8, Location of a shipping document and consist: rail, and
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_section 3.8, Location of a shipping document and consist: rail, and

title.en: 10.1 (1) (b) (iii) - section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation, and
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation, and

title.en: 10.1 (1) (c) - on or after August 31, 2008, the labels and placards displayed for dangerous goods included in Class 2.3 or 6.1 are the labels and placards required in these Regulations for the dangerous goods. The labels or placards may be displayed before August 31, 2008.
title.fr: 10.1 (1) (c) - FR_on or after August 31, 2008, the labels and placards displayed for dangerous goods included in Class 2.3 or 6.1 are the labels and placards required in these Regulations for the dangerous goods. The labels or placards may be displayed before August 31, 2008.

title.en: 10.1 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply to dangerous goods that
title.fr: 10.1 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply to dangerous goods that

title.en: 10.1 (2) (a) - are forbidden for transport by these Regulations;
title.fr: 10.1 (2) (a) - FR_are forbidden for transport by these Regulations;

title.en: 10.1 (2) (b) - are not regulated by 49 CFR but are regulated by these Regulations; or
title.fr: 10.1 (2) (b) - FR_are not regulated by 49 CFR but are regulated by these Regulations; or

title.en: 10.1 (2) (d) - are given dangerous goods safety mark or packaging exceptions in 49 CFR that are not permitted by these Regulations.
title.fr: 10.1 (2) (d) - FR_are given dangerous goods safety mark or packaging exceptions in 49 CFR that are not permitted by these Regulations.

title.en: 10.1 (3) - A person who handles or transports dangerous goods by railway vehicle in accordance with an exemption issued under Subpart B of Part 107 of 49 CFR may do so from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada if the exemption number appears on the shipping document.
title.fr: 10.1 (3) - FR_A person who handles or transports dangerous goods by railway vehicle in accordance with an exemption issued under Subpart B of Part 107 of 49 CFR may do so from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada if the exemption number appears on the shipping document.

title.en: 10.1 (4) - If there is a conflict between the requirements of Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or Part 5 (Means of Containment) and an exemption referred to in subsection (3), the exemption prevails to the extent of the conflict.
title.fr: 10.1 (4) - FR_If there is a conflict between the requirements of Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or Part 5 (Means of Containment) and an exemption referred to in subsection (3), the exemption prevails to the extent of the conflict.

title.en: - Railway Vehicle Reciprocity
title.fr: - FR_Railway Vehicle Reciprocity

title.en: 10.1.1 - Despite the requirements of Part 5 (Means of Containment), a person may offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the requirements of Parts 172, 173, 174, 179 and 180 of 49 CFR, except by tank car if the goods are Class 3, Flammable Liquids that are referred to in section 10.5.6 of TP 14877.
title.fr: 10.1.1 - FR_Despite the requirements of Part 5 (Means of Containment), a person may offer for transport, handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle from a place in the United States to a place in Canada or from a place in the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada in accordance with the requirements of Parts 172, 173, 174, 179 and 180 of 49 CFR, except by tank car if the goods are Class 3, Flammable Liquids that are referred to in section 10.5.6 of TP 14877.

title.en: - Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from an Aircraft, an Aerodrome or an Air Cargo Facility
title.fr: - FR_Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from an Aircraft, an Aerodrome or an Air Cargo Facility

title.en: 10.2 (1) - Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by aircraft, a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling and documentation requirements of the ICAO Technical Instructions, if
title.fr: 10.2 (1) - FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by aircraft, a person may handle or transport dangerous goods by railway vehicle to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling and documentation requirements of the ICAO Technical Instructions, if

title.en: 10.2 (1) (a) - the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and
title.fr: 10.2 (1) (a) - FR_the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and

title.en: 10.2 (1) (b) - the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):
title.fr: 10.2 (1) (b) - FR_the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):

title.en: 10.2 (1) (b) (i) - section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,
title.fr: 10.2 (1) (b) (i) - FR_section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,

title.en: 10.2 (1) (b) (ii) - paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,
title.fr: 10.2 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,

title.en: 10.2 (1) (b) (iii) - section 3.8, Location of a shipping document and consist: rail, and
title.fr: 10.2 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_section 3.8, Location of a shipping document and consist: rail, and

title.en: 10.2 (1) (b) (iv) - section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.
title.fr: 10.2 (1) (b) (iv) - FR_section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.

title.en: 10.2 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the ICAO Technical Instructions but are regulated by these Regulations.
title.fr: 10.2 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the ICAO Technical Instructions but are regulated by these Regulations.

title.en: 10.2 (3) - When dangerous goods are transported to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility, by railway vehicle, the railway vehicle, or any means of containment visible from outside the railway vehicle must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 10.2 (3) - FR_When dangerous goods are transported to or from an aircraft, an aerodrome or an air cargo facility, by railway vehicle, the railway vehicle, or any means of containment visible from outside the railway vehicle must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: - Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from a Vessel, a Port Facility or a Marine Terminal
title.fr: - FR_Transporting Dangerous Goods to or from a Vessel, a Port Facility or a Marine Terminal

title.en: 10.3 (1) - Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by vessel, a person may handle an international consignment of dangerous goods or transport it by railway vehicle to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of the IMDG Code if
title.fr: 10.3 (1) - FR_Despite the requirements in Part 2 (Classification), Part 3 (Documentation), and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), if transport has been or is to be by vessel, a person may handle an international consignment of dangerous goods or transport it by railway vehicle to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal in accordance with the classification, marking, labelling, placarding and documentation requirements of the IMDG Code if

title.en: 10.3 (1) (a) - the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and
title.fr: 10.3 (1) (a) - FR_the information required on the shipping document is easy to identify, legible, in indelible print, in English or French and includes, if applicable, the information relating to the approved ERAP referred to in subsection 3.6(1); and

title.en: 10.3 (1) (b) - the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):
title.fr: 10.3 (1) (b) - FR_the person complies with the following provisions in Part 3 (Documentation):

title.en: 10.3 (1) (b) (i) - section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,
title.fr: 10.3 (1) (b) (i) - FR_section 3.2, Carrier responsibilities,

title.en: 10.3 (1) (b) (ii) - paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,
title.fr: 10.3 (1) (b) (ii) - FR_paragraph 3.5(1)(f) and subsection 3.5(2), concerning a 24-hour number on a shipping document,

title.en: 10.3 (1) (b) (iii) - section 3.8, Location of a shipping document and consist: rail, and
title.fr: 10.3 (1) (b) (iii) - FR_section 3.8, Location of a shipping document and consist: rail, and

title.en: 10.3 (1) (b) (iv) - section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.
title.fr: 10.3 (1) (b) (iv) - FR_section 3.10, Location of a shipping document: storage in the course of transportation.

title.en: 10.3 (2) - Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the IMDG Code but are regulated by these Regulations.
title.fr: 10.3 (2) - FR_Subsection (1) does not apply if these Regulations forbid the transport of the dangerous goods or if the dangerous goods are not regulated by the IMDG Code but are regulated by these Regulations.

title.en: 10.3 (3) - When dangerous goods are transported in a large means of containment to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal, the large means of containment must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or the IMDG Code.
title.fr: 10.3 (3) - FR_When dangerous goods are transported in a large means of containment to or from a vessel, a port facility or a marine terminal, the large means of containment must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) or the IMDG Code.

title.en: - Reshipping in Canada
title.fr: - FR_Reshipping in Canada

title.en: 10.4 (1) - When a consignment of dangerous goods is transported from a place outside Canada to a place in Canada and is reshipped within Canada by railway vehicle, the dangerous goods safety marks displayed in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code at the time of entry into Canada may continue to be displayed, except that the large means of containment containing the dangerous goods must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 10.4 (1) - FR_When a consignment of dangerous goods is transported from a place outside Canada to a place in Canada and is reshipped within Canada by railway vehicle, the dangerous goods safety marks displayed in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code at the time of entry into Canada may continue to be displayed, except that the large means of containment containing the dangerous goods must have placards displayed on it in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: 10.4 (2) - The shipping document that accompanies the dangerous goods must include a notation that the dangerous goods safety marks are in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code, if they differ from the ones required to be displayed by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 10.4 (2) - FR_The shipping document that accompanies the dangerous goods must include a notation that the dangerous goods safety marks are in accordance with 49 CFR, the ICAO Technical Instructions or the IMDG Code, if they differ from the ones required to be displayed by Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: - Location of Placarded Railway Vehicle in a Train
title.fr: - FR_Location of Placarded Railway Vehicle in a Train

title.en: 10.6 (1) - Unless it is likely to have a serious impact on train dynamics, a person must not, in a train, locate a railway vehicle that contains dangerous goods described in column 1 of the table to this subsection for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), next to a railway vehicle described in the same row in column 2.
title.fr: 10.6 (1) - FR_Unless it is likely to have a serious impact on train dynamics, a person must not, in a train, locate a railway vehicle that contains dangerous goods described in column 1 of the table to this subsection for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), next to a railway vehicle described in the same row in column 2.

title.en: 10.6 (2) - Dangerous goods that are being transported in railway vehicles in a train from the United States to Canada or from the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada may be located in the train in accordance with sections 174.84 and 174.85 of 49 CFR.
title.fr: 10.6 (2) - FR_Dangerous goods that are being transported in railway vehicles in a train from the United States to Canada or from the United States through Canada to a place outside Canada may be located in the train in accordance with sections 174.84 and 174.85 of 49 CFR.

title.en: - Coupling of Railway Vehicles
title.fr: - FR_Coupling of Railway Vehicles

title.en: 10.7 (1) - A person must not couple a railway vehicle with another railway vehicle at a relative coupling speed greater than 9.6 km/h (6 mph) if either of the railway vehicles that make contact on coupling contains dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).
title.fr: 10.7 (1) - FR_A person must not couple a railway vehicle with another railway vehicle at a relative coupling speed greater than 9.6 km/h (6 mph) if either of the railway vehicles that make contact on coupling contains dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks).

title.en: 10.7 (2) - Despite subsection (1), a person may couple a single railway vehicle moving under its own momentum at a relative coupling speed less than or equal to 12 km/h (7.5 mph) when the ambient temperature is above -25ºC.
title.fr: 10.7 (2) - FR_Despite subsection (1), a person may couple a single railway vehicle moving under its own momentum at a relative coupling speed less than or equal to 12 km/h (7.5 mph) when the ambient temperature is above -25ºC.

title.en: 10.7 (3) - If a person couples a tank car that contains dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), with another railway vehicle and the three conditions in any one of the four rows set out in the table to this subsection apply, the person must
title.fr: 10.7 (3) - FR_If a person couples a tank car that contains dangerous goods for which a placard is required to be displayed in accordance with Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), with another railway vehicle and the three conditions in any one of the four rows set out in the table to this subsection apply, the person must

title.en: 10.7 (3) (a) - visually inspect the underframe assembly and coupling and cushioning components of the tank car to ensure their integrity before the tank car is moved more than 2 km from the place where the coupling occurred; and
title.fr: 10.7 (3) (a) - FR_visually inspect the underframe assembly and coupling and cushioning components of the tank car to ensure their integrity before the tank car is moved more than 2 km from the place where the coupling occurred; and

title.en: 10.7 (3) (b) - report, in writing, to the owner of the tank car within 10 days after the coupling and include a copy of the text of this section and information about any damage that compromises the integrity of the underframe assembly or draft gear of the tank car discovered as a result of the inspection.
title.fr: 10.7 (3) (b) - FR_report, in writing, to the owner of the tank car within 10 days after the coupling and include a copy of the text of this section and information about any damage that compromises the integrity of the underframe assembly or draft gear of the tank car discovered as a result of the inspection.

title.en: 10.7 (4) - The owner of a tank car who receives the report must not use the tank car or permit the tank car to be used to transport dangerous goods, other than the dangerous goods that were contained in the tank car at the time of the coupling, until the tank car undergoes
title.fr: 10.7 (4) - FR_The owner of a tank car who receives the report must not use the tank car or permit the tank car to be used to transport dangerous goods, other than the dangerous goods that were contained in the tank car at the time of the coupling, until the tank car undergoes

title.en: 10.7 (4) (a) - a visual inspection and a structural integrity inspection in accordance with clause 9.5.6(a) and clause 9.5.7 of TP 14877; and
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (a) - FR_a visual inspection and a structural integrity inspection in accordance with clause 9.5.6(a) and clause 9.5.7 of TP 14877; and

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) - for a tank car equipped with a stub sill, a stub sill inspection covering at least the following areas:
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) - FR_for a tank car equipped with a stub sill, a stub sill inspection covering at least the following areas:

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (i) - the termination of the stub sill reinforcement pad closest to the mid-point of the tank car and associated welds for a 30-cm length from that point back towards the other end of the pad,
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (i) - FR_the termination of the stub sill reinforcement pad closest to the mid-point of the tank car and associated welds for a 30-cm length from that point back towards the other end of the pad,

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) - all welds
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) - FR_all welds

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) (A) - connecting the head brace to the stub sill,
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) (A) - FR_connecting the head brace to the stub sill,

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) (B) - between the head brace and the head reinforcement pad, and
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) (B) - FR_between the head brace and the head reinforcement pad, and

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) (C) - between the tank and the head reinforcement pad and, if the head reinforcement pad is connected to the stub sill reinforcement pad, 2.5 cm past that connection towards the centre of the tank,
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (ii) (C) - FR_between the tank and the head reinforcement pad and, if the head reinforcement pad is connected to the stub sill reinforcement pad, 2.5 cm past that connection towards the centre of the tank,

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (iii) - all metal of the stub sill assembly, other than welds, from the body bolster to the coupler, and
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (iii) - FR_all metal of the stub sill assembly, other than welds, from the body bolster to the coupler, and

title.en: 10.7 (4) (b) (iv) - the draft gear pocket.
title.fr: 10.7 (4) (b) (iv) - FR_the draft gear pocket.

title.en: 10.7 (5) - This section does not apply if either the tank car or the other railway vehicle that was coupled is equipped with a cushioning device designed for a displacement of 15 cm (6 in.) or more in compression and capable of limiting the maximum coupler force to 4 448 kilonewtons (1,000,000 lbf) when impacted at 16.1 km/h (10 mph) by a railway vehicle having a gross mass of 99 790 kg (220,000 lb).
title.fr: 10.7 (5) - FR_This section does not apply if either the tank car or the other railway vehicle that was coupled is equipped with a cushioning device designed for a displacement of 15 cm (6 in.) or more in compression and capable of limiting the maximum coupler force to 4 448 kilonewtons (1,000,000 lbf) when impacted at 16.1 km/h (10 mph) by a railway vehicle having a gross mass of 99 790 kg (220,000 lb).

title.en: - Reporting
title.fr: - FR_Reporting

title.en: 10.8 - A consignor shall, on reasonable notice given by the Minister, provide the Minister with the following information:
title.fr: 10.8 - FR_A consignor shall, on reasonable notice given by the Minister, provide the Minister with the following information:

title.en: 10.8 (a) - the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for TC117R tank cars;
title.fr: 10.8 (a) - FR_the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for TC117R tank cars;

title.en: 10.8 (b) - the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for TC117P tank cars;
title.fr: 10.8 (b) - FR_the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for TC117P tank cars;

title.en: 10.8 (c) - the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor and used for importing, offering for transport or handling dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for Class 111 tank cars; and
title.fr: 10.8 (c) - FR_the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor and used for importing, offering for transport or handling dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for Class 111 tank cars; and

title.en: 10.8 (d) - the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor and used for importing, offering for transport or handling dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for enhanced Class 111 tank cars.
title.fr: 10.8 (d) - FR_the number of tank cars owned or leased by the consignor and used for importing, offering for transport or handling dangerous goods included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, that meet the requirements of TP 14877 for enhanced Class 111 tank cars.

title.en: PART 11 - Marine
title.fr: PART 11 - FR_Marine

title.en: - Marine Transport — IMDG Code
title.fr: - FR_Marine Transport — IMDG Code

title.en: 11.1 (1) - A person who imports, offers for transport, handles or transports dangerous goods by vessel must comply with the IMDG Code if the dangerous goods are in transport between
title.fr: 11.1 (1) - FR_A person who imports, offers for transport, handles or transports dangerous goods by vessel must comply with the IMDG Code if the dangerous goods are in transport between

title.en: 11.3 - A person who transports dangerous goods by vessel from one country through Canada to another country must comply with the IMDG Code and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) of these Regulations.

title.en: 12.1 (2) - A person who handles, offers for transport or transports dangerous goods by aircraft within Canada must do so in accordance with the ICAO Technical Instructions and the provisions of these Regulations referred to in subsection (1).

title.en: 12.1 (3) - Despite subsection (2), a person may handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods by aircraft within Canada in accordance with the requirements of sections 12.4 to 12.17.
title.fr: 12.1 (3) - FR_Despite subsection (2), a person may handle, offer for transport or transport dangerous goods by aircraft within Canada in accordance with the requirements of sections 12.4 to 12.17.

title.en: 12.2 - The shipping document for dangerous goods transported by aircraft must
title.fr: 12.2 - FR_The shipping document for dangerous goods transported by aircraft must

title.en: 12.2 (a) - be completed in accordance with Chapter 4, Documentation, of Part 5, Shipper’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions; and
title.fr: 12.2 (a) - FR_be completed in accordance with Chapter 4, Documentation, of Part 5, Shipper’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions; and

title.en: 12.2 (b) - show the information required for the dangerous goods by the ICAO Technical Instructions on a document that has, on the left and right margins, red hatchings that are oriented to the right or to the left.
title.fr: 12.2 (b) - FR_show the information required for the dangerous goods by the ICAO Technical Instructions on a document that has, on the left and right margins, red hatchings that are oriented to the right or to the left.

title.en: 12.3 - Despite subsection 12.1(1), the following text replaces subsection 4.1.6 in section 4.1, Information to the pilot-in-command, of Chapter 4, Provision of information, of Part 7, Operator’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions:
title.fr: 12.3 - FR_Despite subsection 12.1(1), the following text replaces subsection 4.1.6 in section 4.1, Information to the pilot-in-command, of Chapter 4, Provision of information, of Part 7, Operator’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions:

title.en: 12.3 - “4.1.6 The information provided to the pilot-in-command must be presented on a dedicated form and not by means of air waybills, dangerous goods transport documents, invoices, etc.”

title.en: - Explosives, Class 1.4S
title.fr: - FR_Explosives, Class 1.4S

title.en: 12.4 (1) - A person may handle, offer for transport or transport by aircraft within Canada explosives included in Class 1.4S if
title.fr: 12.4 (1) - FR_A person may handle, offer for transport or transport by aircraft within Canada explosives included in Class 1.4S if

title.en: 12.4 (1) (a) - the person complies with the ICAO Technical Instructions, other than Part 4, Packing Instructions, and sections 1.1 to 1.3 of Chapter 1, General, sections 2.1 to 2.4.1 and 2.4.3 to 2.5 of Chapter 2, Marking, Chapter 3, Labelling, and Chapter 4, Documentation, of Part 5, Shipper’s Responsibilities;
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (a) - FR_the person complies with the ICAO Technical Instructions, other than Part 4, Packing Instructions, and sections 1.1 to 1.3 of Chapter 1, General, sections 2.1 to 2.4.1 and 2.4.3 to 2.5 of Chapter 2, Marking, Chapter 3, Labelling, and Chapter 4, Documentation, of Part 5, Shipper’s Responsibilities;

title.en: 12.4 (1) (b) - when the consignor is not the air carrier, the consignor notifies the air carrier of the presence of the explosives before offering them for transport;
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (b) - FR_when the consignor is not the air carrier, the consignor notifies the air carrier of the presence of the explosives before offering them for transport;

title.en: 12.4 (1) (c) - the explosives are one or more of the explosives set out in the following table:
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (c) - FR_the explosives are one or more of the explosives set out in the following table:

title.en: 12.4 (1) (d) - the calibre of cartridges with the UN number UN0012 or UN0014 is
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (d) - FR_the calibre of cartridges with the UN number UN0012 or UN0014 is

title.en: 12.4 (1) (d) (i) - less than 50 calibres, in the case of cartridges for rifles or pistols, or
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (d) (i) - FR_less than 50 calibres, in the case of cartridges for rifles or pistols, or

title.en: 12.4 (1) (d) (ii) - greater than or equal to 8 gauge, in the case of cartridges for shotguns;
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (d) (ii) - FR_greater than or equal to 8 gauge, in the case of cartridges for shotguns;

title.en: 12.4 (1) (e) - the gross mass of each means of containment is less than or equal to 25 kg;
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (e) - FR_the gross mass of each means of containment is less than or equal to 25 kg;

title.en: 12.4 (1) (f) - the explosives are placed in an inner means of containment that is a box, in metal or plastic clips or in partitions that fit snugly in an outer means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (f) - FR_the explosives are placed in an inner means of containment that is a box, in metal or plastic clips or in partitions that fit snugly in an outer means of containment that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety;

title.en: 12.4 (1) (g) - the primers are protected from accidental initiation; and
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (g) - FR_the primers are protected from accidental initiation; and

title.en: 12.4 (1) (h) - each of the outer means of containment is marked with the gross mass in kilograms and the words “Explosives — Excepted” or “Explosifs — Exceptés”, in letters at least 25 mm high and in a colour that contrasts with the background colour of the means of containment.
title.fr: 12.4 (1) (h) - FR_each of the outer means of containment is marked with the gross mass in kilograms and the words “Explosives — Excepted” or “Explosifs — Exceptés”, in letters at least 25 mm high and in a colour that contrasts with the background colour of the means of containment.

title.en: 12.4 (2) - Despite the restrictions that apply to item 14 of Table 8-1 to Chapter 1, Provisions for dangerous goods carried by passengers or crew, of Part 8, Provisions Concerning Passengers and Crew, of the ICAO Technical Instructions, ammunition, or ammunition loaded in a firearm, with the UN number and shipping name UN0012, CARTRIDGES FOR WEAPONS, INERT PROJECTILE or UN0012, CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS or UN0014, CARTRIDGES FOR WEAPONS, BLANK or UN0014, CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS, BLANK or UN0014, CARTRIDGES FOR TOOLS, BLANK, may be transported on board an aircraft by a peace officer as defined in section 3 of the Canadian Aviation Security Regulations, 2012 or by an in-flight security officer.
title.fr: 12.4 (2) - FR_Despite the restrictions that apply to item 14 of Table 8-1 to Chapter 1, Provisions for dangerous goods carried by passengers or crew, of Part 8, Provisions Concerning Passengers and Crew, of the ICAO Technical Instructions, ammunition, or ammunition loaded in a firearm, with the UN number and shipping name UN0012, CARTRIDGES FOR WEAPONS, INERT PROJECTILE or UN0012, CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS or UN0014, CARTRIDGES FOR WEAPONS, BLANK or UN0014, CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS, BLANK or UN0014, CARTRIDGES FOR TOOLS, BLANK, may be transported on board an aircraft by a peace officer as defined in section 3 of the Canadian Aviation Security Regulations, 2012 or by an in-flight security officer.

title.en: 12.5 (2) - The consignor of the explosives must
title.fr: 12.5 (2) - FR_The consignor of the explosives must

title.en: 12.5 (2) (a) - notify the air carrier, in writing, of the shipping name, UN number, primary class and compatibility group of the explosives at least 48 hours before the explosives are loaded on the aircraft;
title.fr: 12.5 (2) (a) - FR_notify the air carrier, in writing, of the shipping name, UN number, primary class and compatibility group of the explosives at least 48 hours before the explosives are loaded on the aircraft;

title.en: 12.5 (2) (b) - keep a copy of the notification to the air carrier for two years after the date the notification is sent to the air carrier; and
title.fr: 12.5 (2) (b) - FR_keep a copy of the notification to the air carrier for two years after the date the notification is sent to the air carrier; and

title.en: 12.5 (2) (c) - notify the consignee at least 24 hours before the explosives are transported of the expected time of transport unless the consignor and the air carrier agree that the air carrier will notify the consignee of the expected time of transport when the air carrier gives the consignor written agreement to transport the explosives.
title.fr: 12.5 (2) (c) - FR_notify the consignee at least 24 hours before the explosives are transported of the expected time of transport unless the consignor and the air carrier agree that the air carrier will notify the consignee of the expected time of transport when the air carrier gives the consignor written agreement to transport the explosives.

title.en: 12.5 (3) - The air carrier must, at least 24 hours before transporting the explosives,
title.fr: 12.5 (3) - FR_The air carrier must, at least 24 hours before transporting the explosives,

title.en: 12.5 (3) (a) - give the consignor written agreement to transport the explosives and keep a copy of this agreement for two years after the date the notification referred to in paragraph (2)(a) is sent to the consignor; and
title.fr: 12.5 (3) (a) - FR_give the consignor written agreement to transport the explosives and keep a copy of this agreement for two years after the date the notification referred to in paragraph (2)(a) is sent to the consignor; and

title.en: 12.5 (3) (b) - notify each aerodrome operator listed on the flight plan of the intended time of departure, arrival and technical stops, if any.
title.fr: 12.5 (3) (b) - FR_notify each aerodrome operator listed on the flight plan of the intended time of departure, arrival and technical stops, if any.

title.en: 12.5 (4) - The notification referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and the agreement referred to in paragraph (3)(a) are valid for any subsequent transport of the explosives for two years beginning on the date that the notification and the agreement were made unless any of the information required in them changes.
title.fr: 12.5 (4) - FR_The notification referred to in paragraph (2)(a) and the agreement referred to in paragraph (3)(a) are valid for any subsequent transport of the explosives for two years beginning on the date that the notification and the agreement were made unless any of the information required in them changes.

title.en: 12.8 (1) (b) - when the dangerous goods are liquid,
title.fr: 12.8 (1) (b) - FR_when the dangerous goods are liquid,

title.fr: 12.8 (1) (b) (i) - FR_the quantity for Class 3, Packing Group II, is less than or equal to

title.en: 12.8 (1) (b) (i) (A) - 1 L in a metal inner means of containment, except for UN1263, PAINT or PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, in which case the quantity may be less than or equal to 5 L, or
title.fr: 12.8 (1) (b) (i) (A) - FR_1 L in a metal inner means of containment, except for UN1263, PAINT or PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, in which case the quantity may be less than or equal to 5 L, or

title.en: 12.8 (1) (b) (i) (B) - 500 mL in a glass, earthenware or plastic inner means of containment, and
title.fr: 12.8 (1) (b) (i) (B) - FR_500 mL in a glass, earthenware or plastic inner means of containment, and

title.fr: 12.8 (1) (b) (ii) (A) - FR_5 L in a metal inner means of containment, or
