title.fr: 12.8 (1) (b) (ii) (B) - FR_500 mL in a glass, earthenware or plastic inner means of containment; and

title.en: 12.8 (1) (c) - when the dangerous goods are solid, the quantity is less than or equal to 5 kg in an inner means of containment.
title.fr: 12.8 (1) (c) - FR_when the dangerous goods are solid, the quantity is less than or equal to 5 kg in an inner means of containment.

title.en: 12.8 (2) - The person who offers for transport the dangerous goods must, on each small means of containment that contains the dangerous goods,
title.fr: 12.8 (2) - FR_The person who offers for transport the dangerous goods must, on each small means of containment that contains the dangerous goods,

title.en: 12.8 (2) (a) - mark the words “Air Transport, 12.8, Consumer commodity” or “Transport aérien, 12.8, produit de consommation” in letters at least 25 mm high and in a colour that contrasts with the background colour of the means of containment; and
title.fr: 12.8 (2) (a) - FR_mark the words “Air Transport, 12.8, Consumer commodity” or “Transport aérien, 12.8, produit de consommation” in letters at least 25 mm high and in a colour that contrasts with the background colour of the means of containment; and

title.en: 12.8 (2) (b) - for liquids, except flammable liquids in a quantity less than or equal to 120 mL, display on two opposite sides of the means of containment a package orientation label illustrated in Figure 5-29 of Chapter 3, Labelling, of Part 5, Shipper’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions.
title.fr: 12.8 (2) (b) - FR_for liquids, except flammable liquids in a quantity less than or equal to 120 mL, display on two opposite sides of the means of containment a package orientation label illustrated in Figure 5-29 of Chapter 3, Labelling, of Part 5, Shipper’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions.

title.en: 12.8 (3) - Despite subsection (2), the dangerous goods safety marks that are required by that subsection to be marked or displayed on a small means of containment are not required to be marked or displayed on a small means of containment that is inside another small means of containment if the other small means of containment is not opened during loading or unloading or while the dangerous goods are in transport.
title.fr: 12.8 (3) - FR_Despite subsection (2), the dangerous goods safety marks that are required by that subsection to be marked or displayed on a small means of containment are not required to be marked or displayed on a small means of containment that is inside another small means of containment if the other small means of containment is not opened during loading or unloading or while the dangerous goods are in transport.

title.en: 12.9 (3) - When the Class 3, Flammable Liquids, referred to in subsection (2) are
title.fr: 12.9 (3) - FR_When the Class 3, Flammable Liquids, referred to in subsection (2) are

title.en: 12.9 (3) (a) - contained in a small means of containment that is a drum, the drum must be securely closed and marked with one of the following manufacturer’s permanent markings when the drum has a capacity greater than 25 L and less than or equal to 230 L: TC, CTC, DOT, ICC 5A, 5B, 5C, 17C, 17E, TC-34, CTC-34, DOT-34, UN 1A1, UN 1B1, UN 1H1 or UN 6HA; or
title.fr: 12.9 (3) (a) - FR_contained in a small means of containment that is a drum, the drum must be securely closed and marked with one of the following manufacturer’s permanent markings when the drum has a capacity greater than 25 L and less than or equal to 230 L: TC, CTC, DOT, ICC 5A, 5B, 5C, 17C, 17E, TC-34, CTC-34, DOT-34, UN 1A1, UN 1B1, UN 1H1 or UN 6HA; or

title.en: 12.9 (3) (b) - contained in a small means of containment that is not a drum, the small means of containment must be securely closed and
title.fr: 12.9 (3) (b) - FR_contained in a small means of containment that is not a drum, the small means of containment must be securely closed and

title.en: 12.9 (3) (b) (i) - marked with one of the following manufacturer’s permanent markings when the small means of containment has a capacity less than or equal to 25 L: UN 3A1, UN 3H1, UL or ULC,
title.fr: 12.9 (3) (b) (i) - FR_marked with one of the following manufacturer’s permanent markings when the small means of containment has a capacity less than or equal to 25 L: UN 3A1, UN 3H1, UL or ULC,

title.en: 12.9 (3) (b) (ii) - marked in accordance with ASTM F 852, or
title.fr: 12.9 (3) (b) (ii) - FR_marked in accordance with ASTM F 852, or

title.en: 12.9 (3) (b) (iii) - an unmarked steel marine fuel tank of a type that is used to supply fuel for an outboard motor.
title.fr: 12.9 (3) (b) (iii) - FR_an unmarked steel marine fuel tank of a type that is used to supply fuel for an outboard motor.

title.en: 12.9 (4) - The following means of containment may be reused to transport the Class 3, Flammable Liquids, referred to in subsection (2):
title.fr: 12.9 (4) - FR_The following means of containment may be reused to transport the Class 3, Flammable Liquids, referred to in subsection (2):

title.en: 12.9 (4) (a) - a steel drum or jerrican, if
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (a) - FR_a steel drum or jerrican, if

title.en: 12.9 (4) (a) (i) - neither the body nor the top or bottom of the drum or jerrican is damaged by wear, scoring, dents or corrosion to the extent that the integrity of the drum or the jerrican is compromised,
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (a) (i) - FR_neither the body nor the top or bottom of the drum or jerrican is damaged by wear, scoring, dents or corrosion to the extent that the integrity of the drum or the jerrican is compromised,

title.en: 12.9 (4) (a) (ii) - any worn or leaking bung caps or seals are replaced,
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (a) (ii) - FR_any worn or leaking bung caps or seals are replaced,

title.en: 12.9 (4) (a) (iii) - the top and bottom of the drum are not bulging, and
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (a) (iii) - FR_the top and bottom of the drum are not bulging, and

title.en: 12.9 (4) (a) (iv) - sufficient ullage is left to ensure that no leakage or permanent distortion will occur as a result of expansion of the liquid caused by any temperature that may be experienced during transport;
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (a) (iv) - FR_sufficient ullage is left to ensure that no leakage or permanent distortion will occur as a result of expansion of the liquid caused by any temperature that may be experienced during transport;

title.en: 12.9 (4) (b) - a plastic drum or jerrican, if
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (b) - FR_a plastic drum or jerrican, if

title.en: 12.9 (4) (b) (i) - the body of the drum or jerrican is not faded, discoloured, gouged, cracked or distorted to the extent that the integrity of the drum or jerrican is compromised,
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (b) (i) - FR_the body of the drum or jerrican is not faded, discoloured, gouged, cracked or distorted to the extent that the integrity of the drum or jerrican is compromised,

title.en: 12.9 (4) (b) (ii) - the closure flange and bung of the drum show no evidence of cross-threading or thread wear,
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (b) (ii) - FR_the closure flange and bung of the drum show no evidence of cross-threading or thread wear,

title.en: 12.9 (4) (b) (iii) - any worn gaskets are replaced, and
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (b) (iii) - FR_any worn gaskets are replaced, and

title.en: 12.9 (4) (b) (iv) - when the capacity of the jerrican exceeds 25 L, it is used only for flammable liquids that are included in Packing Group III and that have a flash point greater than 37.8°C; and
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (b) (iv) - FR_when the capacity of the jerrican exceeds 25 L, it is used only for flammable liquids that are included in Packing Group III and that have a flash point greater than 37.8°C; and

title.en: 12.9 (4) (c) - a steel marine fuel tank, if
title.fr: 12.9 (4) (c) - FR_a steel marine fuel tank, if

title.en: 12.9 (13) - An air carrier must ensure that

title.en: 12.9 (13) (a) - the pilot-in-command of an aircraft, other than a helicopter, transporting dangerous goods

title.en: 12.9 (13) (a) (i) - briefs flight attendants, if any, on the nature and location of the dangerous goods that are in any compartment to which the flight attendants have access, and

title.en: 12.9 (13) (a) (ii) - completes and signs a manifest, journey log or flight record, or any other type of document designated for this purpose in the Operator’s Manual, that includes the shipping name, UN number, class and quantity of dangerous goods transported that day;
title.fr: 12.9 (13) (a) (ii) - FR_completes and signs a manifest, journey log or flight record, or any other type of document designated for this purpose in the Operator’s Manual, that includes the shipping name, UN number, class and quantity of dangerous goods transported that day;

title.en: 12.9 (13) (b) - at the end of each day, the pilot-in-command of a helicopter transporting dangerous goods completes and signs a manifest, journey log or flight record or any other type of document designated for this purpose in the Operator’s Manual, that includes the words “Dangerous Goods Transported” or “Marchandises dangereuses transportées”;
title.fr: 12.9 (13) (b) - FR_at the end of each day, the pilot-in-command of a helicopter transporting dangerous goods completes and signs a manifest, journey log or flight record or any other type of document designated for this purpose in the Operator’s Manual, that includes the words “Dangerous Goods Transported” or “Marchandises dangereuses transportées”;

title.en: 12.9 (13) (c) - the air carrier keeps the documents referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) for 12 months after the date on which the dangerous goods are no longer in transport; and
title.fr: 12.9 (13) (c) - FR_the air carrier keeps the documents referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) for 12 months after the date on which the dangerous goods are no longer in transport; and

title.fr: 12.9 (13) (d) - FR_when an in-flight emergency occurs and circumstances permit, the pilot-in-command

title.en: 12.9 (13) (d) (ii) - for an external load of dangerous goods suspended from a helicopter, notifies the appropriate air traffic services unit that dangerous goods are in the external load.

title.en: - Geological Core Samples
title.fr: - FR_Geological Core Samples

title.en: 12.11 - A person may handle, offer for transport or transport by aircraft within Canada dangerous goods that are contained in geological core samples less than or equal to 100 mm in diameter if
title.fr: 12.11 - FR_A person may handle, offer for transport or transport by aircraft within Canada dangerous goods that are contained in geological core samples less than or equal to 100 mm in diameter if

title.en: 12.11 (a) - when the consignor is not the air carrier, the consignor notifies the air carrier of the presence of the core samples before offering them for transport;
title.fr: 12.11 (a) - FR_when the consignor is not the air carrier, the consignor notifies the air carrier of the presence of the core samples before offering them for transport;

title.en: 12.11 (b) - the core samples are transported in wooden core sample boxes that are wrapped in a sealed plastic or polyethylene bag or in a means of containment that is equally leak-proof;

title.en: 12.11 (c) - the core samples as well as the means of containment are secured to prevent movement during transport; and
title.fr: 12.11 (c) - FR_the core samples as well as the means of containment are secured to prevent movement during transport; and

title.en: 12.11 (d) - where the core samples contain radioactive material, they are contained in a means of containment in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
title.fr: 12.11 (d) - FR_where the core samples contain radioactive material, they are contained in a means of containment in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

title.fr: 12.12 (2) - FR_The dangerous goods must be contained in a means of containment that is

title.fr: 12.12 (2) (a) - FR_a tank, a container or an apparatus that is an integral part of the aircraft or that is attached to the aircraft in accordance with the Certificate of Airworthiness issued under the Canadian Aviation Regulations;

title.fr: 12.12 (2) (b) - FR_a cylindrical collapsible rubber drum that is transported in or suspended from an aircraft and that is constructed, tested, inspected and used in accordance with MIL-D-23119G;

title.fr: 12.12 (2) (c) - FR_a collapsible fabric tank that is transported suspended from a helicopter and that is constructed of material and seamed in accordance with MIL-T-52983G; or

title.fr: 12.12 (2) (d) - FR_a small means of containment designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no accidental release of the dangerous goods that could endanger public safety.

title.fr: 12.12 (3) - FR_The air carrier must ensure that

title.fr: 12.12 (3) (f) - FR_when an in-flight emergency occurs and circumstances permit, the pilot-in-command complies with section 4.3, Information to be provided by the pilot-in-command in case of in-flight emergency, of Chapter 4, Provision of information, of Part 7, Operator’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions; and

title.en: 12.12 (3) (g) - the person who loads and secures or directly supervises the loading and securing of dangerous goods on board the aircraft
title.fr: 12.12 (3) (g) - FR_the person who loads and secures or directly supervises the loading and securing of dangerous goods on board the aircraft

title.en: 12.12 (3) (g) (i) - complies with section 3.1, Inspection for damage or leakage, of Chapter 3, Inspection and decontamination, of Part 7, Operator’s Responsibilities, of the ICAO Technical Instructions, and

title.en: PART 13 - Protective Direction
title.fr: PART 13 - FR_Protective Direction

title.en: - Effective Date and Expiry of a Protective Direction
title.fr: - FR_Effective Date and Expiry of a Protective Direction

title.en: 13.1 (1) - A protective direction takes effect on the date on which it is signed by the Minister or a designated person or at a later date indicated in the protective direction. However, after the effective date of the protective direction, any non-compliance with it must not be enforced against a person unless the person has received the original, signed protective direction or an electronic copy of it, or reasonable steps have been taken to make the person aware of the protective direction.
title.fr: 13.1 (1) - FR_A protective direction takes effect on the date on which it is signed by the Minister or a designated person or at a later date indicated in the protective direction. However, after the effective date of the protective direction, any non-compliance with it must not be enforced against a person unless the person has received the original, signed protective direction or an electronic copy of it, or reasonable steps have been taken to make the person aware of the protective direction.

title.en: 13.1 (2) - A protective direction expires on the expiry date specified in it. If no expiry date is specified in the protective direction, it expires 12 months after the date on which it is signed.
title.fr: 13.1 (2) - FR_A protective direction expires on the expiry date specified in it. If no expiry date is specified in the protective direction, it expires 12 months after the date on which it is signed.

title.en: - Requesting a Review of a Protective Direction
title.fr: - FR_Requesting a Review of a Protective Direction

title.en: 13.2 (1) - A person may request a review of a protective direction at any time after it is signed.
title.fr: 13.2 (1) - FR_A person may request a review of a protective direction at any time after it is signed.

title.en: 13.2 (2) - The request must be made, in writing, to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:
title.fr: 13.2 (2) - FR_The request must be made, in writing, to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:

title.en: 13.2 (2) (a) - the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;
title.fr: 13.2 (2) (a) - FR_the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;

title.en: 13.2 (2) (b) - the result the person expects from the review; and
title.fr: 13.2 (2) (b) - FR_the result the person expects from the review; and

title.en: 13.2 (2) (c) - all the information necessary to support the request for the review.
title.fr: 13.2 (2) (c) - FR_all the information necessary to support the request for the review.

title.en: - Notification of a Decision
title.fr: - FR_Notification of a Decision

title.en: 13.3 - The Minister or a designated person must notify, in writing, the person who made the request for a review of the decision and the reasons for the decision.
title.fr: 13.3 - FR_The Minister or a designated person must notify, in writing, the person who made the request for a review of the decision and the reasons for the decision.

title.fr: PART 14 - FR_Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: - Applying for a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety
title.fr: - FR_Applying for a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: 14.1 - A person must apply to the Minister or a designated person in writing for a permit for equivalent level of safety and must include the following information:
title.fr: 14.1 - FR_A person must apply to the Minister or a designated person in writing for a permit for equivalent level of safety and must include the following information:

title.en: 14.1 (a) - if the applicant is an individual, the name of the individual;
title.fr: 14.1 (a) - FR_if the applicant is an individual, the name of the individual;

title.en: 14.1 (b) - if the applicant is a company or an association, the name of the company or association and each association member, as the names appear in letters patent, articles of incorporation or any other document that shows the legal identity of the company or the association and each association member;
title.fr: 14.1 (b) - FR_if the applicant is a company or an association, the name of the company or association and each association member, as the names appear in letters patent, articles of incorporation or any other document that shows the legal identity of the company or the association and each association member;

title.en: 14.1 (c) - the address of the place of business of the applicant;
title.fr: 14.1 (c) - FR_the address of the place of business of the applicant;

title.en: 14.1 (d) - the telephone number, including the area code, and, if applicable, the electronic mailing address and the facsimile number of the applicant;
title.fr: 14.1 (d) - FR_the telephone number, including the area code, and, if applicable, the electronic mailing address and the facsimile number of the applicant;

title.en: 14.1 (e) - if a person submits an application on behalf of a company or an association, the person’s name and position and the telephone number, including the area code, and address of the person’s place of business;
title.fr: 14.1 (e) - FR_if a person submits an application on behalf of a company or an association, the person’s name and position and the telephone number, including the area code, and address of the person’s place of business;

title.en: 14.1 (f) - the classification of the dangerous goods and, if the dangerous goods are in a solution or mixture, the composition and percentage (specified by volume, mass or net explosives quantity) of each chemical;
title.fr: 14.1 (f) - FR_the classification of the dangerous goods and, if the dangerous goods are in a solution or mixture, the composition and percentage (specified by volume, mass or net explosives quantity) of each chemical;

title.en: 14.1 (g) - the method of packaging the dangerous goods, including a description of the means of containment and the quantity of dangerous goods in each means of containment;
title.fr: 14.1 (g) - FR_the method of packaging the dangerous goods, including a description of the means of containment and the quantity of dangerous goods in each means of containment;

title.en: 14.1 (h) - whether the permit for equivalent level of safety is requested for transport by road vehicle, railway vehicle, aircraft or vessel;
title.fr: 14.1 (h) - FR_whether the permit for equivalent level of safety is requested for transport by road vehicle, railway vehicle, aircraft or vessel;

title.en: 14.1 (i) - a description of the proposal for a permit for equivalent level of safety, including
title.fr: 14.1 (i) - FR_a description of the proposal for a permit for equivalent level of safety, including

title.en: 14.1 (i) (i) - the requirements of the Act or these Regulations that the applicant proposes not to comply with,
title.fr: 14.1 (i) (i) - FR_the requirements of the Act or these Regulations that the applicant proposes not to comply with,

title.en: 14.1 (i) (ii) - the manner in which the activity will be carried out and how that manner will provide a level of safety at least equivalent to that provided by compliance with the Act and these Regulations, and
title.fr: 14.1 (i) (ii) - FR_the manner in which the activity will be carried out and how that manner will provide a level of safety at least equivalent to that provided by compliance with the Act and these Regulations, and

title.en: 14.1 (i) (iii) - drawings, plans, calculations, procedures, test results and any other information necessary to support the proposal;
title.fr: 14.1 (i) (iii) - FR_drawings, plans, calculations, procedures, test results and any other information necessary to support the proposal;

title.en: 14.1 (j) - the length of time or the schedule of activities for which the permit for equivalent level of safety is requested; and
title.fr: 14.1 (j) - FR_the length of time or the schedule of activities for which the permit for equivalent level of safety is requested; and

title.en: 14.1 (k) - the name, position and business telephone number, including the area code, of the person who can be contacted regarding the application for a permit for equivalent level of safety and who is authorized by the applicant to speak on the applicant’s behalf.
title.fr: 14.1 (k) - FR_the name, position and business telephone number, including the area code, of the person who can be contacted regarding the application for a permit for equivalent level of safety and who is authorized by the applicant to speak on the applicant’s behalf.

title.en: - Issuance or Refusal of a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety
title.fr: - FR_Issuance or Refusal of a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: 14.2 - If an application for a permit for equivalent level of safety is refused, the Minister or a designated person must notify the applicant, in writing, of the refusal and the reasons for the refusal.
title.fr: 14.2 - FR_If an application for a permit for equivalent level of safety is refused, the Minister or a designated person must notify the applicant, in writing, of the refusal and the reasons for the refusal.

title.en: - Applying for Renewal of a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety
title.fr: - FR_Applying for Renewal of a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: 14.3 - A person must apply to the Minister or a designated person in writing to renew a permit for equivalent level of safety and must include the following information:
title.fr: 14.3 - FR_A person must apply to the Minister or a designated person in writing to renew a permit for equivalent level of safety and must include the following information:

title.en: 14.3 (a) - if the applicant is an individual, the name of the individual;
title.fr: 14.3 (a) - FR_if the applicant is an individual, the name of the individual;

title.en: 14.3 (b) - if the applicant is a company or an association, the name of the company or association and each association member, as the names appear in letters patent, articles of incorporation or any other document that shows the legal identity of the company or the association and each association member;
title.fr: 14.3 (b) - FR_if the applicant is a company or an association, the name of the company or association and each association member, as the names appear in letters patent, articles of incorporation or any other document that shows the legal identity of the company or the association and each association member;

title.en: 14.3 (c) - the address of the place of business of the applicant;
title.fr: 14.3 (c) - FR_the address of the place of business of the applicant;

title.en: 14.3 (d) - the telephone number, including the area code, and, if applicable, the electronic mailing address and the facsimile number of the applicant;
title.fr: 14.3 (d) - FR_the telephone number, including the area code, and, if applicable, the electronic mailing address and the facsimile number of the applicant;

title.en: 14.3 (e) - if a person submits an application on behalf of a company or an association, the person’s name and position and the telephone number, including the area code, and address of the person’s place of business;
title.fr: 14.3 (e) - FR_if a person submits an application on behalf of a company or an association, the person’s name and position and the telephone number, including the area code, and address of the person’s place of business;

title.en: 14.3 (f) - certification that the information provided in the original application in accordance with paragraphs 14.1(f) to (i) is still applicable and complete;
title.fr: 14.3 (f) - FR_certification that the information provided in the original application in accordance with paragraphs 14.1(f) to (i) is still applicable and complete;

title.en: 14.3 (g) - the length of time or the schedule of activities for which the renewal is requested; and
title.fr: 14.3 (g) - FR_the length of time or the schedule of activities for which the renewal is requested; and

title.en: 14.3 (h) - the name, position and business telephone number, including the area code, of the person who can be contacted regarding the permit for equivalent level of safety and who is authorized by the applicant to speak on the applicant’s behalf.
title.fr: 14.3 (h) - FR_the name, position and business telephone number, including the area code, of the person who can be contacted regarding the permit for equivalent level of safety and who is authorized by the applicant to speak on the applicant’s behalf.

title.en: - Issuance or Refusal of a Renewal of a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety
title.fr: - FR_Issuance or Refusal of a Renewal of a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: 14.4 (1) - The Minister or a designated person may renew a permit for equivalent level of safety if the Minister or designated person is satisfied, on the basis of the information available and the information submitted with the application for a renewal, that the activity authorized by the permit for equivalent level of safety will provide a level of safety at least equivalent to that provided by compliance with the Act and these Regulations.
title.fr: 14.4 (1) - FR_The Minister or a designated person may renew a permit for equivalent level of safety if the Minister or designated person is satisfied, on the basis of the information available and the information submitted with the application for a renewal, that the activity authorized by the permit for equivalent level of safety will provide a level of safety at least equivalent to that provided by compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

title.en: 14.4 (2) - If an application for a renewal is refused, the Minister or a designated person must notify the applicant, in writing, of the refusal and the reasons for the refusal.
title.fr: 14.4 (2) - FR_If an application for a renewal is refused, the Minister or a designated person must notify the applicant, in writing, of the refusal and the reasons for the refusal.

title.en: - Revoking a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety
title.fr: - FR_Revoking a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: 14.5 - The Minister or designated person must notify a person, in writing, of the revocation of a permit for equivalent level of safety under subsection 31(6) of the Act and the reasons for the revocation.
title.fr: 14.5 - FR_The Minister or designated person must notify a person, in writing, of the revocation of a permit for equivalent level of safety under subsection 31(6) of the Act and the reasons for the revocation.

title.en: - Requesting a Review of a Decision to Refuse or Revoke a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety
title.fr: - FR_Requesting a Review of a Decision to Refuse or Revoke a Permit for Equivalent Level of Safety

title.en: 14.6 (1) - A person may request a review of a decision to refuse or revoke a permit for equivalent level of safety within 30 days after receiving notification of the decision.
title.fr: 14.6 (1) - FR_A person may request a review of a decision to refuse or revoke a permit for equivalent level of safety within 30 days after receiving notification of the decision.

title.en: 14.6 (2) - The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:
title.fr: 14.6 (2) - FR_The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:

title.en: 14.6 (2) (a) - the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;
title.fr: 14.6 (2) (a) - FR_the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;

title.en: 14.6 (2) (b) - the reasons why the decision should be reversed; and
title.fr: 14.6 (2) (b) - FR_the reasons why the decision should be reversed; and

title.en: 14.6 (2) (c) - all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.
title.fr: 14.6 (2) (c) - FR_all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.

title.en: - Processing a Request for a Review
title.fr: - FR_Processing a Request for a Review

title.en: 14.7 - The Minister or, in the case of a refusal or revocation by a designated person, the Director General may issue a permit for equivalent level of safety that was refused or reissue a revoked permit if the Minister or Director General is satisfied, on the basis of the information available and the information submitted with the request for review, that the activity authorized by the permit will provide a level of safety at least equivalent to that provided by compliance with the Act and these Regulations.
title.fr: 14.7 - FR_The Minister or, in the case of a refusal or revocation by a designated person, the Director General may issue a permit for equivalent level of safety that was refused or reissue a revoked permit if the Minister or Director General is satisfied, on the basis of the information available and the information submitted with the request for review, that the activity authorized by the permit will provide a level of safety at least equivalent to that provided by compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

title.en: - Notification of a Decision
title.fr: - FR_Notification of a Decision

title.en: 14.8 - The Minister or the Director General must notify, in writing, the person who made the request for a review of the decision and the reasons for the decision.
title.fr: 14.8 - FR_The Minister or the Director General must notify, in writing, the person who made the request for a review of the decision and the reasons for the decision.

title.en: PART 15 - Court Order
title.fr: PART 15 - FR_Court Order

title.en: - Payment of Money for Research
title.fr: - FR_Payment of Money for Research

title.en: 15.1 - A person who is subject to a court order that requires payment of an amount of money under paragraph 34(1)(d) of the Act to be used to conduct programs of research must
title.fr: 15.1 - FR_A person who is subject to a court order that requires payment of an amount of money under paragraph 34(1)(d) of the Act to be used to conduct programs of research must

title.en: 15.1 (a) - provide a summary of the order, in writing, to the Director General within 30 days after the order is made; and
title.fr: 15.1 (a) - FR_provide a summary of the order, in writing, to the Director General within 30 days after the order is made; and

title.en: 15.1 (b) - give to the Director General the amount in the form of a certified cheque, money order or bank draft, payable to the Receiver General for Canada, within the period established by the court or, if no period is established, within 90 days after the order is made.
title.fr: 15.1 (b) - FR_give to the Director General the amount in the form of a certified cheque, money order or bank draft, payable to the Receiver General for Canada, within the period established by the court or, if no period is established, within 90 days after the order is made.

title.en: PART 16 - Inspectors
title.fr: PART 16 - FR_Inspectors

title.en: - Certificate of Designation
title.fr: - FR_Certificate of Designation

title.en: 16.1 - A certificate of designation issued to an inspector under subsection 10(2) of the Act must be in the following form:
title.fr: 16.1 - FR_A certificate of designation issued to an inspector under subsection 10(2) of the Act must be in the following form:

title.en: - Inspection Certificate
title.fr: - FR_Inspection Certificate

title.en: 16.2 - An inspection certificate provided under subsection 11(1) of the Act when an inspector opens anything for inspection or takes a sample of anything that is sealed or closed up must be in the following form:
title.fr: 16.2 - FR_An inspection certificate provided under subsection 11(1) of the Act when an inspector opens anything for inspection or takes a sample of anything that is sealed or closed up must be in the following form:

title.en: - Detention of Dangerous Goods or Means of Containment
title.fr: - FR_Detention of Dangerous Goods or Means of Containment

title.en: 16.3 (1) - When an inspector detains dangerous goods or a means of containment under subsection 17(1) or (2) of the Act, the inspector must deliver a Detention Notice in the form following this section to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment at the time they are detained.
title.fr: 16.3 (1) - FR_When an inspector detains dangerous goods or a means of containment under subsection 17(1) or (2) of the Act, the inspector must deliver a Detention Notice in the form following this section to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment at the time they are detained.

title.en: 16.3 (2) - The inspector must sign and date the Notice.
title.fr: 16.3 (2) - FR_The inspector must sign and date the Notice.

title.en: 16.3 (3) - The detention takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the detention must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.
title.fr: 16.3 (3) - FR_The detention takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the detention must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.

title.en: 16.3 (4) - The detention expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.
title.fr: 16.3 (4) - FR_The detention expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.

title.en: 16.3 (5) - A person may request a review of the detention at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:
title.fr: 16.3 (5) - FR_A person may request a review of the detention at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or of the means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:

title.en: 16.3 (5) (a) - the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;
title.fr: 16.3 (5) (a) - FR_the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;

title.en: 16.3 (5) (b) - a copy of the Notice;
title.fr: 16.3 (5) (b) - FR_a copy of the Notice;

title.en: 16.3 (5) (c) - the reasons why the detention should be revoked; and
title.fr: 16.3 (5) (c) - FR_the reasons why the detention should be revoked; and

title.en: 16.3 (5) (d) - all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.
title.fr: 16.3 (5) (d) - FR_all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.

title.en: 16.3 (6) - The Minister or the Director General must notify the person, in writing, of the decision made and the reasons for the decision.
title.fr: 16.3 (6) - FR_The Minister or the Director General must notify the person, in writing, of the decision made and the reasons for the decision.

title.en: - Direction to Remedy Non-compliance
title.fr: - FR_Direction to Remedy Non-compliance

title.en: 16.4 (1) - When an inspector directs a person, under subsection 17(3) of the Act, to take necessary measures to remedy non-compliance with the Act and these Regulations, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction to Remedy Non-compliance in the form following this section.
title.fr: 16.4 (1) - FR_When an inspector directs a person, under subsection 17(3) of the Act, to take necessary measures to remedy non-compliance with the Act and these Regulations, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction to Remedy Non-compliance in the form following this section.

title.en: 16.4 (2) - The inspector must sign and date the Notice.
title.fr: 16.4 (2) - FR_The inspector must sign and date the Notice.

title.en: 16.4 (3) - The Notice must also be signed and dated by one of the following designated persons before it is delivered to the person directed by the inspector to take the necessary measures: the Director, Compliance and Response, the Chief, Response Operations, or the Chief, Enforcement, of the Transport Dangerous Goods Directorate, Department of Transport.
title.fr: 16.4 (3) - FR_The Notice must also be signed and dated by one of the following designated persons before it is delivered to the person directed by the inspector to take the necessary measures: the Director, Compliance and Response, the Chief, Response Operations, or the Chief, Enforcement, of the Transport Dangerous Goods Directorate, Department of Transport.

title.en: 16.4 (4) - The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated in accordance with subsections (2) and (3). However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.
title.fr: 16.4 (4) - FR_The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated in accordance with subsections (2) and (3). However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.

title.en: 16.4 (5) - The direction expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.
title.fr: 16.4 (5) - FR_The direction expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.

title.en: 16.4 (6) - A person may request a review of the direction at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:
title.fr: 16.4 (6) - FR_A person may request a review of the direction at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:

title.en: 16.4 (6) (a) - the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;
title.fr: 16.4 (6) (a) - FR_the name and address of the place of business of the person requesting the review;

title.en: 16.4 (6) (b) - a copy of the Notice;
title.fr: 16.4 (6) (b) - FR_a copy of the Notice;

title.en: 16.4 (6) (c) - the reasons why the direction should be revoked; and
title.fr: 16.4 (6) (c) - FR_the reasons why the direction should be revoked; and

title.en: 16.4 (6) (d) - all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.
title.fr: 16.4 (6) (d) - FR_all of the information necessary to support the request for the review.

title.en: 16.4 (7) - The Minister or the Director General must notify the person, in writing, of the decision made and the reasons for the decision.
title.fr: 16.4 (7) - FR_The Minister or the Director General must notify the person, in writing, of the decision made and the reasons for the decision.

title.en: - Direction Not to Import or to Return to Place of Origin
title.fr: - FR_Direction Not to Import or to Return to Place of Origin

title.en: 16.5 (1) - When an inspector directs, under subsection 17(4) of the Act, a person who has charge, management or control of dangerous goods or means of containment that the dangerous goods or means of containment not be imported into Canada or, if they are already in Canada, that they be returned to their place of origin, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction Not to Import or to Return to Place of Origin in the form following this section.
title.fr: 16.5 (1) - FR_When an inspector directs, under subsection 17(4) of the Act, a person who has charge, management or control of dangerous goods or means of containment that the dangerous goods or means of containment not be imported into Canada or, if they are already in Canada, that they be returned to their place of origin, the inspector must deliver to that person a Notice of Direction Not to Import or to Return to Place of Origin in the form following this section.

title.en: 16.5 (2) - The inspector must sign and date the Notice.
title.fr: 16.5 (2) - FR_The inspector must sign and date the Notice.

title.en: 16.5 (3) - The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.
title.fr: 16.5 (3) - FR_The direction takes effect when the Notice is signed and dated by the inspector. However, any non-compliance with the direction must not be enforced against a person until the person has received the Notice or a copy of it or a reasonable attempt has been made to give the person the Notice or a copy of it.

title.en: 16.5 (4) - The direction expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.
title.fr: 16.5 (4) - FR_The direction expires 12 months after the day on which it takes effect, but it may be revoked earlier, in writing, by an inspector.

title.en: 16.5 (5) - A person may request a review of the direction at any time after it takes effect and the Notice is delivered to the person who has charge, management or control of the dangerous goods or means of containment. The request must be made in writing to the Minister or the Director General and must include the following information:
